original: 'di na 'dug pa nges sel 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di na 'dug pa nges sel 'gyur //
translated: It would dispel darkness here and there.🔽But if a lamp illuminates itself and others, then the darkness that is in contact with it would be dispelled.

original: ci ste mar me phrad pa nyid du yang mun pa sel bar byed na ni de ltar na 'jig rten kun na gnas pa'i mun pa dag kyang mar me 'di na 'dug pa des bsal bar 'gyur te /🔽ma phrad pa 'dra ba las la la ni sel bar byed la /
analyzed: ci ste mar me phrad pa nyid du yang mun pa sel bar byed na ni de ltar na 'jig rten kun na gnas pa'i mun pa dag kyang mar me 'di na 'dug pa des bsal bar 'gyur te / ma phrad pa 'dra ba las la la ni sel bar byed la /
translated: But if it is similar in not being in contact with some, it would illuminate some and not illuminate others.

original: la la ni sel bar mi byed pa de la khyad par ci yod //
analyzed: la la ni sel bar mi byed pa de la khyad par ci yod //
translated: What is the difference between those that are similar in not being in contact?

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: mar me rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
analyzed: mar me rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
translated: If a lamp illuminates itself and others,

original: gal te snang bar byed gyur na //
analyzed: gal te snang bar byed gyur na //
translated: then without a doubt

original: mun pa'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //🔽sgrib par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
analyzed: mun pa'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos // sgrib par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
translated: darkness would obscure itself and others.🔽Here a lamp is the antidote to darkness. Therefore, if a lamp illuminates itself and others,

original: 'di na mar me ni mun pa'i gnyen por gnas pa yin pas des na gal te mar mes rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag snang par byed par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di na mar me ni mun pa'i gnyen por gnas pa yin pas des na gal te mar mes rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag snang par byed par gyur na /
translated: then without a doubt darkness would obscure itself and others.

original: mun pas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par thal bar 'gyur pa 'di la the tshom med pa zhig na mun pas ni rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par mi byed do //
analyzed: mun pas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par thal bar 'gyur pa 'di la the tshom med pa zhig na mun pas ni rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par mi byed do //
translated: Darkness would also obscure itself and others, there is no doubt about that. But darkness does not obscure itself or others.

original: gal te sgrib par byed na ni gzhan bzhin du mun pa nyid kyang mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgrib par byed na ni gzhan bzhin du mun pa nyid kyang mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did obscure, then like the other, darkness itself would not be apprehended.

original: mun pa mi dmigs na ni dngos po rnams rtag tu snang bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: mun pa mi dmigs na ni dngos po rnams rtag tu snang bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If darkness is not apprehended, then things would always be illuminated.

original: dngos po rnams rtag tu mi snang bas de'i phyir mun pas ni rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po rnams rtag tu mi snang bas de'i phyir mun pas ni rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag sgrib par mi byed do //
translated: But things are not always illuminated, therefore darkness does not obscure itself or others.🔽If that were so, then like darkness, a lamp would not illuminate itself and others.

original: de lta yin na mun pa'i gnyen por mar mes kyang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag snang @190b bar mi byed pas de la mar me bzhin du skye bas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag kyang skyed par byed do //🔽zhes gang smras pa de rigs pas ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na mun pa'i gnyen por mar mes kyang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag snang @190b bar mi byed pas de la mar me bzhin du skye bas kyang rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag kyang skyed par byed do //🔽zhes gang smras pa de rigs pas ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that arising causes the generation of itself and others.

original: yang gzhan yang /🔽gal te skye bas rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed na skyes pas sam /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / gal te skye bas rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed na skyes pas sam /
translated: Moreover:🔽If arising causes the generation of itself, does it cause the generation of itself

original: ma skyes pa zhig gis skyed par skyed grang na /
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhig gis skyed par skyed grang na /
translated: when it has arisen or when it has not arisen?

original: gnyi gas kyang mi 'thad do //🔽ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi gas kyang mi 'thad do // ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Both are untenable.🔽Why?

original: skye ba 'di ni ma skyes pas //
analyzed: skye ba 'di ni ma skyes pas //
translated: How could this non-arisen

original: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar skyed //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar skyed //
translated: arising cause the generation of itself?

original: skye ba 'di ma skyes shing med pas rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar skyed par byed /
analyzed: skye ba 'di ma skyes shing med pas rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar skyed par byed /
translated: How could this non-arisen and non-existent arising cause the generation of itself?

original: yang na 'di ma skyes shing med pa'i bdag nyid su zhig gis skyed par byed /
analyzed: yang na 'di ma skyes shing med pa'i bdag nyid su zhig gis skyed par byed /
translated: Or, what person causes the generation of itself, which is non-arisen and non-existent?

original: ci ste med pas kyang bdag nyid med pa skyes na ni ri bong gi rvas kyang bdag nyid skyed par byed pa zhig na skyed par mi byed do /
analyzed: ci ste med pas kyang bdag nyid med pa skyes na ni ri bong gi rvas kyang bdag nyid skyed par byed pa zhig na skyed par mi byed do /
translated: But if that which is non-existent causes the generation of that which is non-existent, then the horn of a rabbit would cause the generation of itself, but it does not cause the generation of itself.

original: de lta bas na skye ba ma skyes pas bdag nyid skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba ma skyes pas bdag nyid skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, arising that is non-arisen does not cause the generation of itself.

original: de la 'di snyam du skye ba skyes pas bdag nyid skyed par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du skye ba skyes pas bdag nyid skyed par sems na /
translated: But if you think that arising that has arisen causes the generation of itself,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: ci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
analyzed: ci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
translated: But if it generates itself when arisen,

original: skyes na ci zhig bskyed du yod //
analyzed: skyes na ci zhig bskyed du yod //
translated: what arisen thing is generated?

original: gal te skye ba skyes pa nyid yin na skye ba skyes pas bdag nyid skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gal te skye ba skyes pa nyid yin na skye ba skyes pas bdag nyid skyed par byed do //
translated: If arising itself is arisen, then it is tenable to say that arising generates itself.

original: zhes bya ba 'thad pa'i don med pa 'di ci'i phyir byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'thad pa'i don med pa 'di ci'i phyir byed de /
translated: But why would one do this, since it is meaningless?

original: skyes zin pa la yang skye bas ci bya /
analyzed: skyes zin pa la yang skye bas ci bya /
translated: And what would arising do for that which has already arisen?

original: de ltar na re zhig skyes pas bdag nyid skyed par mi byed do //🔽skye bas gzhan skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig skyes pas bdag nyid skyed par mi byed do // skye bas gzhan skyed par byed do //
translated: Thus, first of all, arising does not generate itself.

original: zhes gang smras pa de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: But if you say that arising generates another, that is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar gal te skye bas gzhan skyed par byed na skye bas bskyed par bya ba gzhan de skyes pa'am ma skyes pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te skye bas gzhan skyed par byed na skye bas bskyed par bya ba gzhan de skyes pa'am ma skyes pa'am /
translated: In this regard, if arising generates another, does it generate that other which is arisen, or that which is not arisen, or that which is in the process of arising?

original: skye bzhin pa zhig skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa zhig skyed par byed grang na /
translated: But it does not generate that which is arisen,

original: de la / skyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa //🔽ji lta bur yang skyed mi byed //
analyzed: de la / skyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa // ji lta bur yang skyed mi byed //
translated: nor that which is not arisen,🔽nor that which is in the process of arising.

original: skye ba ni ji ltar yang skyed par mi 'thad do ;
analyzed: skye ba ni ji ltar yang skyed par mi 'thad do ;
translated: How could arising generate that which is arisen?

original: / ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed la /
analyzed: / ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed la /
translated: Nor does it cause the generation of that which is not yet arisen.

original: skye bzhin pa yang skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yang skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Nor does it cause the generation of that which is in the process of arising.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?🔽It is explained:

original: bshad pa / song dang ma song bgom pa yis //
analyzed: bshad pa / song dang ma song bgom pa yis //
translated: By that which has been gone over, that over which one is going,🔽and that over which one is to go,

original: de dag rnam par bshad pa yin //🔽ji ltar song ba la 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: de dag rnam par bshad pa yin // ji ltar song ba la 'gro ba med de /
translated: they are explained.

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba 'das zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba 'das zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as there is no going on that which has been gone over because the action of going has already passed,

original: zhes bya ba de bzhin du skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed de skye ba'i bya ba 'das zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de bzhin du skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed de skye ba'i bya ba 'das zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in the same way, that which has arisen does not cause the generation of itself because the action of arising has already passed.

original: skyes pa la yang skye ba'i bya ba med de /
analyzed: skyes pa la yang skye ba'i bya ba med de /
translated: Nor is there the action of arising on that which has arisen.

original: ci ste yang skyes par 'gyur na ni nam yang mi skyed par mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ci ste yang skyes par 'gyur na ni nam yang mi skyed par mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But if that which has arisen were to arise again, it would never not be arising. Therefore, that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir skyes ba skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes ba skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Hence, that which has arisen does not cause the generation of itself.

original: ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed de /
translated: Nor does that which is in the process of arising cause the generation of itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //🔽med @191a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na // med @191a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: ma skyes pa la gang skyed par 'gyur ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: ma skyes pa la gang skyed par 'gyur ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What is there to arise that is not yet arisen?

original: ci ste med kyang skyed par 'gyur na ni ri bong gi rva yang skyed par 'gyur ba zhig na skyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste med kyang skyed par 'gyur na ni ri bong gi rva yang skyed par 'gyur ba zhig na skyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But it does not generate it.

original: de lta bas na skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed do //🔽de ni skye bzhin pa yang skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: de lta bas na skyes pa yang skyed par mi byed do // de ni skye bzhin pa yang skyed par mi byed de /
translated: Therefore, that which has arisen does not generate itself.

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa ma gtogs par skye bzhin pa med pa'i phyir dang / skye ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /🔽gang dang ldan pas skye bzhin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dang / gang dang ldan pas skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa ma gtogs par skye bzhin pa med pa'i phyir dang / skye ba gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te / gang dang ldan pas skye bzhin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dang / gang dang ldan pas skyed par byed do //
translated: That which is in the process of arising also does not generate itself because that which is in the process of arising does not exist apart from that which has arisen and that which has not yet arisen, and because it is illogical that that which is in the process of arising generates itself.🔽That which is in the process of arising is that which is called “in the process of arising” because it possesses arising.

original: zhes brjod par /
analyzed: zhes brjod par /
translated: That which is called “generating” is that which generates because it possesses arising.

original: yang gzhan yang /🔽'di la skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi cung zad ni skyes cung zad ni ma skyes pa'am /🔽yang na de las gzhan pa skyes pa'am /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / 'di la skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi cung zad ni skyes cung zad ni ma skyes pa'am / yang na de las gzhan pa skyes pa'am /
translated: Moreover,🔽here that which is in the process of arising is that which has arisen in part and that which has not arisen in part, or that which is other than that.

original: ma skyes pa zhig yin gang na /
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhig yin gang na /
translated: Or that which is in the process of arising is that which has arisen or that which has not yet arisen.

original: de la gal te skyes pa dang ma skyes pa de skye bas skyed par byed na re zhig de'i gang cung zad skyed pa de ni skye ba des bskyed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de la gal te skyes pa dang ma skyes pa de skye bas skyed par byed na re zhig de'i gang cung zad skyed pa de ni skye ba des bskyed pa ma yin la /
translated: If that which has arisen and that which has not arisen are generated by arising, then first, that which is being generated is not generated by that arising.

original: skyes pa de skye bzhin pa ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de skyes na skye bzhin pa ma yin zhing skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skyes pa de skye bzhin pa ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na / de skyes na skye bzhin pa ma yin zhing skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do //
translated: That which has arisen is not being generated. Why is it so?

original: zhes kyang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes kyang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that when it has arisen, it is not being generated, and that which is being generated is generated.

original: gal te cung zad skyes pa de skye ba med pa kho nar skyes na ni /
analyzed: gal te cung zad skyes pa de skye ba med pa kho nar skyes na ni /
translated: If that which has arisen is generated without arising,

original: de'i lhag ma yang de bzhin du skye ba med pa kho nar skye bar 'gyur bar nges so //
analyzed: de'i lhag ma yang de bzhin du skye ba med pa kho nar skye bar 'gyur bar nges so //
translated: then it is certain that the remainder also would be generated without arising.

original: yang na de'i gang cung zad ni skye ba med pa kho nar skyes la cung zad ni skye bas skyed par byed pa la khyad par ci yod pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: yang na de'i gang cung zad ni skye ba med pa kho nar skyes la cung zad ni skye bas skyed par byed pa la khyad par ci yod pa brjod dgos so //
translated: Or else, one must explain what the difference is between that which is being generated without arising and that which is being generated by arising.

original: ci ste de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de yang skye ba kho nas bskyed na ni de lta na ma skyes pa skye bas skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: ci ste de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de yang skye ba kho nas bskyed na ni de lta na ma skyes pa skye bas skyed par byed kyi /
translated: But if that which is born by that generates it, then in that case, that which is not born generates it,

original: skye bzhin pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: but that which is in the process of being born does not generate it.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de ni skye bas skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: de'i gang cung zad skyes pa de ni skye bas skyed par mi byed de /
translated: that which is born by that does not generate it,

original: skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been born.

original: des na de'i lhag ma ma skyes pa gang zhig yin pa de skye bas skyed par byed do //
analyzed: des na de'i lhag ma ma skyes pa gang zhig yin pa de skye bas skyed par byed do //
translated: Therefore, that which is its remainder, that which is not born, is generated by that which is born.

original: zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, it would be like that.

original: de la skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de nyams par gyur to //
analyzed: de la skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de nyams par gyur to //
translated: But that which is in the process of being born generates it, as you have said, is refuted.

original: ci ste de'i cung zad skyes pa de yang skyed par byed na ni de la skye ba gnyis kyis byas pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste de'i cung zad skyes pa de yang skyed par byed na ni de la skye ba gnyis kyis byas pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if that which is born by that generates it, then it would have a distinction made by two births, but it does not.

original: skyes zin pa de la ni yang skyed pa'i phyir bya ba 'ga' yang rtsom par mi byed pas de'i phyir de ni yang skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: skyes zin pa de la ni yang skyed pa'i phyir bya ba 'ga' yang rtsom par mi byed pas de'i phyir de ni yang skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Since it does not undertake any activity whatsoever in order to generate that which has already arisen, therefore it does not generate that which has already arisen.

original: de lta bas na skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Thus, it is said that “that which is in the process of arising generates that which is in the process of arising.”

original: zhes bya ba de ni snying po med pa la blos snying por @191b bzung par zad de gyi na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni snying po med pa la blos snying por @191b bzung par zad de gyi na'o //
translated: But this is just the mind grasping at the core of what is essenceless.

original: smras pa / bum pa la sogs pa skye ba dag kyang dmigs shing /
analyzed: smras pa / bum pa la sogs pa skye ba dag kyang dmigs shing /
translated: Objection: But since things such as pots are observed arising,

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i don du bya ba dag la 'jug pa yang snang bas de'i phyir skye ba yod na skye ba la brten cing skye ba la ltos nas skye bzhin pa skyed do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i don du bya ba dag la 'jug pa yang snang bas de'i phyir skye ba yod na skye ba la brten cing skye ba la ltos nas skye bzhin pa skyed do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: and since it is seen that they engage in the activity of a pot, therefore, if arising exists, it is said that that which is in the process of arising generates that which is in the process of arising in dependence on and in reliance on arising.🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gang tshe skye ba yod pas ni //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang tshe skye ba yod pas ni //
translated: When arising exists,

original: skye bzhin 'di 'byung med pa'i tshe //🔽ji ltar skye la brten nas ni //
analyzed: skye bzhin 'di 'byung med pa'i tshe // ji ltar skye la brten nas ni //
translated: that which is in the process of arising does not exist.🔽How could it be said

original: skye bzhin zhes ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: skye bzhin zhes ni brjod par bya //
translated: that that which is in the process of arising arises in dependence on arising?

original: gang gi tshe skye ba 'di yod pas skye bzhin pa 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de med cing mi srid pa de'i tshe ji ltar skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin pa skyed do //🔽zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skye ba 'di yod pas skye bzhin pa 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de med cing mi srid pa de'i tshe ji ltar skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin pa skyed do // zhes brjod par bya /
translated: But when this arising does not exist, and this arising of that which is in the process of arising is impossible, then how can you say that that which is in the process of arising is generated in dependence on arising?

original: smras pa / ji ltar mi srid pa /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar mi srid pa /
translated: Objection: Why is it impossible?

original: bshad pa / re zhig snam bu skye ba la brten nas ci zhig skye bzhin pa yin /
analyzed: bshad pa / re zhig snam bu skye ba la brten nas ci zhig skye bzhin pa yin /
translated: Response: First, in dependence on the arising of cloth, what arises?

original: smras pa / snam bu nyid skye bzhin pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / snam bu nyid skye bzhin pa yin no //
translated: Objection: Cloth itself arises.

original: bshad pa / gal te snam bu skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs nyid na snam bu yin na /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te snam bu skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs nyid na snam bu yin na /
translated: Response: If cloth is cloth in the state of arising,

original: de la skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin pa skyed do zhes gang brjod pa'i skye bas yang ci bya /
analyzed: de la skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin pa skyed do zhes gang brjod pa'i skye bas yang ci bya /
translated: then what use is there for arising, since you say that that which is in the process of arising is generated in dependence on arising?

original: de ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: That is untenable.

original: skyes pa dang skye bzhin pa gnyis la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa dang skye bzhin pa gnyis la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between that which has arisen and that which is in the process of arising.

original: de'i phyir skye bzhin pa snam bu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye bzhin pa snam bu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore that which is in the process of arising is not cloth.

original: smras pa / re zhig skyes pa ni snam bu yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / re zhig skyes pa ni snam bu yin te /
translated: Objection: First, that which has arisen is cloth.

original: skyes pa de la brten nas ji srid du brtag pa'i bya ba ma zin pa de srid du skye bzhin pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa de la brten nas ji srid du brtag pa'i bya ba ma zin pa de srid du skye bzhin pa yin no //
translated: But as long as the action of arising has not yet ceased in dependence on that person, it is still in the process of arising.

original: bshad pa / drang po //
analyzed: bshad pa / drang po //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:

original: gang skye bzhin pa na snam bu ma yin pa de skyes na ji ltar snam bur 'gyur /
analyzed: gang skye bzhin pa na snam bu ma yin pa de skyes na ji ltar snam bur 'gyur /
translated: If it is not cloth while in the process of arising, how could it become cloth when it arises?

original: 'di ltar gzhan byed bzhin pa na gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan byed bzhin pa na gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For something that is being made into one thing cannot become something else.

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni re lde byed bzhin pa na snam bur 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir skyes pa yang snam bu ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni re lde byed bzhin pa na snam bur 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir skyes pa yang snam bu ma yin no //
translated: But if it could, then while a mat is being made, it would become cloth. But it does not. Therefore, that which has arisen is not cloth.

original: snam bu de med na gang gi skye ba la brten nas ci zhig skye bzhin par 'gyur /
analyzed: snam bu de med na gang gi skye ba la brten nas ci zhig skye bzhin par 'gyur /
translated: If cloth does not exist, then what is in the process of arising in dependence on whose arising?

original: smras pa / ci khyod mtshon thabs la mkhas zhes te ma nyid la 'debs par byed dam /
analyzed: smras pa / ci khyod mtshon thabs la mkhas zhes te ma nyid la 'debs par byed dam /
translated: Objection: Are you skilled in the use of weapons, that you strike a corpse with your reasoning?

original: khyod 'gyed pa la chags pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rigs pa nyid sur 'byin ko //
analyzed: khyod 'gyed pa la chags pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rigs pa nyid sur 'byin ko //
translated: You are attached to debate, and you proclaim the logic of dependent origination to the world.

original: bshad pa ; de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa ; de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: That is not the logic of dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba rnams la ni dngos po skye bzhin pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba rnams la ni dngos po skye bzhin pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: For those who speak of dependent origination, an entity that is in the process of arising does not exist.

original: dngos po skye bzhin pa'i skye pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po skye bzhin pa'i skye pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor does the arising of an entity that is in the process of arising exist.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don ni 'di yin te /🔽rten cing 'byung ba @192a * //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don ni 'di yin te / rten cing 'byung ba @192a * //
translated: This is the meaning of dependent origination:

original: gang yin pa //🔽de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi //
analyzed: gang yin pa // de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi //
translated: Whatever is dependent origination🔽That is taught to be emptiness.

original: rten cing zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang / 'byung ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang / gnyi ga ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ngo bo nyid stong pa yin no //
analyzed: rten cing zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang / 'byung ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang / gnyi ga ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ngo bo nyid stong pa yin no //
translated: That which is called “dependent” and that which is called “origination” are both peace, free of intrinsic reality, empty of intrinsic reality.

original: de phyir skye bzhin nyid dang ni //
analyzed: de phyir skye bzhin nyid dang ni //
translated: Therefore, that which is in the process of arising

original: skye ba yang ni zhi ba nyid //
analyzed: skye ba yang ni zhi ba nyid //
translated: And arising are both peace.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir rten cing zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang 'byung ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dang de gnyi ga ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ngo bo nyid stong pa /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir rten cing zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang 'byung ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dang de gnyi ga ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ngo bo nyid stong pa /
translated: Thus, because that which is called “dependent” and that which is called “origination” are both peace, free of intrinsic reality, empty of intrinsic reality,

original: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba rnams la skye bzhin pa dang skye ba gnyi ga yang ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba ngo bo nyid kyis bral ba ngo bo nyid stong pa yin no //🔽de gnyi ga ngo bo nyid stong pa yin pa skye ba 'di la brten nas skye bzhin pa 'di skyed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba rnams la skye bzhin pa dang skye ba gnyi ga yang ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba ngo bo nyid kyis bral ba ngo bo nyid stong pa yin no // de gnyi ga ngo bo nyid stong pa yin pa skye ba 'di la brten nas skye bzhin pa 'di skyed do //
translated: Therefore, for those who propound dependent origination, both that which is in the process of arising and arising are by nature peaceful, by nature free, and by nature empty.

original: zhes bya ba de ji lta bur srid par 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ji lta bur srid par 'gyur /
translated: If both of them are by nature empty, how could it be possible to say, “In dependence on this arising, this that is in the process of arising arises”?

original: smras pa / rgyu dang rkyen rnams la brten nas ji srid na skyes par 'gyur ba de srid du dngos po skyed pa'i phyir bya ba rtsom ste /
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu dang rkyen rnams la brten nas ji srid na skyes par 'gyur ba de srid du dngos po skyed pa'i phyir bya ba rtsom ste /
translated: Objection: In dependence on causes and conditions, as long as something is in the process of arising, it is said to commence activity in order to give rise to an entity.

original: des na dngos po gang kho na skye ba de nyid la brten nas bya ba rtsom par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: des na dngos po gang kho na skye ba de nyid la brten nas bya ba rtsom par yang mi byed la /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on just that entity that is in the process of arising, activity does not commence.

original: gzhi med par yang bya ba rtsom par mi byed pas bya ba dang ldan pa'i rgyu dang rkyen de dag la brten nas dngos po skye zhing de'i skye ba de la brten nas skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi med par yang bya ba rtsom par mi byed pas bya ba dang ldan pa'i rgyu dang rkyen de dag la brten nas dngos po skye zhing de'i skye ba de la brten nas skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since one does not commence activity without a basis, things arise in dependence on those causes and conditions that commence activity. And their arising arises in dependence on that.

original: bshad pa / gang gi rgyu dang rkyen dag la brten nas bya ba rtsom par byed /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi rgyu dang rkyen dag la brten nas bya ba rtsom par byed /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: In dependence on what causes and conditions does one commence activity?

original: smras pa ; snam bu'o //
analyzed: smras pa ; snam bu'o //
translated: He says: A cloth.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod nam mkha'i me tog sogs par byed dam /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod nam mkha'i me tog sogs par byed dam /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Do you gather sky-flowers?

original: khyod snam bu med pa'i rgyu dang rkyen dag la brten nas bya ba rtsom par byed ko //
analyzed: khyod snam bu med pa'i rgyu dang rkyen dag la brten nas bya ba rtsom par byed ko //
translated: You commence activity in dependence on causes and conditions that do not exist.

original: gal te dngos po ma skyes pa //
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma skyes pa //
translated: If a non-arisen thing

original: 'ga' zhig gang na yod gyur na //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gang na yod gyur na //
translated: Existed somewhere,

original: de ni ci phyir der skye 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ci phyir der skye 'gyur //
translated: Why would it arise there?

original: yod na skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod na skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it existed, it would not arise.

original: gal te skye ba'i snga rol na dngos po ma skyes pa 'ga' zhig gshed na yod par 'gyur ba de lta bu srid na ni des na dngos po yod pa de'i rgyu dang rkyen dang de la brten pa'i bya ba dag kyang tha snyad gdags su rung grang
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i snga rol na dngos po ma skyes pa 'ga' zhig gshed na yod par 'gyur ba de lta bu srid na ni des na dngos po yod pa de'i rgyu dang rkyen dang de la brten pa'i bya ba dag kyang tha snyad gdags su rung grang
translated: If it were possible that a non-arisen thing existed prior to arising, then it would be tenable to impute the cause and conditions of that existent thing and the action that depends on it.

original: na / gang gi tshe dngos po ma skyes pa ji ltar yang mi 'thad pa de'i tshe dngos po skye ba dang bral ba de yod pa de ma yin na gang gi rgyu dang rkyen du 'gyur /
analyzed: na / gang gi tshe dngos po ma skyes pa ji ltar yang mi 'thad pa de'i tshe dngos po skye ba dang bral ba de yod pa de ma yin na gang gi rgyu dang rkyen du 'gyur /
translated: But when a non-arisen thing is in no way tenable, then at that time, since that which is devoid of arising does not exist, what would be its cause and conditions?

original: rgyu dang rkyen gang zhig la brten nas bya ba rtsom par byed cing gang zhig skyed par byed /🔽gang rtsom par mi byed skye bar mi byed pa de la skye ba ga la yod //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gang zhig la brten nas bya ba rtsom par byed cing gang zhig skyed par byed / gang rtsom par mi byed skye bar mi byed pa de la skye ba ga la yod //
translated: In dependence on what cause and conditions would action be initiated and what would be generated?🔽How could that which is not initiated and not generated arise?

original: gang la skye ba med pa ji ltar skye ba la brten nas skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la skye ba med pa ji ltar skye ba la brten nas skye bar 'gyur /
translated: How could that which does not arise depend on arising and arise?

original: de lta bas na rten cing @192b 'brel par 'byung ba smra  ba rnams kyi lta ba ni skye bzhin pa dang skye ba zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rten cing @192b 'brel par 'byung ba smra  ba rnams kyi lta ba ni skye bzhin pa dang skye ba zhi ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the view of those who propound dependent origination is that that which is in the process of arising and arising are at peace.

original: yang gzhan yang /🔽gal te skye ba de yis ni //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / gal te skye ba de yis ni //
translated: Moreover,🔽if that arising causes

original: skye bzhin pa ni skyed byed na //🔽skye ba de ni skyed byed pa //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa ni skyed byed na // skye ba de ni skyed byed pa //
translated: the generation of that which is in the process of arising,🔽what is that arising

original: skye ba yang ni gang zhig yin //
analyzed: skye ba yang ni gang zhig yin //
translated: that causes the generation of that arising?

original: gal te skye ba des skye bzhin pa gzhan pa skyed par byed na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba des skye bzhin pa gzhan pa skyed par byed na /
translated: If that arising causes the generation of another that which is in the process of arising,

original: 'o na de skye ba de skyed par byed pa'i skye ba yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'o na de skye ba de skyed par byed pa'i skye ba yang gang zhig yin /
translated: then what is that arising that causes the generation of that arising?

original: de la / 'di snyam du de ni skye ba gzhan zhig gis skyed par sems na /
analyzed: de la / 'di snyam du de ni skye ba gzhan zhig gis skyed par sems na /
translated: If you think that another arising causes the generation of that arising,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
translated: If another arising causes

original: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: the generation of that, there is an infinite regress.

original: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis skye bzhin pa gzhan skyed par byed na de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis skye bzhin pa gzhan skyed par byed na de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If another arising causes the generation of another that which is in the process of arising, then in that case an infinite regress would ensue.

original: de yang gzhan gyis skyed cing de yang gzhan gyis skyed de mtha' med par 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyis skyed cing de yang gzhan gyis skyed de mtha' med par 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: Moreover, since that which is generated by another is generated by another, there would be an infinite regress, but that is unacceptable.

original: ci ste gzhan skyed pa ni skye ba med pa kho nar skyes so snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan skyed pa ni skye ba med pa kho nar skyes so snyam na /
translated: But if you think that that which generates another is generated only without another generating it,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: ci ste skye ba med skye na //
analyzed: ci ste skye ba med skye na //
translated: If that which is not generated generates,

original: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur //
translated: then everything would be generated in that way.

original: ji ltar gzhan skyed par byed pa de skyed pa gzhan med par skyes na ni thams cad kyang de bzhin du skye ba gzhan med par skye bar 'gyur te /🔽skyes pas gzhan skyed par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan skyed par byed pa de skyed pa gzhan med par skyes na ni thams cad kyang de bzhin du skye ba gzhan med par skye bar 'gyur te / skyes pas gzhan skyed par byed do //
translated: If that which generates another is generated without another generating it, then everything would be generated in that way, without another generating it.

original: zhes bya ba don med pa'i rtog pa med pa 'dis ci bya /
analyzed: zhes bya ba don med pa'i rtog pa med pa 'dis ci bya /
translated: What is the point of this meaningless speculation that “that which is generated generates another”?

original: yang na 'di ltar skye ba nyid ni skyed pa gzhan med par skye la dngos po gzhan dag ni skyed pa gzhan med par mi skye'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di ltar skye ba nyid ni skyed pa gzhan med par skye la dngos po gzhan dag ni skyed pa gzhan med par mi skye'o //
translated: Or, in this way, generation itself is generated without another generating it, but other things are not generated without another generating them.

original: zhes khyad par gyi gtan tshigs bstan par bya dgos na de yang mi byed pas de'i skye bas skye bzhin pa gzhan skyed do //
analyzed: zhes khyad par gyi gtan tshigs bstan par bya dgos na de yang mi byed pas de'i skye bas skye bzhin pa gzhan skyed do //
translated: If you must state a specific reason, then you should do so, but you do not.

original: zhes bya ba de gyi na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de gyi na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is untenable to state, “The arising of that generates another arising.”

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'di la dngos po 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur na de yod pa'am med pa zhig skye bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di la dngos po 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur na de yod pa'am med pa zhig skye bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: if some thing were to arise, would it arise having an existent or nonexistent cause?🔽First, it is not tenable

original: de la / re zhig yod dang med pa yang //🔽skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //🔽re zhig yod pa ni skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la / re zhig yod dang med pa yang // skye bar rigs pa ma yin no // re zhig yod pa ni skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That an existent or nonexistent thing arises.

original: skye bar brtag pa don med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bar brtag pa don med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, it is not tenable that an existent thing arises because it is pointless to imagine that it arises.

original: 'di ltar yod pa la yang skye bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa la yang skye bas ci zhig bya /
translated: In that case, what would be the point of an existent thing arising again?

original: med pa yang skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not tenable that a nonexistent thing arises.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because it is nonexistent.

original: de la ci zhig skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la ci zhig skye bar 'gyur /
translated: What would arise in that which is nonexistent?

original: ci ste med pa skye bar 'gyur na ni ri bong gi rva yang skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ci ste med pa skye bar 'gyur na ni ri bong gi rva yang skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: But if a nonexistent thing were to arise, then even the horn of a rabbit would arise.

original: nyes pa zad pa rnams la yang nyes pa skye bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /🔽de lta bas na med pa yang skye bar @193a * //
analyzed: nyes pa zad pa rnams la yang nyes pa skye bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de / de lta bas na med pa yang skye bar @193a * //
translated: And faults would arise for those whose faults have been exhausted. But that is unacceptable.

original: rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical that the nonexistent arises.

original: de la 'di snyam du yod med gcig skye bar sems na /🔽bshad pa / yod med nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du yod med gcig skye bar sems na / bshad pa / yod med nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: If you think that both the existent and the nonexistent arise,🔽then Nāgārjuna explains:🔽The existent and the nonexistent do not arise.

original: yod med kyang skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod med kyang skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that the existent and the nonexistent arise.

original: gal te ji ltar zhe na /🔽bshad pa / gong du bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar zhe na / bshad pa / gong du bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: If you ask why,🔽it has already been explained above.

original: de ni gong du /🔽re zhig yod dang med pa yang //
analyzed: de ni gong du / re zhig yod dang med pa yang //
translated: That is, above it was taught:🔽First, it is not logical that

original: skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //🔽zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: skye bar rigs pa ma yin no // zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: The existent and the nonexistent arise.

original: yod med ni gnyis la snyegs pas de gnyis ni dgag pa snga mas bkag pa nyid yin no //🔽yang na yod pa dang med pa dang yod med dag ji ltar skye bar rigs pa ma yin pa de ni //
analyzed: yod med ni gnyis la snyegs pas de gnyis ni dgag pa snga mas bkag pa nyid yin no // yang na yod pa dang med pa dang yod med dag ji ltar skye bar rigs pa ma yin pa de ni //
translated: The existent and the nonexistent are mutually exclusive. Therefore, the previous refutation refutes both of them.

original: dang po kho na bstan brin to //
analyzed: dang po kho na bstan brin to //
translated: Or, the way that the existent, the nonexistent, and both the existent and the nonexistent do not arise was taught at the very beginning.

original: gang du zhe na ;
analyzed: gang du zhe na ;
translated: Where was it taught?

original: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi bsgrub pa //
analyzed: gang tshe chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi bsgrub pa //
translated: nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent,

original: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
translated: how could it be called a cause of establishment?

original: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta yin na mi rigs so //
translated: If it were, it would be illogical.

original: zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: This is what is said.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: dngos po 'gag bzhin nyid la ni //
analyzed: dngos po 'gag bzhin nyid la ni //
translated: For a thing that is in the process of ceasing,

original: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: arising is not tenable.

original: 'di la khyod kyis dngos po skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes smras pas dngos po skye bzhin pa la 'gag pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la khyod kyis dngos po skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes smras pas dngos po skye bzhin pa la 'gag pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, since you say that a thing that is in the process of arising is produced, a thing that is in the process of arising would also be in the process of ceasing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽dngos po ni 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / dngos po ni 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is this?🔽Because a thing has the characteristic of disintegration.

original: dngos po 'gag bzhin pa la ni //
analyzed: dngos po 'gag bzhin pa la ni //
translated: For a thing that is in the process of ceasing,

original: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: arising is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar skye bzhin pa mngon par 'phel ba la skye ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye bzhin pa mngon par 'phel ba la skye ba yin la /
translated: In this regard, arising is the manifest increase of that which is in the process of arising.

original: de yang 'jig pa zad par 'gyur bas zad pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang 'jig pa zad par 'gyur bas zad pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, since that which is in the process of ceasing would be exhausted, that which is exhausted does not arise.

original: ci ste skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs na 'gag par mi 'gyur pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs na 'gag par mi 'gyur pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that at the time of arising it does not cease,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
translated: That which is not ceasing

original: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
translated: Is not tenable as a thing.

original: gal te dngos po skye bzhin pa nyid na 'gag par mi 'gyur ba skye bzhin pa nyid dngos po nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po skye bzhin pa nyid na 'gag par mi 'gyur ba skye bzhin pa nyid dngos po nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If a thing that is arising does not cease, then that which is arising would not be a thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would not have the characteristics of a thing.

original: 'di ltar 'jig pa ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid du bstan pas de med na ji ltar dngos po yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig pa ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid du bstan pas de med na ji ltar dngos po yin par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, since destruction is taught to be the characteristic of a thing, if it does not exist, how could it be a thing?

original: de ltar yin na dngos po skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de nyams pa dang / dngos po med pa skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes bya bar yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin na dngos po skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de nyams pa dang / dngos po med pa skye bzhin pa skyed par byed do zhes bya bar yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then the statement “That which is arising causes the generation of a thing” would be undermined, and it would follow that “That which is not a thing causes the generation of a thing that is arising.”

original: de lta bas na skye bas gzhan skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye bas gzhan skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore it is also untenable to state, “Generation causes the generation of another.”

original: gang rang gi bdag nyid kyang skyed bar mi byed la //
analyzed: gang rang gi bdag nyid kyang skyed bar mi byed la //
translated: But how could that which does not cause the generation of itself

original: @193b gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyang skyed par mi byed pa de skye pa yin par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: @193b gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyang skyed par mi byed pa de skye pa yin par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: and does not cause the generation of another arise?

original: de lta bas na skye ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, arising does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gnas pa ni yod de /
analyzed: gnas pa ni yod de /
translated: Enduring exists.

original: de yang dngos po ma skyes pa la mi 'thad pas skye ba yang rab tu grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang dngos po ma skyes pa la mi 'thad pas skye ba yang rab tu grub pa nyid do //
translated: Since that is untenable for a non-arisen thing, arising is also fully established.🔽In response to this, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / 'di la dngos po gang zhig gnas par 'gyur na de gnas pa gnas sam /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di la dngos po gang zhig gnas par 'gyur na de gnas pa gnas sam /
translated: Here, if any thing endures, does it endure having endured?

original: ma gnas pa gnas sam /
analyzed: ma gnas pa gnas sam /
translated: Or does it endure not having endured?

original: gnas bzhin pa gnas grang na /🔽de la / dngos po gnas pa mi gnas te //
analyzed: gnas bzhin pa gnas grang na / de la / dngos po gnas pa mi gnas te //
translated: Or does that which is in the process of enduring endure?🔽A thing that has endured does not endure.

original: dngos po ma gnas gnas pa min //
analyzed: dngos po ma gnas gnas pa min //
translated: A thing that has not endured does not endure.

original: gnas bzhin pa yang mi gnas te //
analyzed: gnas bzhin pa yang mi gnas te //
translated: That which is in the process of enduring also does not endure.

original: re zhig dngos po gnas pa ni gnas par mi byed de /
analyzed: re zhig dngos po gnas pa ni gnas par mi byed de /
translated: First, a thing that has endured does not cause endurance.

original: gnas pa la yang gnas pas ci bya //
analyzed: gnas pa la yang gnas pas ci bya //
translated: What would endurance do for that which has endured?

original: gnas pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Endurance would be twofold.

original: gang dang ldan pas gnas par byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang dang ldan pas gnas par byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because it would follow that the one who endures would be twofold.

original: de ltar gyur na gnas pa po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na gnas pa po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: dngos po ma gnas pa yang gnas par mi byed de /
analyzed: dngos po ma gnas pa yang gnas par mi byed de /
translated: Nor does endurance cause the nonenduring thing to endure.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnas pa dang gnas pa ma yin pa gnyis mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa dang gnas pa ma yin pa gnyis mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because endurance and nonendurance are incompatible.

original: gnas bzhin yang gnas par mi byed de /
analyzed: gnas bzhin yang gnas par mi byed de /
translated: Nor does endurance cause the enduring thing to endure.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnas pa dang ma gnas pa ma gtogs par gnas bzhin pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / gnas pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba dang / gnas pa po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa dang ma gnas pa ma gtogs par gnas bzhin pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / gnas pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba dang / gnas pa po yang gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because apart from endurance and nonendurance, there is no other possibility for endurance, and because it would follow that endurance would be twofold, and because it would follow that the one who endures would be twofold.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: ma skyes gang zhig gnas par byed //
analyzed: ma skyes gang zhig gnas par byed //
translated: What nonarisen thing does endurance cause to endure?

original: gang gi tshe rigs pa sngon du btod bas skye ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba bstan zin pa de'i tshe ma skyes ba gzhan gang zhig gnas par byed ces bya ba /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rigs pa sngon du btod bas skye ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba bstan zin pa de'i tshe ma skyes ba gzhan gang zhig gnas par byed ces bya ba /
translated: When it has been demonstrated through reasoning that there is no arising, at that time, what other non-arisen thing endures?

original: yang gzhan yang /🔽dngos po 'gag bzhin nyid la ni /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / dngos po 'gag bzhin nyid la ni /
translated: Moreover:🔽It is not tenable that

original: gnas pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: A thing that is ceasing endures.

original: dngos po 'gag bzhin pa la gnas pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po 'gag bzhin pa la gnas pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not tenable that a thing that is ceasing endures.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnas pa dang 'gag pa gnyis su mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa dang 'gag pa gnyis su mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because endurance and cessation are incompatible.

original: de la 'di snyam du gnas pa'i gnas skabs na 'gag par mi 'gyur ba nyid du sems na de bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du gnas pa'i gnas skabs na 'gag par mi 'gyur ba nyid du sems na de bshad par bya ste /
translated: But if you think that at the time of endurance it does not cease, then that is explained as follows:

original: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gag bzhin ma yin pa //
translated: That which is not ceasing

original: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
translated: Is not tenable as a thing.

original: gang gnas pa'i gnas skabs na 'gag par mi 'gyur ba de ni gnas pa'i gnas skabs na dngos po nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gnas pa'i gnas skabs na 'gag par mi 'gyur ba de ni gnas pa'i gnas skabs na dngos po nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: That which does not cease at the time of endurance is not a thing at the time of endurance.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po'i mtshan @194a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan @194a * //
translated: Because it is incompatible with the characteristics of a thing.

original: nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: 'di ltar 'jig pa ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid du bstan pas de med na ji ltar dngos po yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig pa ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid du bstan pas de med na ji ltar dngos po yin par 'gyur /
translated: In this way, since cessation is taught to be a characteristic of things, if it does not exist, how could it be a thing?

original: dngos po med na gang gis gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po med na gang gis gnas par 'gyur /
translated: If it is not a thing, by what means would it endure?

original: de lta bas na 'gag bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dngos po'i gnas pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'gag bzhin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dngos po'i gnas pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, because it is in the process of ceasing, the endurance of a thing is untenable.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: dngos po thams cad dus kun du //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dus kun du //
translated: All things at all times

original: rga dang 'chi ba'i chos yin na //🔽gang dag rga dang 'chi med par //
analyzed: rga dang 'chi ba'i chos yin na // gang dag rga dang 'chi med par //
translated: Are subject to aging and death.🔽What thing is there

original: gnas pa'i dngos po gang zhig yin //
analyzed: gnas pa'i dngos po gang zhig yin //
translated: That endures without aging and death?

original: gang gi tshe dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir /
translated: When you accept that all things are related to impermanence,

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis rga ba dang 'chi ba'i chos can yin pa de khas blang bar bya ba de'i tshe gang dag la ltos nas gnas pa yod par brjod pa gang dag rga ba dang 'chi ba med par gnas pa'i dngos po de dag gang zhig yin
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis rga ba dang 'chi ba'i chos can yin pa de khas blang bar bya ba de'i tshe gang dag la ltos nas gnas pa yod par brjod pa gang dag rga ba dang 'chi ba med par gnas pa'i dngos po de dag gang zhig yin
translated: and that impermanence is subject to aging and death, then what thing is there that endures without aging and death, in dependence on which you could say endurance exists?

original: de lta bas na gnas pa yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas pa yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, endurance is not tenable.

original: gnas pa'i gnas pa zhes gang smras pa de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i gnas pa zhes gang smras pa de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, in regard to what you said about the endurance of endurance, we will explain this.

original: gnas pa gnas pa gzhan dang ni //
analyzed: gnas pa gnas pa gzhan dang ni //
translated: The endurance of endurance

original: de nyid kyis kyang gnas mi rigs //🔽gnas pa ni gnas pa gzhan gyis kyang gnas par byed pa mi rigs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyis kyang gnas mi rigs // gnas pa ni gnas pa gzhan gyis kyang gnas par byed pa mi rigs pa nyid yin la /
translated: Is not tenable either through itself🔽Or through another.

original: gnas pa de nyid gnas pa de nyid kyis kyang gnas par byed par mi rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnas pa de nyid gnas pa de nyid kyis kyang gnas par byed par mi rigs pa nyid do //
translated: The endurance of endurance is not tenable either through another endurance or through itself.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽ji ltar skye ba rang dang ni //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / ji ltar skye ba rang dang ni //
translated: How is it so?🔽Just as arising does not arise

original: gzhan gyis bskyed pa ma yin nyid //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bskyed pa ma yin nyid //
translated: Through itself or through another.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it was said:

original: skye ba 'di ni ma skyes pas //
analyzed: skye ba 'di ni ma skyes pas //
translated: This non-arisen arising

original: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar bskyed //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar bskyed //
translated: How could it cause the arising of itself?

original: ci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
analyzed: ci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
translated: If the arisen causes the arising of itself,

original: skye na ci zhig skyed du yod //🔽ces smras pa de bzhin du gnas pa yang mi gnas pas rang gi bdag nyid gnas par byed dam /
analyzed: skye na ci zhig skyed du yod // ces smras pa de bzhin du gnas pa yang mi gnas pas rang gi bdag nyid gnas par byed dam /
translated: What arisen thing is there that is caused to arise?🔽In the same way, does endurance cause the endurance of itself through non-endurance?

original: gnas pa rang gi bdag nyid gnas par byed grang na /
analyzed: gnas pa rang gi bdag nyid gnas par byed grang na /
translated: Or does endurance cause the endurance of itself through endurance?

original: de la re zhig ma gnas pas ni rang gi bdag nyid gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: de la re zhig ma gnas pas ni rang gi bdag nyid gnas par mi byed do //
translated: First, that which is not enduring does not cause the endurance of itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: 'di ltar ma gnas pa la ni gnas pa mi 'thad ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma gnas pa la ni gnas pa mi 'thad ro //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that that which is not enduring endures.

original: gang med pa des rang gi bdag nyid gang zhig ji ltar gnas par byed /
analyzed: gang med pa des rang gi bdag nyid gang zhig ji ltar gnas par byed /
translated: How could that which does not exist cause the endurance of itself?

original: ci ste gnas par byed na ni ri bong gi rvas kyang rang gi bdag nyid gnas bar byed pa zhig na de ni mi brjod de /
analyzed: ci ste gnas par byed na ni ri bong gi rvas kyang rang gi bdag nyid gnas bar byed pa zhig na de ni mi brjod de /
translated: But if it did cause the endurance of itself, then the horn of a rabbit would also cause the endurance of itself. But that is not accepted.

original: de lta bas na gnas pa ma gnas pas rang gi bdag nyid gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas pa ma gnas pas rang gi bdag nyid gnas par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, that which is not enduring does not cause the endurance of itself.

original: gnas pa gnas pas kyang rang gi bdag nyid gnas par mi byed de /
analyzed: gnas pa gnas pas kyang rang gi bdag nyid gnas par mi byed de /
translated: That which is enduring also does not cause the endurance of itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnas pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: gnas pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because it is enduring.

original: gnas pa la yang gnas pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: gnas pa la yang gnas pas ci zhig bya //
translated: What would be the point of that which is enduring enduring again?

original: de lta @194b bas na gnas pa gnas pas kyang rang gi bdag nyid gnas par mi byed de /
analyzed: de lta @194b bas na gnas pa gnas pas kyang rang gi bdag nyid gnas par mi byed de /
translated: Therefore, that which is enduring does not cause the endurance of itself.

original: gang gnas par mi byed pa de gnas pa yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gnas par mi byed pa de gnas pa yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could that which does not cause endurance be endurance?

original: de ltar re zhig gnas pa de nyid gnas pa de nyid kyis gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gnas pa de nyid gnas pa de nyid kyis gnas par mi byed do //
translated: Thus, that which is enduring does not cause endurance by means of that very endurance.

original: ji ltar gnas pa da gnas pa gzhan gyis gnas par byed par mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa da gnas pa gzhan gyis gnas par byed par mi rigs she na /
translated: How is it that endurance is not tenable by means of another endurance?

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it was said:

original: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: gal te skye ba gzhan zhig gis //
translated: If another arising causes the generation of that,

original: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de skyed thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: there will be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste skye ba med skye na //
analyzed: ci ste skye ba med skye na //
translated: If there is generation without arising,

original: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur //🔽zhes smras pa de bzhin du /🔽gnas pa yang gnas pa gzhan zhig gis gnas par byed dam /
analyzed: thams cad de bzhin skye bar 'gyur // zhes smras pa de bzhin du / gnas pa yang gnas pa gzhan zhig gis gnas par byed dam /
translated: all things would arise in that way.🔽In the same way, does endurance cause endurance by means of another endurance?

original: gnas pa gzhan med par gnas par byed grang na /
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan med par gnas par byed grang na /
translated: Or does it cause endurance without another endurance?

original: de la re zhig gnas pa ni gnas pa gzhan gyis gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: de la re zhig gnas pa ni gnas pa gzhan gyis gnas par mi byed do //
translated: First, endurance does not cause endurance by means of another endurance.

original: gal te gnas pa gnas pa gzhan gyis gnas par byed na /
analyzed: gal te gnas pa gnas pa gzhan gyis gnas par byed na /
translated: If endurance causes endurance by means of another endurance,

original: de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that there would be an infinite regress.

original: de yang gzhan gyis gnas par byed cing /
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyis gnas par byed cing /
translated: And that would cause endurance by means of another,🔽and that another by means of another.

original: de yang gzhan gyis gnas par byed pa de mtha' med par 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyis gnas par byed pa de mtha' med par 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: Moreover, since that which causes endurance would be infinite, that is unacceptable.

original: de lta bas na gnas pa ni gzhan pa gzhan gyis gnas par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas pa ni gzhan pa gzhan gyis gnas par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is illogical that endurance is caused by another.

original: ci ste gnas pa de gnas pa gzhan med par gnas par byed do snyam na de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste gnas pa de gnas pa gzhan med par gnas par byed do snyam na de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: But if you think that endurance causes endurance without another enduring, then Nāgārjuna addresses this point:

original: ji ltar gzhan gnas par byed pa de gnas pa gzhan med par gnas pa de bzhin du thams cad kyang gnas pa gzhan med par gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gnas par byed pa de gnas pa gzhan med par gnas pa de bzhin du thams cad kyang gnas pa gzhan med par gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as that which causes endurance causes endurance without another enduring, so too everything would endure without another enduring.

original: gnas pas gzhan gnas par byed do zhes bya ba don med pa'i rtog pa 'dis ci bya /
analyzed: gnas pas gzhan gnas par byed do zhes bya ba don med pa'i rtog pa 'dis ci bya /
translated: What is the point of this pointless speculation that endurance causes another to endure?

original: yang na 'di ltar gnas pa nyid ni gnas pa gzhan med par gnas pa la dngos po gzhan dag ni gnas pa gzhan med par mi gnas so zhes khyad par gyi gtan tshigs bstan par bya dgos na de yang mi byed pas de'i phyir gnas pa ni gnas
analyzed: yang na 'di ltar gnas pa nyid ni gnas pa gzhan med par gnas pa la dngos po gzhan dag ni gnas pa gzhan med par mi gnas so zhes khyad par gyi gtan tshigs bstan par bya dgos na de yang mi byed pas de'i phyir gnas pa ni gnas
translated: Or in this way, you must state a specific reason, “Endurance itself endures without another enduring, but other things do not endure without another enduring,” but since you do not do that, therefore endurance does not endure.

original: pa gzhan gyis gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: pa gzhan gyis gnas par mi byed do //
translated: It does not cause the endurance of that which is enduring.

original: gang gnas par mi byed pa de ni gnas pa nyid kyang ma yin pas de'i phyir gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin no //🔽'dir smras pa ;
analyzed: gang gnas par mi byed pa de ni gnas pa nyid kyang ma yin pas de'i phyir gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin no // 'dir smras pa ;
translated: Since it does not cause the endurance of that which is enduring, therefore endurance does not exist.

original: 'gag pa ni yod de /
analyzed: 'gag pa ni yod de /
translated: Objection: Cessation exists.

original: de yang dngos po ma skyes pa dang mi gnas pa dag la mi 'thad pas skye ba dang gnas pa dag kyang rab tu grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang dngos po ma skyes pa dang mi gnas pa dag la mi 'thad pas skye ba dang gnas pa dag kyang rab tu grub pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, since it is untenable that a non-arisen or non-enduring thing ceases, therefore arising and enduring are also established.🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa // gal te 'gag bzhin pa yod par gyur na /🔽de dngos po 'gag pa'am /🔽ma 'gag pa'am /
analyzed: bshad pa // gal te 'gag bzhin pa yod par gyur na / de dngos po 'gag pa'am / ma 'gag pa'am /
translated: If that now ceasing exists,🔽would it be a thing that has ceased,🔽that has not ceased,

original: 'gag bzhin pa'i yin @195a * //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa'i yin @195a * //
translated: or that is now ceasing?

original: grang na / rnam pa thams cad mi 'thad do //
analyzed: grang na / rnam pa thams cad mi 'thad do //
translated: All of these are untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ltar / 'gags pa 'gag par mi byed de //🔽ma 'gags pa yang 'gag mi byed //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'gags pa 'gag par mi byed de // ma 'gags pa yang 'gag mi byed //
translated: Because: That which has ceased does not cause cessation.🔽That which has not ceased does not cause cessation.

original: 'gag bzhin pa yang de bzhin min //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa yang de bzhin min //
translated: That which is now ceasing does not cause cessation.

original: de la re zhig 'gags pa ni 'gag par mi byed de /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'gags pa ni 'gag par mi byed de /
translated: First, that which has ceased does not cause cessation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: med pa la ci zhig 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: med pa la ci zhig 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: What could cease of that which does not exist?

original: ma 'gags pa yang 'gag par mi byed de /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa yang 'gag par mi byed de /
translated: Nor does that which is not ceasing cause cessation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa gnyis mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa gnyis mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is ceasing and that which is not ceasing are incompatible.

original: 'gag bzhin pa yang de bzhin du 'gag par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa yang de bzhin du 'gag par mi byed de /
translated: That which is in the process of ceasing does not cause cessation in the same way.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it was said:

original: skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed do zhes smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa skyed par mi byed do zhes smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: That which is in the process of arising does not cause the generation of that which is in the process of arising.

original: des na 'gags pa dang / ma 'gags pa ma gtogs par 'gag bzhin pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / 'gag pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba dang / 'gag bzhin pa gnyis su thal bar yang 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa 'gag par mi byed do //
analyzed: des na 'gags pa dang / ma 'gags pa ma gtogs par 'gag bzhin pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / 'gag pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba dang / 'gag bzhin pa gnyis su thal bar yang 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gag bzhin pa 'gag par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, because that which is in the process of ceasing is impossible apart from that which has ceased and that which has not ceased, and because the error of two cessations and two that are in the process of cessation would ensue, that which is in the process of ceasing does not cause cessation.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'di la 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi cung zad ni 'gags cung zad ni ma 'gags pa 'am /🔽yang na de la gzhan 'gags pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di la 'gag bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi cung zad ni 'gags cung zad ni ma 'gags pa 'am / yang na de la gzhan 'gags pa 'am /
translated: here that which is in the process of ceasing is that of which a part has ceased and a part has not ceased.

original: ma 'gags pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: Or, is it that which is different from that which has ceased or that which has not ceased?

original: de la gal te 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa de 'gag pas de 'gog par byed na ni re zhig de'i cung zad 'gag pa des ni bkag pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de la gal te 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa de 'gag pas de 'gog par byed na ni re zhig de'i cung zad 'gag pa des ni bkag pa ma yin la /
translated: If that which has ceased and that which has not ceased were to cease through cessation, then first, that which has ceased would not cease.

original: 'gag pa de 'gag bzhin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gag pa de 'gag bzhin pa ma yin te /
translated: And that cessation would not be in the process of cessation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de 'gags na 'gag bzhin pa ma yin zhing 'gag bzhin pa 'gog par byed do zhes kyang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'gags na 'gag bzhin pa ma yin zhing 'gag bzhin pa 'gog par byed do zhes kyang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which has ceased is not in the process of cessation, and it is said that that which is in the process of cessation ceases.

original: gal te cung zad 'gags pa de 'gag pa med pa kho nar 'gags na ni de'i lhag ma yang de bzhin du 'gog pa med pa kho nar 'gag par 'gyur par nges so //🔽yang na de'i gang cung zad ni 'gag pa med pa kho nar 'gags la /
analyzed: gal te cung zad 'gags pa de 'gag pa med pa kho nar 'gags na ni de'i lhag ma yang de bzhin du 'gog pa med pa kho nar 'gag par 'gyur par nges so // yang na de'i gang cung zad ni 'gag pa med pa kho nar 'gags la /
translated: If that which has ceased were to cease without cessation, then that which remains would also definitely cease without cessation.

original: cung zad ni 'gags pas 'gag par byed pa la khyad par ci yod pa brjod dgos so ;
analyzed: cung zad ni 'gags pas 'gag par byed pa la khyad par ci yod pa brjod dgos so ;
translated: Or else, you must explain what the difference is between that which ceases without cessation and that which ceases through cessation.

original: / ci ste de'i gang du cung zad 'gags pa de yang 'gag pa kho nar bkag pa ni de lta na ma 'gags pa 'gags pas 'gag par byed kyi 'gag bzhin pa 'gag par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / ci ste de'i gang du cung zad 'gags pa de yang 'gag pa kho nar bkag pa ni de lta na ma 'gags pa 'gags pas 'gag par byed kyi 'gag bzhin pa 'gag par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But if that which has ceased a little is ceased, then that which has not ceased is ceased by that which is ceasing, not by that which is ceased.

original: gzhan yang / de'i phyir cung zad 'gags pa de ni 'gags pas 'gag par mi byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang / de'i phyir cung zad 'gags pa de ni 'gags pas 'gag par mi byed de /
translated: Moreover, that which has ceased a little is not ceased by that which is ceased,

original: 'gags @195b zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags @195b zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already ceased.

original: des na / de'i lhag ma ma 'gags pa gang yin pa de 'gags pas 'gag par byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na / de'i lhag ma ma 'gags pa gang yin pa de 'gags pas 'gag par byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, that which has not ceased, which is the remainder of that, is ceased by that which is ceased.

original: de la 'gag bzhin pa 'gag bar byed do //
analyzed: de la 'gag bzhin pa 'gag bar byed do //
translated: Thus, that which is ceasing is ceased by that which is ceasing.

original: zhes gang smras pa de nyams par gyur to //
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de nyams par gyur to //
translated: What was said, namely, that that which is ceasing is ceased by that which is ceasing, is undermined.

original: ci ste de'i gang cung zad 'gags pas 'gag par byed na ni de la 'gag pa gnyis kyis byas pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste de'i gang cung zad 'gags pas 'gag par byed na ni de la 'gag pa gnyis kyis byas pa'i khyad par can du 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if that which has ceased a little is ceased by that which is ceasing, then it would have a distinction made by two cessations, but it does not.

original: 'gag pa zin pa de la ni yang 'gag par bya ba'i phyir bya ba 'ga' yang rtsom par mi byed par de'i phyir de ni yang 'gag par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'gag pa zin pa de la ni yang 'gag par bya ba'i phyir bya ba 'ga' yang rtsom par mi byed par de'i phyir de ni yang 'gag par mi byed do //
translated: But since it has already ceased, it does not engage in any activity whatsoever in order to cause it to cease again, and therefore it does not cause it to cease again.

original: de lta bas na 'gag bzhin pa 'gag par byed do zhes bya ba de yang snying po med pa la blos snying por bzung bar zad de gyi na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'gag bzhin pa 'gag par byed do zhes bya ba de yang snying po med pa la blos snying por bzung bar zad de gyi na'o //
translated: Thus, the statement “That now ceasing causes cessation” is also just a mind grasping an essence in the absence of an essence.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: ma skyes gang zhig 'gag par byed //🔽gang gi tshe cung zad kyang skye ba med do //
analyzed: ma skyes gang zhig 'gag par byed // gang gi tshe cung zad kyang skye ba med do //
translated: What unarisen thing causes cessation?🔽Since it has already been demonstrated that nothing arises in the least,🔽what unarisen thing causes cessation?

original: zhes bya ba de sngar bstan zin pa de'i phyir ma skyes pa gzhan gang zhig 'gag par byed ces bya ba dang / de lta bas na 'gag pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de sngar bstan zin pa de'i phyir ma skyes pa gzhan gang zhig 'gag par byed ces bya ba dang / de lta bas na 'gag pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore cessation also does not exist.

original: yang gzhan yang /🔽'gag pa ni gnas pa 'am /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / 'gag pa ni gnas pa 'am /
translated: Moreover:🔽Cessation should be investigated:🔽Does it occur in a thing that endures?

original: ma gnas pa la brtag grang na /
analyzed: ma gnas pa la brtag grang na /
translated: Or does it occur in a thing that does not endure?

original: de ni gnyi ga la yang mi rung ste /🔽de la / re zhig dngos po gnas pa la //
analyzed: de ni gnyi ga la yang mi rung ste / de la / re zhig dngos po gnas pa la //
translated: It is untenable in both cases.

original: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: First, cessation is untenable🔽In a thing that endures.

original: gnas pa'i bya ba skyes pa la gnas pa dang mi mthun pa'i 'gag pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gnas pa'i bya ba skyes pa la gnas pa dang mi mthun pa'i 'gag pa mi 'thad de /
translated: It is untenable that cessation, which is incompatible with endurance, occurs in that which has arisen, the activity of endurance.

original: gnas pa'i phyir de ni grags pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa'i phyir de ni grags pa yin no //
translated: Because it endures, it is well known.

original: gal te mi gnas pa la 'gag pa yod pas nyes pa med do //🔽zhe na / dngos po mi gnas pa la yang //
