original: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
translated: In the same way, understand appropriation.

original: nyer len zhes bya ba ni dngos por lta ste /
analyzed: nyer len zhes bya ba ni dngos por lta ste /
translated: Appropriation is the view of things as real.

original: gang la dngos po yod pa de la byed pa po du ma yod pas 'dir nye bar blangs pa dang nye bar len pa po gzung bar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la dngos po yod pa de la byed pa po du ma yod pas 'dir nye bar blangs pa dang nye bar len pa po gzung bar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Since there are many agents in regard to that which is real, here the appropriator and the appropriated should be understood as the object of grasping.

original: de la ji ltar byed pa po la brten nas gdags pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de la ji ltar byed pa po la brten nas gdags pa de bzhin du /
translated: In that regard, just as the agent is designated in dependence on action,

original: nye bar len pa po yang nye bar blang ba la brten nas gdags so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po yang nye bar blang ba la brten nas gdags so //
translated: so too the appropriator is designated in dependence on appropriation.

original: ji ltar las byed pa po de nyid la brten nas gdags pa de bzhin du nye bar blang ba yang nye bar len pa po de nyid la brten nas gdags te /
analyzed: ji ltar las byed pa po de nyid la brten nas gdags pa de bzhin du nye bar blang ba yang nye bar len pa po de nyid la brten nas gdags te /
translated: Just as the object of action is designated in dependence on the agent, so too appropriation is designated in dependence on the appropriator.

original: de gnyis la yang de ma gtogs par 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de gnyis la yang de ma gtogs par 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid ma mthong ngo //
translated: And we see no other characteristics of the established effect of these two.

original: de yang / ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang / ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
translated: Because the agent and action are refuted.

original: bsal zhes bya ba ni bkag pa'o //
analyzed: bsal zhes bya ba ni bkag pa'o //
translated: “Refuted” means “negated.”

original: phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don te /
analyzed: phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don te /
translated: “Because” means “for the reason that.”

original: byed pa po dang las de dag sngar rnam pa du mar gsal bar byas pas de dag gsal ba kho nas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag gis 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan yang bsal bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las de dag sngar rnam pa du mar gsal bar byas pas de dag gsal ba kho nas nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag gis 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan yang bsal bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Since the agent and action have been clarified in many ways above, it should be understood that through their very clarification, the characteristics of the established appropriator and appropriated are also refuted.

original: de la ji ltar byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed la /
analyzed: de la ji ltar byed pa po yin par gyur pa las yin par gyur pa mi byed la /
translated: In that regard, an existent agent does not perform an existent action.

original: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa las ma yin par gyur pa mi byed /
translated: A nonexistent agent does not perform a nonexistent action.

original: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed de /
translated: An existent and nonexistent agent does not perform an existent and nonexistent action.

original: skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du nye bar len pa po yang nye bar len pa po yin par gyur pa nye bar blang ba yin par gyur pa nye bar len par mi byed /
analyzed: skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du nye bar len pa po yang nye bar len pa po yin par gyur pa nye bar blang ba yin par gyur pa nye bar len par mi byed /
translated: Likewise, the appropriator who is an appropriator does not appropriate that which is an appropriated object,

original: nye bar len pa po ma yin par gyur pa nye bar blang ba ma yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len par mi byed de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po ma yin par gyur pa nye bar blang ba ma yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa nye bar len par mi byed de /
translated: the appropriator who is not an appropriator does not appropriate that which is not an appropriated object, and the appropriator who is not an appropriator does not appropriate that which is an appropriated object.

original: skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because many errors would ensue.🔽The same should be applied to the dissimilar positions.

original: phyogs mi mthun pa dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyogs mi mthun pa dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The remaining entities should be understood

original: byed pa po dang las dag gis //🔽dngos po lhag ma shes par bya //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dag gis // dngos po lhag ma shes par bya //
translated: in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.

original: byed pa po las dag dang dngos po lhag ma rnams mtshungs par shes par bya'o //🔽nye bar len pa @202a * //
analyzed: byed pa po las dag dang dngos po lhag ma rnams mtshungs par shes par bya'o // nye bar len pa @202a * //
translated: The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.

original: logs shig tu smos pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / don 'og ma dag gi phyir te /
analyzed: logs shig tu smos pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / don 'og ma dag gi phyir te /
translated: The remaining entities should be understood in terms of the agent and action.🔽The remaining entities should

original: de la dngos po lhag ma rnams ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang yan lag dang yan lag can dang / me dang bud shing dang / yon tan dang yon tan can dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / rnam pa de lta bu dag go //
analyzed: de la dngos po lhag ma rnams ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang yan lag dang yan lag can dang / me dang bud shing dang / yon tan dang yon tan can dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / rnam pa de lta bu dag go //
translated: The remaining entities are cause and effect, part and whole, fire and fuel, quality and substance, characteristic and characterized, and so forth.

original: de rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu yin par gyur pa mi skyed /
analyzed: de rgyu yin par gyur pa 'bras bu yin par gyur pa mi skyed /
translated: A real cause does not produce a real effect.

original: rgyu ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi skyed /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin par gyur pa mi skyed /
translated: An unreal cause does not produce an unreal effect.

original: rgyu yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa mi skyed de /
analyzed: rgyu yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa 'bras bu yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa mi skyed de /
translated: A real and unreal cause does not produce a real and unreal effect.

original: phyogs thams cad la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya zhing /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya zhing /
translated: The same should be applied to all the other positions.

original: skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba ji skad smos pa dag kyang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba ji skad smos pa dag kyang bstan par bya'o //
translated: The errors that ensue should be explained as stated.

original: rgyu yang 'bras bu skyed par byed pa na yin par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'bras bu skyed par byed pa na yin par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When a cause produces an effect, it is called real.

original: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin par gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is other than that is unreal.

original: 'bras bu yang skyed par bya ba na yin par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang skyed par bya ba na yin par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And when the effect is produced, it is said to be that which has come to be.

original: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin par gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is other than that is that which has not come to be.

original: de bzhin du yan lag dang yan lag can dag la yang blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag dang yan lag can dag la yang blta bar bya ste /
translated: In the same way, it should be seen in the case of the whole and the parts.🔽The universal does not occur in wholes that have come to be, nor in wholes that have not come to be, nor in wholes that both have and have not come to be.

original: yan lag yin par gyur pa yan lag can yin par gyur pa dag la mi 'jug / ma yin par gyur pa yang ma yin par gyur pa dag la mi 'jug / yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa🔽dag la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: yan lag yin par gyur pa yan lag can yin par gyur pa dag la mi 'jug / ma yin par gyur pa yang ma yin par gyur pa dag la mi 'jug / yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa dag la mi 'jug go //
translated: Nor does it occur in wholes that neither have nor have not come to be.🔽Fire that has come to be does not burn fuel that has come to be, nor does it burn fuel that has not come to be, nor does it burn fuel that both has and has not come to be.

original: me yin par gyur pa yang bud shing yin par gyur pa mi sreg / ma yin par gyur pa yang ma yin par gyur pa mi sreg / yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi sreg go //
analyzed: me yin par gyur pa yang bud shing yin par gyur pa mi sreg / ma yin par gyur pa yang ma yin par gyur pa mi sreg / yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi sreg go //
translated: Nor does it burn fuel that neither has nor has not come to be.

original: yon tan yin par gyur pa yang yon tan can yin par gyur pa la mi 'jug / ma yin par gyur pa yang ma yin par gyur pa la mi 'jug / yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa la🔽mi 'jug go /
analyzed: yon tan yin par gyur pa yang yon tan can yin par gyur pa la mi 'jug / ma yin par gyur pa yang ma yin par gyur pa la mi 'jug / yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa la mi 'jug go /
translated: A real and unreal quality does not occur in a real and unreal possessor of qualities.

original: mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin par gyur pa yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed /
translated: A real characteristic does not characterize a real characterized basis.

original: ma yin par gyur pa yang ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed /
analyzed: ma yin par gyur pa yang ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed /
translated: A unreal characteristic does not characterize a unreal characterized basis.

original: yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed do //
analyzed: yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa mtshon par mi byed do //
translated: A real and unreal characteristic does not characterize a real and unreal characterized basis.

original: ji ltar byed pa po las la brten nas gdags la /
analyzed: ji ltar byed pa po las la brten nas gdags la /
translated: Just as an agent is imputed in dependence on an action,

original: las kyang byed pa po nyid la brten nas gdags pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yang rgyu @202b la brten nas gdags la /
analyzed: las kyang byed pa po nyid la brten nas gdags pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yang rgyu @202b la brten nas gdags la /
translated: and an action is imputed in dependence on the agent, in the same way, an effect is imputed in dependence on a cause,

original: rgyu yang 'bras bu de nyid la brten nas gdags so //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'bras bu de nyid la brten nas gdags so //
translated: and a cause is imputed in dependence on that very effect.

original: yan lag can yang yan lag la brten nas gdags la /
analyzed: yan lag can yang yan lag la brten nas gdags la /
translated: The whole is also imputed in dependence on the parts.

original: yan lag kyang yan lag can de nyid la brten nas gdags so //🔽me yang bud shing la brten nas gdags la //
analyzed: yan lag kyang yan lag can de nyid la brten nas gdags so // me yang bud shing la brten nas gdags la //
translated: The parts are also imputed in dependence on the very same whole.🔽Fire is also imputed in dependence on fuel.

original: bud shing yang me de nyid la brten nas gdags so //🔽yon tan can yang yon tan la brten nas gdags la /
analyzed: bud shing yang me de nyid la brten nas gdags so // yon tan can yang yon tan la brten nas gdags la /
translated: Fuel is also imputed in dependence on fire.🔽The possessor of qualities is also imputed in dependence on qualities.

original: yon tan yang yon tan can de nyid la brten nas gdags so //🔽mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid la brten nas gdags la /
analyzed: yon tan yang yon tan can de nyid la brten nas gdags so // mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid la brten nas gdags la /
translated: Qualities are also imputed in dependence on the very same possessor of qualities.🔽The basis of characteristics is also imputed in dependence on characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi de nyid la brten nas gdags so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi de nyid la brten nas gdags so //
translated: Characteristics are also imputed in dependence on the very same basis of characteristics.

original: de ltar de dag la ltos te gdags pa ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan gang gis kyang de dag 'grub par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar de dag la ltos te gdags pa ma gtogs par rnam pa gzhan gang gis kyang de dag 'grub par mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus it is not tenable that they are established by any other means apart from their being imputed in dependence on each other.

original: byed pa po dang las brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the eighth chapter, called “The Critique of the Agent and Action.”

original: // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta /
analyzed: // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta /
translated: BUDDHAPĀLITA

original: bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi pa /
translated: PART IV

original: smras pa / de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
analyzed: smras pa / de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
translated: Objection: It should be understood in the same way as appropriation.

original: zhes gang bshad pa de la smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa de la smra bar bya ste /
translated: This is what should be said to those who say this:🔽1. Some say that prior to the appropriator

original: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor sogs dang yang dbang byas pa //
analyzed: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor sogs dang yang dbang byas pa //
translated: of seeing, hearing, and so on, and of feeling and so on,

original: gang gi yin pa de dag gi //
analyzed: gang gi yin pa de dag gi //
translated: that which is the basis of these

original: snga rol de yod kha cig smra //
analyzed: snga rol de yod kha cig smra //
translated: exists prior to them.

original: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa'o//
translated: “Seeing, hearing, and so on” refers to seeing, hearing, and so on.

original: lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa dag gang gi nye bar blang ba yin pa'i dngos po de lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa de dag gi snga rol na yod do zhes kha cig de skad ces smra'o //
analyzed: lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa dag gang gi nye bar blang ba yin pa'i dngos po de lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa de dag gi snga rol na yod do zhes kha cig de skad ces smra'o //
translated: Some say that prior to seeing, hearing, and so on, and feeling and so on, the thing that is the basis of these, that is, the appropriator of seeing, hearing, and so on, and of feeling and so on, exists prior to them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If the thing does not exist,

original: lta la sogs pa ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: lta la sogs pa ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could seeing and so on occur?

original: de phyir de dag snga rol na //
analyzed: de phyir de dag snga rol na //
translated: Therefore, prior to them,

original: dngos po gnas pa de yod de //
analyzed: dngos po gnas pa de yod de //
translated: the thing that is the basis exists.

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If the thing does not exist,🔽how could seeing and so on occur?

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag ji ltar nye bar blang ba yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag ji ltar nye bar blang ba yin par 'gyur /
translated: How could seeing and so on be appropriated?

original: de'i phyir mi 'thad pas lta ba la sogs pa de dag gi snga rol na lta ba la sogs pa dag gang gi nye bar blang ba yin pa'i dngos po gnas pa de yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'thad pas lta ba la sogs pa de dag gi snga rol na lta ba la sogs pa dag gang gi nye bar blang ba yin pa'i dngos po gnas pa de yod do //
translated: Therefore, since that is untenable, prior to seeing and so on, the thing that is the appropriator of seeing and so on exists.🔽If the appropriator exists, the appropriated also exists in dependence.

original: nye bar len pa po de yod na nye bar blang ba yang ltos pas gdags su yod pa yin na de la khyod ci zer /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po de yod na nye bar blang ba yang ltos pas gdags su yod pa yin na de la khyod ci zer /
translated: What do you say about that?

original: bshad pa / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba la sogs nyid kyi ni //
analyzed: bshad pa / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba la sogs nyid kyi ni //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Prior to seeing, hearing, and so on, And feeling and so on,

original: snga rol dngos po gang gnas pa //
analyzed: snga rol dngos po gang gnas pa //
translated: What is the thing that exists?

original: de ni gang gis gdags @203a * //
analyzed: de ni gang gis gdags @203a * //
translated: By what means is it imputed?

original: par bya // 'di la lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa dag gis lta ba po dang / nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po zhes dngos po gdags par bya ba yin na lta ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: par bya // 'di la lta ba dang nyan pa la sogs pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa dag gis lta ba po dang / nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po zhes dngos po gdags par bya ba yin na lta ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: Here, if the thing is imputed as the seer, the hearer, and the feeler by means of seeing, hearing, and so on, and feeling and so on,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na lta ba la sogs pa dag gang gi nye bar blang ba zhes brjod pa'i dngos po yod do //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na lta ba la sogs pa dag gang gi nye bar blang ba zhes brjod pa'i dngos po yod do //
translated: Prior to feeling and so on, seeing and so on are said to be the appropriated.

original: zhes brtag pa'i dngos po de 'di ltar gnas te /
analyzed: zhes brtag pa'i dngos po de 'di ltar gnas te /
translated: The thing that is imagined as existing in this way is as follows:

original: yod do zhes gang gis gdags par bya /
analyzed: yod do zhes gang gis gdags par bya /
translated: By what is it designated as existing?

original: smras pa / de ni lta ba la sogs pa dag med par yang rang nyid kyis rab tu grub par yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / de ni lta ba la sogs pa dag med par yang rang nyid kyis rab tu grub par yod do //
translated: Objection: It exists by itself, even without seeing and so on.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:🔽If it exists

original: bshad pa / lta la sogs pa med par yang //🔽gal te de ni gnas gyur na //🔽de med par yang de dag ni //
analyzed: bshad pa / lta la sogs pa med par yang // gal te de ni gnas gyur na // de med par yang de dag ni //
translated: without seeing and so on,🔽then without a doubt

original: yod par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
analyzed: yod par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
translated: they would exist without it.

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag med par yang gal te dngos po de rang nyid kyis rab tu grub cing gnas pa yod do //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag med par yang gal te dngos po de rang nyid kyis rab tu grub cing gnas pa yod do //
translated: If you say that this thing exists by itself, even without seeing and so on,

original: zhes brjod na /
analyzed: zhes brjod na /
translated: then without a doubt,

original: dngos po de med par yang lta ba la sogs pa de dag rang nyid kyis rab tu grub cing gnas pa yod par 'gyur par the tshom med do //
analyzed: dngos po de med par yang lta ba la sogs pa de dag rang nyid kyis rab tu grub cing gnas pa yod par 'gyur par the tshom med do //
translated: even without that thing, seeing and so on would exist by themselves.

original: smras pa / lta ba la sogs pa dag kyang de med par gnas par gyur na skyon ci yod //
analyzed: smras pa / lta ba la sogs pa dag kyang de med par gnas par gyur na skyon ci yod //
translated: Objection: If seeing and so on exist without an entity, what is the error?

original: bshad pa / thams cad skyon nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bshad pa / thams cad skyon nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In response Nāgārjuna explains: Everything would be an error.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag med pa'i dngos po gsal bar byed pa med par gnas pa med par 'gyur ba dang / de med na lta ba la sogs pa dag kyang gsal bar byed pa med par gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag med pa'i dngos po gsal bar byed pa med par gnas pa med par 'gyur ba dang / de med na lta ba la sogs pa dag kyang gsal bar byed pa med par gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without an entity that is illuminated, seeing and so on would not exist without illumination, and if that is so, then seeing and so on would exist without illumination.

original: gang gi phyir de dag ni /🔽ci yis gang zhig gsal bar byed //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ni / ci yis gang zhig gsal bar byed //
translated: Because of that,🔽By what is anything illuminated?

original: gang gis ci zhig gsal bar byed //
analyzed: gang gis ci zhig gsal bar byed //
translated: By what is anything illuminated?

original: lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag gis dngos po gang zhig lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang tshor ba po dang zhes gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag gis dngos po gang zhig lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang tshor ba po dang zhes gsal bar byed de /
translated: By what are seeing and so on illuminated? By what entity is the seer, the hearer, and the feeler illuminated?

original: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: “Illuminated” means

original: mngon par byed pa dang / gzung bar byed pa dang / shes par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par byed pa dang / gzung bar byed pa dang / shes par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: manifested, apprehended, and known.

original: dngos po gang zhig pos kyang lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag 'di ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig pos kyang lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag 'di ni lta ba'o //
translated: This is seeing.

original: 'di ni nyan pa'o//
analyzed: 'di ni nyan pa'o//
translated: This is hearing.

original: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
translated: This is feeling.

original: zhes gsal bar byed do //🔽de ltar gang gi phyir lta ba la sogs pa dag gis dngos po gsal bar byed pa /
analyzed: zhes gsal bar byed do // de ltar gang gi phyir lta ba la sogs pa dag gis dngos po gsal bar byed pa /
translated: ”🔽Thus, because such things as seeing clarify a thing,

original: dngos pos kyang lta ba la sogs pa dag gsal bar byed pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos pos kyang lta ba la sogs pa dag gsal bar byed pa de'i phyir /
translated: and because a thing clarifies such things as seeing,

original: ci med gang zhig ga la yod //
analyzed: ci med gang zhig ga la yod //
translated: how could a thing exist🔽without such things as seeing?🔽How could such things as seeing exist

original: gang med ci zhig ga la yod //
analyzed: gang med ci zhig ga la yod //
translated: without a thing?

original: lta ba la sogs pa @203b ci zhig po dag med na gsal bar byed pa med pa'i dngos po gang zhig po gnas pas gnas par 'gyur ba ga la yod /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa @203b ci zhig po dag med na gsal bar byed pa med pa'i dngos po gang zhig po gnas pas gnas par 'gyur ba ga la yod /
translated: If such things as seeing do not exist, how could a thing exist, since it is not clarified?

original: dngos po gang zhig po med na yang gsal bar byed pa med pa'i lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag gnas par 'gyur ba ga la yod de /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig po med na yang gsal bar byed pa med pa'i lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag gnas par 'gyur ba ga la yod de /
translated: How could such things as seeing exist without a thing, since they are not clarified?

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag gi snga rol na dngos po gang zhig po gnas pa med do //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag gi snga rol na dngos po gang zhig po gnas pa med do //
translated: prior to such things as seeing, a thing does not exist.

original: smras pa / lta la sogs pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: smras pa / lta la sogs pa thams cad kyi //
translated: Objection: Prior to all such things as seeing,

original: snga rol gang zhig yod pa min //
analyzed: snga rol gang zhig yod pa min //
translated: there is no existent thing.🔽Prior to all such things as seeing,

original: lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po thams cad kyi snga rol na dngos po gang zhig po yod do //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po thams cad kyi snga rol na dngos po gang zhig po yod do //
translated: there is no existent thing.

original: zhes ni mi smra'i /🔽'di lta ba la sogs pa'i ci zhig po dag re re'i snga rol na dngos po gang zhig po yod pas de'i phyir de ni /
analyzed: zhes ni mi smra'i / 'di lta ba la sogs pa'i ci zhig po dag re re'i snga rol na dngos po gang zhig po yod pas de'i phyir de ni /
translated: But we do not say that.🔽We say that prior to each of such things as seeing, there is an existent thing.

original: lta la sogs pa gzhan dag gis //
analyzed: lta la sogs pa gzhan dag gis //
translated: Therefore, it is clarified by other things,

original: gzhan gyi tshe na gsal bar byed //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe na gsal bar byed //
translated: such as seeing, at another time.

original: gang gi phyir de lta ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi snga rol na yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi snga rol na yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Because it does not exist prior to all such things as seeing,

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag re re'i snga rol na yod pa de'i phyir de ni lta ba la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis dus gzhan gyi tshe na lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po zhes gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag re re'i snga rol na yod pa de'i phyir de ni lta ba la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis dus gzhan gyi tshe na lta ba po dang nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po zhes gsal bar byed do //
translated: but it does exist prior to each of such things as seeing, therefore it is clarified by other things, such as seeing, at another time, as the seer, the hearer, and the feeler.

original: de lta bas na de ni lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Thus, it is not that the self does not exist prior to seeing and so on,

original: gsal bar byed pa med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it that it is not manifest without an agent that clarifies it.

original: bshad pa / rang gi blo gros yang bar ston par zad de gyi na zhig smras so //🔽lta la sogs pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: bshad pa / rang gi blo gros yang bar ston par zad de gyi na zhig smras so // lta la sogs pa thams cad kyi //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: You are simply revealing your own feeble intellect, for you have uttered nonsense.

original: snga rol gal te yod min na //
analyzed: snga rol gal te yod min na //
translated: If it does not exist prior to

original: lta la sogs pa re re yi //
analyzed: lta la sogs pa re re yi //
translated: all such things as seeing,

original: snga rol de ni ji ltar yod //
analyzed: snga rol de ni ji ltar yod //
translated: how could it exist prior to🔽each such thing as seeing?

original: lta ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi snga rol na gal te yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa thams cad kyi snga rol na gal te yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If it does not exist prior to all such things as seeing,

original: lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yang de yod pa ma yin par nges so //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yang de yod pa ma yin par nges so //
translated: then it definitely does not exist prior to each such thing as seeing.

original: ci ste re re'i snga rol na yod na ni thams cad kyi snga rol na yang de yod par gsal lo //
analyzed: ci ste re re'i snga rol na yod na ni thams cad kyi snga rol na yang de yod par gsal lo //
translated: But if it exists prior to each, then it is clear that it exists prior to all.

original: ci ste de gang gi tshe lta ba'i snga rol na yod pa de'i tshe na nyan pa la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na med pa yin na de dag gi snga rol na med pa gang yin pa de ji ltar nyan pa'i snga rol na med pa🔽bzhin du lta ba spangs te /
analyzed: ci ste de gang gi tshe lta ba'i snga rol na yod pa de'i tshe na nyan pa la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na med pa yin na de dag gi snga rol na med pa gang yin pa de ji ltar nyan pa'i snga rol na med pa bzhin du lta ba spangs te /
translated: But if it exists prior to seeing, then it would not exist prior to hearing and so on. But how could it be that which does not exist prior to hearing,

original: nyan pa'i snga rol na yod par 'gyur /🔽de lta bas na re re'i snga rol na yod kyi /
analyzed: nyan pa'i snga rol na yod par 'gyur / de lta bas na re re'i snga rol na yod kyi /
translated: like seeing, and exist prior to seeing?🔽Therefore, it is untenable to say, “It exists prior to each,

original: thams cad kyi snga rol na med do zhes bya ba de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi snga rol na med do zhes bya ba de ni gyi na'o //
translated: but it does not exist prior to all.”

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gal te re re'i snga rol na //
analyzed: gal te re re'i snga rol na //
translated: if it existed prior to each,

original: lta po de nyid nyan po de //
analyzed: lta po de nyid nyan po de //
translated: then the seer would be the hearer,

original: tshor ba po yang de nyid 'gyur//
analyzed: tshor ba po yang de nyid 'gyur//
translated: and the feeler would be the same.

original: @204a * // de ni de ltar mi rigs so //
analyzed: @204a * // de ni de ltar mi rigs so //
translated: But that is illogical.

original: gal te de lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod par gyur na de lta ba po yang de nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te de lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod par gyur na de lta ba po yang de nyid yin la /
translated: If it existed prior to each, such as seeing, then it would be the seer,

original: nyan pa po yang de nyid yin /
analyzed: nyan pa po yang de nyid yin /
translated: it would be the hearer,

original: tshor ba po yang de nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshor ba po yang de nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: and it would be the feeler.

original: de de ltar na mi rigs so //
analyzed: de de ltar na mi rigs so //
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes bu skar khung tha dad par 'gro ba bzhin du bdag dbang po gzhan du 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes bu skar khung tha dad par 'gro ba bzhin du bdag dbang po gzhan du 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it follows that the self would go to another sense faculty, like a person going to another window.

original: bdag ni dbang po gzhan gang du 'gro bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: bdag ni dbang po gzhan gang du 'gro bar mi 'dod do //
translated: But the self does not want to go to another sense faculty.🔽But if you think, “It is not suitable for the self to go to another sense faculty,”

original: ci ste bdag dbang po gzhan du 'gro bar thal ba der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas lta ba po yang gzhan nyid yin la /
analyzed: ci ste bdag dbang po gzhan du 'gro bar thal ba der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas lta ba po yang gzhan nyid yin la /
translated: then you would imagine that the one who sees is another,

original: nyan pa po yang gzhan nyid yin //
analyzed: nyan pa po yang gzhan nyid yin //
translated: the one who hears is another,

original: tshor ba po yang gzhan nyid yin par rtog na /
analyzed: tshor ba po yang gzhan nyid yin par rtog na /
translated: and the one who feels is another.

original: de la yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: In response to that, we say:

original: gal te lta po gzhan nyid la //🔽nyan pa po gzhan tshor gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te lta po gzhan nyid la // nyan pa po gzhan tshor gzhan na //
translated: If the one who sees is another,🔽and the one who hears is another,

original: lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
analyzed: lta po'i tshe na nyan po yod //
translated: and the one who feels is another,

original: bdag kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur //
translated: then the self would be multiple.

original: gal te lta ba po yang gzhan nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te lta ba po yang gzhan nyid yin la /
translated: If the one who sees is another,

original: nyan pa po yang gzhan nyid yin /
analyzed: nyan pa po yang gzhan nyid yin /
translated: and the one who hears is another,🔽and the one who feels is another,🔽then the self would be multiple.

original: tshor ba po yang gzhan nyid yin par gyur na de lta na lta ba po'i tshe na nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshor ba po yang gzhan nyid yin par gyur na de lta na lta ba po'i tshe na nyan pa po dang tshor ba po yang yod par 'gyur te /
translated: If the seer were one person, the hearer another, and the feeler another still, then at the time of seeing, the hearer and the feeler would exist.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi tshe lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na de dag yod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //🔽kho bo'i lta ba po yang gzhan nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na de dag yod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro // kho bo'i lta ba po yang gzhan nyid yin la /
translated: Because you assert that they exist prior to each of seeing and so on.🔽We say that the seer is one person,

original: nyan pa po yang gzhan nyid yin //
analyzed: nyan pa po yang gzhan nyid yin //
translated: the hearer is another,

original: tshor ba po yang gzhan nyid yin no zhes zer bas /
analyzed: tshor ba po yang gzhan nyid yin no zhes zer bas /
translated: and the feeler is another.

original: de lta na bdag kyang mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na bdag kyang mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it follows that the self would be manifold.

original: ci ste gzhan nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan nyid kyang yin la /
translated: But if the seer is one person,

original: lta ba po'i tshe na nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po med na de lta na yang bdag mi rtag pa nyid dang / bdag mang po nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: lta ba po'i tshe na nyan pa po dang / tshor ba po med na de lta na yang bdag mi rtag pa nyid dang / bdag mang po nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: and the hearer and the feeler do not exist at the time of seeing, then in that case, it follows that the self would be impermanent and manifold, but that also is unacceptable.

original: de lta bas na lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod pa dang / lta ba la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis gsal bar byed do zhes gang smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na lta ba la sogs pa re re'i snga rol na yod pa dang / lta ba la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis gsal bar byed do zhes gang smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that the self exists prior to each of seeing and so on, and that it is clarified by the others such as seeing.

original: smras pa / lta la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na bdag yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: smras pa / lta la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na bdag yod pa nyid do //
translated: Objection: The self exists prior to seeing and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di la ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces gsungs la /
analyzed: 'di la ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces gsungs la /
translated: Here it is said, “The condition of name and form is the six sense spheres.”

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag yin pas de'i phyir 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug 'byung la /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag yin pas de'i phyir 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug 'byung la /
translated: Since “form” refers to the four great elements, the six sense spheres arise due to the condition of the elements.

original: 'byung ba de dag kyang bdag gi nye bar blang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba de dag kyang bdag gi nye bar blang ba yin no //
translated: And those elements are the appropriated aggregates of the self.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'byung ba nye bar len pa po 'byung bas gsal bar byas pa'i bdag gnas pa yod na skye @204b mched drug 'byung zhing rim gyis tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang 'byung bas des na lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na dngos po gnas pa
analyzed: 'byung ba nye bar len pa po 'byung bas gsal bar byas pa'i bdag gnas pa yod na skye @204b mched drug 'byung zhing rim gyis tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang 'byung bas des na lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na dngos po gnas pa
translated: If the self that is the appropriator of the primary elements exists, the six sense bases arise, and in sequence feeling and so on arise. Therefore, prior to seeing and so on, the self exists as an entity.🔽

original: yod do zhes bya ba de 'thad do //
analyzed: yod do zhes bya ba de 'thad do //
translated: If the self that is the appropriator of the primary elements exists, the six sense bases arise, and in sequence, feeling and so on arise. Therefore it is tenable to say that prior to seeing and so on, the thing that endures exists.

original: bshad pa / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //🔽gang las 'gyur ba'i 'byung de la'ang //
analyzed: bshad pa / lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang // gang las 'gyur ba'i 'byung de la'ang //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Seeing, hearing, and so on, And feeling and so on,🔽Do not exist in the primary elements

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: From which they arise.

original: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis gang dag las 'gyur pa'i 'byung ba de dag la yang khyod kyis brtags pa'i dngos po de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba la sogs pa dag rim gyis gang dag las 'gyur pa'i 'byung ba de dag la yang khyod kyis brtags pa'i dngos po de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The thing that you imagine does not exist in the primary elements from which seeing, hearing, and so on, and feeling and so on arise.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'byung ba nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'byung ba nye bar len pa po yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the primary elements are the appropriator.

original: 'byung ba nye bar len pa po de yang 'byung ba dag gi snga rol na gsal bar byed pa med pas mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'byung ba nye bar len pa po de yang 'byung ba dag gi snga rol na gsal bar byed pa med pas mi 'thad do //
translated: But that appropriator of the elements does not exist prior to the elements, because it is not manifest.

original: gang 'byung ba dag gi snga rol na yod pa ma yin pa de ji ltar 'byung ba dag gi nye bar len pa por 'gyur /
analyzed: gang 'byung ba dag gi snga rol na yod pa ma yin pa de ji ltar 'byung ba dag gi nye bar len pa por 'gyur /
translated: How could that which does not exist prior to the elements be the appropriator of the elements?

original: de lta bas na 'byung ba dag la yang de yod pa ma yin na lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'byung ba dag la yang de yod pa ma yin na lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Thus, since it does not exist in relation to the elements, how could it exist prior to seeing and so on?

original: smras pa / lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na de yod kyang rung med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: smras pa / lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na de yod kyang rung med kyang rung ste /
translated: Objection: Whether or not it exists prior to seeing and so on,

original: yod ni re zhig lta ba la sogs pa dag ni yod de /
analyzed: yod ni re zhig lta ba la sogs pa dag ni yod de /
translated: seeing and so on exist.

original: khyod kyis sngar /🔽ci med gang zhig ga la yod //🔽gang med ci zhig ga la yod //
analyzed: khyod kyis sngar / ci med gang zhig ga la yod // gang med ci zhig ga la yod //
translated: Previously you said:🔽How could something nonexistent be?

original: ces smras pas /
analyzed: ces smras pas /
translated: How could nothing be something?

original: de'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag yod do //
translated: Therefore, seeing and so on exist.

original: gang zhig med na ci zhig kyang med pas de'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag gang gi yin pa'i dngos po gang zhig po de yang yod do //
analyzed: gang zhig med na ci zhig kyang med pas de'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag gang gi yin pa'i dngos po gang zhig po de yang yod do //
translated: Since if something does not exist, then something else also does not exist, therefore, since the things that are the appropriators of such things as seeing exist, the appropriator also exists.

original: bshad pa / gang med ci zhig ga la yod //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang med ci zhig ga la yod //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If something does not exist, how could something exist?

original: ces bya ba des de'i lan btab zin to //
analyzed: ces bya ba des de'i lan btab zin to //
translated: This response has already been given.

original: ji ltar zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na //
translated: How?🔽Seeing, hearing, and so on,

original: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
analyzed: lta dang nyan la sogs pa dang // tshor ba dag la sogs pa yang //
translated: And feeling and so on,

original: gang gi yin pa gal te med //
analyzed: gang gi yin pa gal te med //
translated: If that which possesses them does not exist,

original: de dag kyang ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: de dag kyang ni yod ma yin //
translated: They also would not exist.

original: lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag gi snga rol na dngos po gang zhig po med do zhes bya ba de ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag gi snga rol na dngos po gang zhig po med do zhes bya ba de ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has been explained earlier that prior to such things as seeing, the thing that possesses them does not exist.

original: gang med ci zhig ga la yod ces bya ba de yang bstan zin te /
analyzed: gang med ci zhig ga la yod ces bya ba de yang bstan zin te /
translated: It has also been explained that if something does not exist, how could something else exist?

original: de'i phyir gal te lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag rab tu sgrub par byed cing lta ba la sogs pa dag gang gi yin par 'gyur ba gang zhig po de nyid med na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag rab tu sgrub par byed cing lta ba la sogs pa dag gang gi yin par 'gyur ba gang zhig po de nyid med na /
translated: Therefore, if the thing that possesses such things as seeing does not exist, then how could such things as seeing be established?

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag rab tu 'grub par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag rab tu 'grub par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could seeing and so on be established?

original: gang gi lta ba la sogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi lta ba la sogs par 'gyur /
translated: How could seeing and so on be established?

original: de lta bas na dngos po gang zhig po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po gang zhig po med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since any entity does not exist,

original: @205a * // lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag kyang med la /
analyzed: @205a * // lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag kyang med la /
translated: any seeing and so on also does not exist.

original: lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag med na khyod kyi dngos po gang zhig yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa ci zhig po dag med na khyod kyi dngos po gang zhig yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If any seeing and so on does not exist, how could any entity exist for you?

original: smras pa / ci khyod kyi dngos po gang zhig po med pa de shin tu nges pa yin nam /
analyzed: smras pa / ci khyod kyi dngos po gang zhig po med pa de shin tu nges pa yin nam /
translated: Objection: Are you certain that any entity does not exist?🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gang zhig lta la sogs pa yi //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang zhig lta la sogs pa yi //
translated: Prior to seeing and so on,

original: snga rol da ltar phyi na med //
analyzed: snga rol da ltar phyi na med //
translated: it does not exist now or later.🔽The conceptions

original: de la yod do med do zhes //
analyzed: de la yod do med do zhes //
translated: “It exists” or “It does not exist”

original: rtog pa dag ni ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtog pa dag ni ldog par 'gyur //
translated: cease.

original: gang zhig po lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol dang lta ba la sogs pa dag dang / da ltar lhan cig dang / lta ba la sogs pa dag gi phyi dus rnam pa thams cad du btsal na /
analyzed: gang zhig po lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol dang lta ba la sogs pa dag dang / da ltar lhan cig dang / lta ba la sogs pa dag gi phyi dus rnam pa thams cad du btsal na /
translated: If you search in every way for any entity prior to seeing and so on, simultaneously with seeing and so on, and after seeing and so on,

original: de 'di'o zhes rang gis rab tu grub pa med pa de la lta ba la sogs pa dag gis yod do med do zhes gdags pa'i rtog pa dag ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'di'o zhes rang gis rab tu grub pa med pa de la lta ba la sogs pa dag gis yod do med do zhes gdags pa'i rtog pa dag ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is not established by itself as “this,” the conceptions of “it exists” and “it does not exist” in terms of seeing and so on are reversed.

original: re zhig rang nyid rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir de yod do zhes ji skad brjod par nus /
analyzed: re zhig rang nyid rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir de yod do zhes ji skad brjod par nus /
translated: First, since it is not established by itself, how can one say “it exists”?

original: lta ba la sogs pa dag gis gsal bar byed pa'i phyir de med do zhes kyang ji skad brjod par nus te /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa dag gis gsal bar byed pa'i phyir de med do zhes kyang ji skad brjod par nus te /
translated: Since it is illuminated by seeing and so on, how can one say “it does not exist”?

original: de'i phyir de la yod do med do zhes rtog pa dag mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la yod do med do zhes rtog pa dag mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, the conceptions of “it exists” and “it does not exist” are untenable.

original: de lta bas na byed pa po dang las dag bzhin du nye bar len pa de yang gdags par zad kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na byed pa po dang las dag bzhin du nye bar len pa de yang gdags par zad kyi /
translated: Thus, like the agent and action, the appropriator is also a mere imputation.

original: de ma gtogs par 'grub pa gzhan mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ma gtogs par 'grub pa gzhan mi 'thad do //
translated: Apart from that, another establishment is untenable.

original: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa dgu pa'o /🔽// / smras pa /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa dgu pa'o / // / smras pa /
translated: This is the ninth chapter, called the Critique of the Apprehender and the Apprehended.

original: me dang bud shing dag bzhin du /
analyzed: me dang bud shing dag bzhin du /
translated: Objection: Like fire and fuel,

original: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag rab tu 'grub kyi /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag rab tu 'grub kyi /
translated: The appropriator and that appropriated are established,

original: byed pa po dang las dag bzhin du rab tu mi 'grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dag bzhin du rab tu mi 'grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not like the agent and action.

original: bshad pa / gal te me bud shing rab tu grub na ni de dag kyang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te me bud shing rab tu grub na ni de dag kyang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If fire and fuel were established, they would also be established.

original: gang gi tshe me dang bud shing dag byed pa po dang las dag kho na bzhin du rab tu mi 'grub pa de'i tshe nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba dag ji ltar rab tu 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe me dang bud shing dag byed pa po dang las dag kho na bzhin du rab tu mi 'grub pa de'i tshe nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba dag ji ltar rab tu 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: But when fire and fuel are not established like the agent and action, how could the appropriator and that appropriated be established?

original: gal te med dang bud shing dag ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu grub par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te med dang bud shing dag ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu grub par gyur na /
translated: If fire and fuel were established by their own intrinsic reality,

original: gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du rab tu 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du rab tu 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
translated: they would be established as the same or different.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But both are untenable.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: bud shing gang de me yin na //
analyzed: bud shing gang de me yin na //
translated: If that fuel is fire,

original: byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur //
translated: the agent and action would be the same.

original: gal te re zhig bud shing gang kho na yin pa de nyid me yin par rab tu rtog na /
analyzed: gal te re zhig bud shing gang kho na yin pa de nyid me yin par rab tu rtog na /
translated: If you think that fire is just fuel,

original: de lta na byed pa po dang las gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na byed pa po dang las gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that the agent and object of action are the same.

original: de la me ni @205b sreg par byed pa'o zhes bya ba dag mi srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la me ni @205b sreg par byed pa'o zhes bya ba dag mi srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be impossible to say, “Fire burns fuel.”

original: ci ste gcig pa nyid yin yang de dag srid na ni me ni sreg par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste gcig pa nyid yin yang de dag srid na ni me ni sreg par byed pa'o //
translated: But if it were possible for them to be the same, then it would be possible to say, “Fire burns fuel,”

original: bud shing ni bsreg par bya ba'o zhes bya ba dag kyang srid par 'gyur ba zhig na mi srid par 'gyur ba zhig na mi srid pas de lta bas na de gnyis gcig pa nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bud shing ni bsreg par bya ba'o zhes bya ba dag kyang srid par 'gyur ba zhig na mi srid par 'gyur ba zhig na mi srid pas de lta bas na de gnyis gcig pa nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: but it is not possible, and therefore it is untenable that they are the same.

original: de la bud shing las me gzhan nyid yin par sems na /
analyzed: de la bud shing las me gzhan nyid yin par sems na /
translated: If you think that fire is different from fuel,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna addresses this point:

original: gal te shing las me gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te shing las me gzhan na //
translated: If fire were different from fuel,

original: shing med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: shing med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: it would arise even without fuel.

original: gal te bud shing las me gzhan nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bud shing las me gzhan nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: If fire were different from fuel,🔽then it would arise even without fuel.

original: bud shing med cing bud shing ma gtogs par kho nar yang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: bud shing med cing bud shing ma gtogs par kho nar yang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: and it would occur without fuel, but not only without fuel.

original: bud shing med par me 'byung bas de lta bas na de nyid gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bud shing med par me 'byung bas de lta bas na de nyid gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But fire occurs without fuel. Therefore, it is not tenable that it is the same or different.

original: yang gzhan yang //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang //
translated: Moreover,

original: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: it would always be burning.

original: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung //
analyzed: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung //
translated: It would arise without a cause of burning.

original: rtsom pa don med nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rtsom pa don med nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Initiation would be pointless.

original: de ltar yin na las kyang med //
analyzed: de ltar yin na las kyang med //
translated: And in that case, there would be no karma.

original: gal te bud shing las me gzhan nyid yin par gyur na rtag tu 'bar na nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bud shing las me gzhan nyid yin par gyur na rtag tu 'bar na nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If fire were different from fuel, it would always be burning,

original: 'di ltar 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would arise without a cause of burning.

original: de'i 'bar bar byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni 'bar byed kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bar bar byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni 'bar byed kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of its burning is the cause of burning.

original: 'bar bar byed pa'i rgyu med pa ni 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'bar bar byed pa'i rgyu med pa ni 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: It would arise without a cause of burning.

original: 'bar bar byed pa med pa kho nar mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bar bar byed pa med pa kho nar mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It would not occur only without a cause of burning. This is the meaning.

original: rtsom pa don med pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsom pa don med pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, the activity would be pointless.

original: de lta yin na las med pa'i mer yang 'gyur te /🔽me zhes bya ba 'di ni sreg par byed pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i las bstan du med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na las med pa'i mer yang 'gyur te / me zhes bya ba 'di ni sreg par byed pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i las bstan du med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then fire would be without activity.🔽The so-called fire would be without the activity of burning.🔽 Objection: But it was explained that fire arises without a cause. How is that?

original: smras pa / me 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa de ji lta bu /
analyzed: smras pa / me 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa de ji lta bu /
translated: In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bshad pa / gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it does not depend on another,

original: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung //🔽gang gi phyir bud shing las me gzhan nyid yin par gyur na bud shing med par yang 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung // gang gi phyir bud shing las me gzhan nyid yin par gyur na bud shing med par yang 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin te /
translated: It arises without a cause of burning.🔽If fire were different from fuel, it would follow that it would arise without fuel. Therefore it does not depend on another.

original: 'di ltar me bud shing la ltos na ni gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas par gyur na de yang de la bud shing med pas gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar me bud shing la ltos na ni gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas par gyur na de yang de la bud shing med pas gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin la /
translated: In this way, if fire depended on fuel, it would depend on another. But since it does not exist in that, it does not depend on another.

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would not depend on another, it would arise without a cause for its burning.

original: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'gyur na rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du @206a * //🔽thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung bar 'gyur na rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du @206a * // thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it arose without a cause for its burning, it would follow that it would always be burning.

original: 'di ltar me 'bar byed la ltos na ni 'bar byed med na de 'chi bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di ltar me 'bar byed la ltos na ni 'bar byed med na de 'chi bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: For if fire depended on a cause for its burning, then without a cause for its burning, it would go out.

original: de la 'bar byed de yang med pas rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'bar byed de yang med pas rtag tu 'bar ba nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But since it would not have a cause for its burning, it would follow that it would always be burning.

original: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid yin na //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bar ba nyid yin na //
translated: If it were always burning,

original: rtsom pa don med nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rtsom pa don med nyid du 'gyur //
translated: then the effort to light it would be pointless.

original: me rtag tu 'bar ba nyid yin na ni byung ba dang spar ba la sogs pa rtsom pa dag don med pa nyid du'ang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me rtag tu 'bar ba nyid yin na ni byung ba dang spar ba la sogs pa rtsom pa dag don med pa nyid du'ang 'gyur ro //
translated: If fire were always burning, then the effort to light it and to keep it burning would be pointless.

original: de lta na las med par yang thal bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de lta na las med par yang thal bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: In that case, it would follow that it would be without action.

original: rnam pa de lta bu ni mi 'thad pas me med pa nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu ni mi 'thad pas me med pa nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And since that is not tenable, it would follow that it would be without fire.

original: de la gal te 'di snyam du //
analyzed: de la gal te 'di snyam du //
translated: If you think that

original: sreg shing bud shing yin sems na //
analyzed: sreg shing bud shing yin sems na //
translated: If you think that fuel is the fire’s fuel,

original: de la gal te la las 'di snyam du gang gi phyir mes khyab cing mes bsreg bzhin pa bud shing yin pa de'i phyir gzhan nyid yin yang me la bud shing med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la gal te la las 'di snyam du gang gi phyir mes khyab cing mes bsreg bzhin pa bud shing yin pa de'i phyir gzhan nyid yin yang me la bud shing med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If someone thought as follows: Because it is pervaded by fire and is being burned by fire, it is fuel. Therefore, even though it is different from fire, fuel is not nonexistent in fire.

original: bud shing dang bcas pa nyid yin pas de la bud shing med par thal bar gyur na skyon gang dag bstan pa de dag tu mi 'gyur bar sems na /
analyzed: bud shing dang bcas pa nyid yin pas de la bud shing med par thal bar gyur na skyon gang dag bstan pa de dag tu mi 'gyur bar sems na /
translated: Since it possesses fuel, the error that has been shown to arise if fuel is nonexistent would not occur.

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:

original: gang tshe de tsam de yin na //
analyzed: gang tshe de tsam de yin na //
translated: If it is just that, it is that.

original: gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
analyzed: gang gis bud shing de sreg byed //
translated: By what is that fuel burned?

original: gang gi tshe bsreg bzhin pa de tsam na de nyid yin zhing gzhan gang dang ldan pas kyang bsreg bzhin pa ma yin na bud shing gi gnas skabs kyi snga rol na me zhes bya ba gang gis khyab cing gang gis bsreg bzhin pa na bud shing yin
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsreg bzhin pa de tsam na de nyid yin zhing gzhan gang dang ldan pas kyang bsreg bzhin pa ma yin na bud shing gi gnas skabs kyi snga rol na me zhes bya ba gang gis khyab cing gang gis bsreg bzhin pa na bud shing yin
translated: If it is just that which is being burned, it is that. If it is not being burned by anything else, then prior to the state of being fuel, by what other fire is it pervaded and by what is it being burned such that it becomes fuel?

original: par 'gyur ba gzhan de gang yin /
analyzed: par 'gyur ba gzhan de gang yin /
translated: What is that other fire?

original: bsreg bzhin pa'i gnas skabs nyid la yang ci bud shing gang kho na yin pa de nyid me yin nam /🔽'on te me yang gzhan la bud shing kyang gzhan zhes bsam pa 'di 'byung la /
analyzed: bsreg bzhin pa'i gnas skabs nyid la yang ci bud shing gang kho na yin pa de nyid me yin nam / 'on te me yang gzhan la bud shing kyang gzhan zhes bsam pa 'di 'byung la /
translated: But at the very time of burning, the thought occurs: “Is that which is fuel just fire, or is the fire one thing and the fuel another?”🔽And you say that at the very time of burning, that which is pervaded by fire and being burned by fire is fuel.

original: khyod kyis kyang bsreg bzhin pa'i gnas skabs nyid la mes khyab cing mes bsreg bzhin pa bud shing yin no zhes smras pa de'i tshe gang gi phyir mes khyab cing mes bsreg bzhin pa bud shing yin pa de'i phyir me la bud shing med pa ma yin no🔽zhes bya ba de ji ltar smra ba rigs so //
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang bsreg bzhin pa'i gnas skabs nyid la mes khyab cing mes bsreg bzhin pa bud shing yin no zhes smras pa de'i tshe gang gi phyir mes khyab cing mes bsreg bzhin pa bud shing yin pa de'i phyir me la bud shing med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ji ltar smra ba rigs so //
translated: But when you say that at the very time of burning, that which is pervaded by fire and being burned by fire is fuel, then how could it be logical to say, “Because that which is pervaded by fire and being burned by fire is fuel, therefore fire is not without fuel”?

original: de lta bas na gzhan nyid yin na yang skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba de dag son gnas bzhin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan nyid yin na yang skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba de dag son gnas bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, even if they were different, the absurd consequence would ensue, just as in the case of the traveler and the resting place.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: gzhan na mi phrad phrad med na //🔽sreg par mi 'gyur mi sreg na //
analyzed: gzhan na mi phrad phrad med na // sreg par mi 'gyur mi sreg na //
translated: If different, they would not make contact.🔽If they did not make contact,🔽there would be no burning.

original: 'chi bar mi 'gyur mi 'chi na //
analyzed: 'chi bar mi 'gyur mi 'chi na //
translated: If there were no burning,🔽they would remain as they are,

original: rang gi brtags dang ldan par gnas //
analyzed: rang gi brtags dang ldan par gnas //
translated: endowed with their own characteristics.

original: me gzhan yin na bud shing dang mi phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me gzhan yin na bud shing dang mi phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If fire were different from fuel, it would not contact fuel.

original: phrad pa med na de sreg par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrad pa med na de sreg par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not contact fuel, it would not burn.

original: ci ste phrad pa @206b med kyang sreg par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: ci ste phrad pa @206b med kyang sreg par 'gyur na ni /
translated: But if it burned without contacting fuel,

original: phyogs gcig na 'dug pas 'gro ba mtha' dag sreg par 'gyur bas de'i phyir phrad pa de mi 'thad pas gzhan nyid yin yang bsreg bzhin pa na bud shing yin no zhes gang smras pa de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig na 'dug pas 'gro ba mtha' dag sreg par 'gyur bas de'i phyir phrad pa de mi 'thad pas gzhan nyid yin yang bsreg bzhin pa na bud shing yin no zhes gang smras pa de mi 'thad do //
translated: then it would burn the entire world without exception, since it would be present everywhere. Therefore, since it is untenable that it contacts fuel, it is untenable to state, “When it burns, it is fuel, even though it is different from fuel.”

original: mi sreg na 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi sreg na 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not burn, it would not die.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar mes bud shing bsregs na ni bud shing zad pas 'chi bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mes bud shing bsregs na ni bud shing zad pas 'chi bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If fire burned fuel, it would die because the fuel would be exhausted.

original: mi sreg pa la 'chi ba rgyu med pa las byung ba ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi sreg pa la 'chi ba rgyu med pa las byung ba ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: But if it does not burn, how could it die without a cause?

original: mi 'chi na ni gzhan la mi ltos pa 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba rtag tu 'bar ba dang / gang gi rtags dang ldan pa ther zug tu gnas nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'chi na ni gzhan la mi ltos pa 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba rtag tu 'bar ba dang / gang gi rtags dang ldan pa ther zug tu gnas nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.

original: yang na ni de bud shing las gzhan ma yin par 'gyur ro //🔽smras pa / me gzhan yin na bud shing dang mi phrad par 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa de la smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na ni de bud shing las gzhan ma yin par 'gyur ro // smras pa / me gzhan yin na bud shing dang mi phrad par 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa de la smra bar bya ste /
translated: Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.

original: gal te shing las me gzhan yang //🔽shing dang phrad du rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te shing las me gzhan yang // shing dang phrad du rung bar 'gyur //
translated: Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.🔽Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.

original: gal te bud shing las me gzhan yin na yang bud shing dang phrad du rung bar 'gyur ro //🔽ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bud shing las me gzhan yin na yang bud shing dang phrad du rung bar 'gyur ro // ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.🔽Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.🔽Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.🔽Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.🔽Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.🔽Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.🔽Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.🔽Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.🔽Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.🔽Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.

original: ji ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar bud med skyes pa dang // skyes pa'ang bud med phrad pa bzhin //
translated: Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures as long as the world.

original: bshad pa / gal te med dang shing dag ni //🔽gcig gis gcig ni bsal gyur na //🔽shing las me gzhan nyid yin yang //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te med dang shing dag ni //🔽gcig gis gcig ni bsal gyur na //🔽shing las me gzhan nyid yin yang //
translated: Or else, it would be like the self of the Enumerators, which is permanent and endures

original: shing dang phrad par 'dod la rag / gal te me dang bud shing dag skyes pa dang bud med dag bzhin du gcig gis gcig bsal bar gyur na ni bud shing las me gzhan nyid yin yang khyod kyi yid la bsams ba bzhin du /
analyzed: shing dang phrad par 'dod la rag / gal te me dang bud shing dag skyes pa dang bud med dag bzhin du gcig gis gcig bsal bar gyur na ni bud shing las me gzhan nyid yin yang khyod kyi yid la bsams ba bzhin du /
translated: If fire and fuel were mutually exclusive, like a man and a woman, then even though fire would be different from fuel,🔽you could still assert that fire comes into contact with fuel, just as you assert that a man comes into contact with a woman and a woman comes into contact with a man.

original: ji ltar bud med skyes pa dang phrad pa dang / skyes pa bud med dang phrad pa bzhin du bud shing dang phrad par yang 'dod la rag na gang gi tshe bsreg bzhin pa'i gnas skabs nyid la bsam pa 'di 'byung ba de'i tshe me dang bud shing phrad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de 'thad par ga
analyzed: ji ltar bud med skyes pa dang phrad pa dang / skyes pa bud med dang phrad pa bzhin du bud shing dang phrad par yang 'dod la rag na gang gi tshe bsreg bzhin pa'i gnas skabs nyid la bsam pa 'di 'byung ba de'i tshe me dang bud shing phrad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de 'thad par ga
translated: But when you think about it, it is not tenable to say that fire and fuel come into contact.

original: la 'gyur / smras pa /🔽'dir de gnyis gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la /🔽gzhan nyid kyang ma yin pa de nyid rigs pas de gnyis gcig pa nyid dam /
analyzed: la 'gyur / smras pa / 'dir de gnyis gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin la / gzhan nyid kyang ma yin pa de nyid rigs pas de gnyis gcig pa nyid dam /
translated: Objection:🔽Here, those two are neither identical nor different.

original: gzhan nyid du ma gyur kyang go sla ste /
analyzed: gzhan nyid du ma gyur kyang go sla ste /
translated: Even though those two are neither identical nor different, it is easy to understand that they are not tenable as identical or different.

original: re zhig me dang bud shing dag ni rab tu grub pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig me dang bud shing dag ni rab tu grub pa yin no //
translated: First, fire and fuel are established.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / de ni bzhad gang kho nar 'gyur te //
analyzed: bshad pa / de ni bzhad gang kho nar 'gyur te //
translated: This is just laughable!🔽If things are not established

original: gang dag dngos po gcig pa dang // dngos po gzhan pa nyid du ni //🔽grub par gyur pa yod mid pa //
analyzed: gang dag dngos po gcig pa dang // dngos po gzhan pa nyid du ni // grub par gyur pa yod mid pa //
translated: As the same or different,

original: de gnyis grub pa hi ltar yod //🔽smras pa // phan @207a * //
analyzed: de gnyis grub pa hi ltar yod // smras pa // phan @207a * //
translated: How could those two be established?

original: tshun ltos pa las bud shing la ltos nas me yin la /
analyzed: tshun ltos pa las bud shing la ltos nas me yin la /
translated: Objection: They are established through mutual dependence. In dependence on fuel there is fire,

original: me la ltos nas bud shing yin no //🔽bshad pa / gal te shing ltos me yin la //🔽gal te me ltos shing yin na //
analyzed: me la ltos nas bud shing yin no // bshad pa / gal te shing ltos me yin la // gal te me ltos shing yin na //
translated: and in dependence on fire there is fuel.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:🔽If fire exists in dependence on fuel,

original: gang la ltos pa'i me dang shing //
analyzed: gang la ltos pa'i me dang shing //
translated: and if fuel exists in dependence on fire,

original: dang por grub pa gang zhig yin //🔽gal te bud shing la ltos nas me yin la /
analyzed: dang por grub pa gang zhig yin // gal te bud shing la ltos nas me yin la /
translated: Which of these two would exist first,🔽the fire that exists in dependence on fuel,🔽or the fuel that exists in dependence on fire?🔽If fire exists in dependence on fuel,

original: me la ltos nas kyang shing yin na //🔽gang la ltos nas me yin par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: me la ltos nas kyang shing yin na // gang la ltos nas me yin par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: and if fuel exists in dependence on fire,🔽which of these two would exist first, the fire that exists in dependence on fuel,

original: bud shing yin par 'gyur ba de gnyis las dang por grub pa gang yin /
analyzed: bud shing yin par 'gyur ba de gnyis las dang por grub pa gang yin /
translated: or the fuel that exists in dependence on fire?

original: de la 'di snyam du bud shing dang por grub pa de la ltos nas me yin par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du bud shing dang por grub pa de la ltos nas me yin par sems na /
translated: But if you think that fire is established in dependence on fuel that was established earlier,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gal te shing ltos me yin na //
analyzed: gal te shing ltos me yin na //
translated: If fire is established in dependence on fuel,

original: me grub pa la sgrub par 'gyur //
analyzed: me grub pa la sgrub par 'gyur //
translated: then fire would be established in what is established.

original: gal te bud shing dang por grub pa la de ltos nas me yin par 'gyur na de ltar na me grub zin pa la yang sgrub par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te bud shing dang por grub pa la de ltos nas me yin par 'gyur na de ltar na me grub zin pa la yang sgrub par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If fire were established in dependence on fuel that was established earlier, then fire would be established in what is already established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar me grub na bud shing la ltos par 'thad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar me grub na bud shing la ltos par 'thad kyi /
translated: If fire is established, it is tenable that it depends on fuel.

original: me ma grub cing med na ji ltar bud shing la ltos par byed do //
analyzed: me ma grub cing med na ji ltar bud shing la ltos par byed do //
translated: But if fire is not established and does not exist, how could it depend on fuel?

original: de'i phyir bud shing med par yang me rang gis grub pa ltos par nus pa la khyod yang bud shing la ltos nas rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ba don med pa yod dam /
analyzed: de'i phyir bud shing med par yang me rang gis grub pa ltos par nus pa la khyod yang bud shing la ltos nas rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ba don med pa yod dam /
