translated: Therefore, if fire could be established without fuel, then it would be pointless for you to say that fire is established in dependence on fuel.

original: yang gzhan yang /🔽bud par bya ba'i shing la yang //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / bud par bya ba'i shing la yang //
translated: Moreover:🔽Fuel would also exist

original: me med par ni 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: me med par ni 'gyur ba yin //
translated: without fire.

original: de lta na bud shing la yang me med par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na bud shing la yang me med par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: In that case, fire would also not exist in relation to fuel.

original: 'di ltar bud shing yang grub pa na me la ltos par 'thad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bud shing yang grub pa na me la ltos par 'thad kyi /
translated: In this way, when fuel is established, it is tenable that it relies on fire.

original: bud shing ma grub cing med na ji ltar me la ltos par byed do //
analyzed: bud shing ma grub cing med na ji ltar me la ltos par byed do //
translated: But if fuel is not established and does not exist, how could it rely on fire?

original: de'i phyir bud shing de nyid kyang me med par rang gis rab tu grub par thal bar 'gyur ba la khyod yang me la ltos nas rab tu 'grub pa don med pa la rtog par byed dam /
analyzed: de'i phyir bud shing de nyid kyang me med par rang gis rab tu grub par thal bar 'gyur ba la khyod yang me la ltos nas rab tu 'grub pa don med pa la rtog par byed dam /
translated: Therefore, it follows that fuel would be established on its own without fire. But you imagine that it is established in reliance on fire.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: That being so,

original: de gnyis ni phan tshun ltos te 'grub par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de gnyis ni phan tshun ltos te 'grub par mi 'thad do //
translated: it is untenable that those two are established in mutual reliance.

original: de bzhin du me sngar grub pa la ltos nas bud shing 'grub par rtog na yang skyon dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du me sngar grub pa la ltos nas bud shing 'grub par rtog na yang skyon dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, if you imagine that fuel is established in reliance on fire that is already established, the error would be the same.

original: smras pa / ci ma smras pa la skyon de lta bu 'dogs par byed dam /
analyzed: smras pa / ci ma smras pa la skyon de lta bu 'dogs par byed dam /
translated: Objection: Do you impute such an error to what is not even stated?

original: gang gi tshe kho bos de dag phan tshun ltos te 'grub bo zhes smras pa de'i tshe de dag la dang por grub pa gang yin zhes bya ba dang / gal te de dag las gang yang rung ba dang por grub par gyur na phan tshun ltos pa nyid mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba de dag gang gi lan yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kho bos de dag phan tshun ltos te 'grub bo zhes smras pa de'i tshe de dag la dang por grub pa gang yin zhes bya ba dang / gal te de dag las gang yang rung ba dang por grub par gyur na phan tshun ltos pa nyid mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba de dag gang gi lan yin /
translated: When we say that they are established in mutual dependence, then at that time, what is the response to the question, “Which is established first?” and “If any of them were established first, then mutual dependence would not be established?”

original: bshad pa / phan tshun ltos te 'grub par rtog na gang yang rung ba dang por 'grub @207b par mi 'dod du zin kyang de lta na phan tshun ltos pa 'grub par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bshad pa / phan tshun ltos te 'grub par rtog na gang yang rung ba dang por 'grub @207b par mi 'dod du zin kyang de lta na phan tshun ltos pa 'grub par mi 'thad do //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If you think they are established in mutual dependence, then even though you do not assert that any of them are established first, still it is untenable that they are established in mutual dependence.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gal te dngos po gang ltos 'grub //
analyzed: gal te dngos po gang ltos 'grub //
translated: If things are established in dependence,

original: de nyid la yang ltos nas ni //🔽ltos bya gang yin de 'grub na //
analyzed: de nyid la yang ltos nas ni // ltos bya gang yin de 'grub na //
translated: Then depending on what🔽Would that which is depended on be established?

original: gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub //
analyzed: gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub //
translated: Depending on what would it be established?

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa ni dngos po gzhan la ltos nas 'grub cing bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po de nyid la yang ltos nas bsgrub par bya grub par bya ba'i phyir ltos par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan gang yin pa de🔽'grub na / 'o na grub par 'dod pa gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub pa de smros shig / ci khyod kyi rna lam du skye bo mkhas pa'i kha nas brjod pa'i tshig de dag ni phan tshun ltos pa dag yin la /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa ni dngos po gzhan la ltos nas 'grub cing bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po de nyid la yang ltos nas bsgrub par bya grub par bya ba'i phyir ltos par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan gang yin pa de 'grub na / 'o na grub par 'dod pa gang la ltos nas gang zhig 'grub pa de smros shig / ci khyod kyi rna lam du skye bo mkhas pa'i kha nas brjod pa'i tshig de dag ni phan tshun ltos pa dag yin la /
translated: If the thing that is to be established is established in reliance on another thing, and that very thing to be established is established in reliance on another thing that is to be established, then tell us what is to be established that is established in reliance on what is to be established?🔽If you say that the thing to be established is established in reliance on the thing that is to be established, then tell us what is to be established that is established in reliance on what is to be established?

original: phan tshun ltos pa dag ni mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba de sngon chad ma grags sam /
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa dag ni mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba de sngon chad ma grags sam /
translated: Have you never heard the words spoken by the mouths of scholars that things that mutually rely on each other🔽are not established?

original: dper na gru la bstod pa gcig gi skyabs su gcig mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gru la bstod pa gcig gi skyabs su gcig mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like one boat not being the support of another boat.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin na khyod ngo tsha bor te de dag phan tshun ltos te 'grub bo zhes gsang bstod de smra 'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin na khyod ngo tsha bor te de dag phan tshun ltos te 'grub bo zhes gsang bstod de smra 'am /
translated: Since that is so, why do you abandon shame and say with a loud voice, “They are established through mutual reliance”?

original: re zhig mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid kyis legs par soms la de smros shig / dngos po ltos 'grub gang yin pa //
analyzed: re zhig mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid kyis legs par soms la de smros shig / dngos po ltos 'grub gang yin pa //
translated: First, you should think well with a mind of equipoise and then speak.🔽How can that which is established in dependence

original: de ma grub na ji ltar ltos //🔽dngos po gang dngos po gzhan la ltos te 'grub bo zhes brjod pa'i dngos po de ma grub cing /
analyzed: de ma grub na ji ltar ltos // dngos po gang dngos po gzhan la ltos te 'grub bo zhes brjod pa'i dngos po de ma grub cing /
translated: On something else be established if that does not exist?

original: med na ji ltar ltos par byed //
analyzed: med na ji ltar ltos par byed //
translated: If you say that an entity is established in dependence on another entity, how can that entity be established if it does not exist?

original: de ma grub cing med pa la yang ji ltar ltos par bya /🔽ci ste grub pa ltos she na //
analyzed: de ma grub cing med pa la yang ji ltar ltos par bya / ci ste grub pa ltos she na //
translated: How can that which is not established and does not exist depend on another?

original: ci ste yang khyod grub pa nyid gzhan la ltos kyi /
analyzed: ci ste yang khyod grub pa nyid gzhan la ltos kyi /
translated: But if you think that that which is established depends on another,🔽then if you think that that which is established depends on another,

original: ma grub pa la ni mi ltos la grub pa la yang ci zhig ltos par sems na /
analyzed: ma grub pa la ni mi ltos la grub pa la yang ci zhig ltos par sems na /
translated: but that which is not established does not depend on another, and that which is established depends on another,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni ltos par mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical that it depends on another.

original: dngos po grub cing yod pa yang grub par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa ni don med pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
analyzed: dngos po grub cing yod pa yang grub par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa ni don med pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical that an entity that is established and exists depends on another because it is pointless.

original: dngos po grub cing yod pa la gzhan la ltos pas ci bya /
analyzed: dngos po grub cing yod pa la gzhan la ltos pas ci bya /
translated: What use is it for an entity that is established and exists to depend on another?

original: grub cing yod pa la gzhan ltos pas kyang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: grub cing yod pa la gzhan ltos pas kyang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is established and exists depend on another?

original: de lta bas na grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir med bud shing dag la ltos te 'grub par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir med bud shing dag la ltos te 'grub par mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, because it is untenable that that which is established and that which is not established are mutually dependent, it is untenable that fire is established in dependence on fuel.

original: me dang bud shing gi skabs su dngos po'i tshig smros pa ni me dang bud shing dag kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: me dang bud shing gi skabs su dngos po'i tshig smros pa ni me dang bud shing dag kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term “thing” is mentioned in the context of fire and fuel because fire and fuel are things.

original: 'og nas kyang /
analyzed: 'og nas kyang /
translated: Later, Candrakīrti will say:

original: bum snam la sogs lhan cig tu //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bum snam la sogs lhan cig tu // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: “A pot, a cloth, and so on are not things.”

original: de'i phyir 'di ni dngos po thams cad brtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po zhes smros so //🔽shing ma ltos pa'i @208a * //🔽me med de //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni dngos po thams cad brtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po zhes smros so // shing ma ltos pa'i @208a * // me med de //
translated: Therefore, since this is an analysis of all things, he says “thing.”🔽Fire does not exist without fuel.

original: shing la ma ltos me yang med //🔽me la ltos pa'i shing med de //
analyzed: shing la ma ltos me yang med // me la ltos pa'i shing med de //
translated: Fire does not exist without fuel.🔽Fuel does not exist in dependence on fire.

original: me la ma ltos shing yang med //
analyzed: me la ma ltos shing yang med //
translated: Fuel does not exist without fire.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rigs pa sngon du btang ste yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na bud shing la ltos pa'i me med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rigs pa sngon du btang ste yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na bud shing la ltos pa'i me med de /
translated: Therefore, when one analyzes in this way, using reason to examine reality just as it is, fire does not depend on fuel.

original: me dang bud shing grub pa dang // ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me dang bud shing grub pa dang // ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that fire and fuel are established in dependence on each other.

original: bud shing la ma ltos pa'i me yang med de /
analyzed: bud shing la ma ltos pa'i me yang med de /
translated: Fire does not exist without depending on fuel.

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa dang / 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / rtag tu 'bar bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa dang / 'bar byed med pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / rtag tu 'bar bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would arise without depending on another, it would arise without a cause, and it would be burning forever.

original: de ni me la ltos pa'i bud shing yang med de /
analyzed: de ni me la ltos pa'i bud shing yang med de /
translated: Fuel does not exist in dependence on fire.

original: me dang bud shing grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me dang bud shing grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that fire and fuel are established in dependence on each other.

original: me la ma ltos pa'i bud shing yang med de /
analyzed: me la ma ltos pa'i bud shing yang med de /
translated: Fuel does not exist without depending on fire.

original: 'di ltar me med cing bsreg bzhin pa ma yin pa bud shing du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar me med cing bsreg bzhin pa ma yin pa bud shing du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Because how could that which is not burning and does not depend on fire be fuel?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni bud shing ma yin par 'gyur ba ci yang med de /
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni bud shing ma yin par 'gyur ba ci yang med de /
translated: If it were, then nothing would be nonfuel.

original: de ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir me la ma ltos pa'i bud shing yang med do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir me la ma ltos pa'i bud shing yang med do //
translated: Therefore, fuel does not exist without depending on fire.

original: me ni gzhan las mi 'ong ste //
analyzed: me ni gzhan las mi 'ong ste //
translated: Fire does not come from another,

original: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: shing la'ang me ni yod ma yin //
translated: nor is fire in fuel.

original: me ni gzhan gang las kyang mi 'ong ste /
analyzed: me ni gzhan gang las kyang mi 'ong ste /
translated: Fire does not come from another.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de gzhan las 'ong bar rnam par brtag pa gang yin pa de yang bud shing dang bcas par ram /🔽bud shing med par ro grang na //
analyzed: 'di ltar de gzhan las 'ong bar rnam par brtag pa gang yin pa de yang bud shing dang bcas par ram / bud shing med par ro grang na //
translated: If it is imagined that it comes from another, then it would come with fuel or without fuel.

original: de lta na de la yang bsam pa dang skyon du thal ba de dag nyid du 'gyur bas gzhan las 'ong bar brtag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na de la yang bsam pa dang skyon du thal ba de dag nyid du 'gyur bas gzhan las 'ong bar brtag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But in that case, the same considerations and objections would apply. Therefore, it is pointless to imagine that fire comes from another.

original: bud shing la yang me yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bud shing la yang me yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Fire is not in fuel.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rtsom pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not perceived and because the undertaking would be pointless.

original: gsal ba dang chen po nyid kyang snga na med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba dang chen po nyid kyang snga na med pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if fire were in fuel, then the manifestation and the greatness would be without fire, and the consequence would be that the effect would be without fire.

original: gal te til dag la til bar bzhin na zhe na /
analyzed: gal te til dag la til bar bzhin na zhe na /
translated: If you say that the oil is in the sesame seed,

original: de yang mi rung ste /🔽til ni brdung ba dang snum pa dag yin pa'i phyir dang / til bar ni gzhan du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste / til ni brdung ba dang snum pa dag yin pa'i phyir dang / til bar ni gzhan du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not correct,

original: song dang ma song bgos pa yis //
analyzed: song dang ma song bgos pa yis //
translated: because the sesame seed is the object of the action of grinding and the oil is the object of the action of pressing, and because the oil is perceived as different from the sesame seed.🔽The remainder of the wood

original: de bzhin shing la lhag ma bstan //
analyzed: de bzhin shing la lhag ma bstan //
translated: is shown to be like the path.

original: rnam pa de dag gis de bzhin du bud shing la yang brjod pa ltag ma dag bstan par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gis de bzhin du bud shing la yang brjod pa ltag ma dag bstan par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The remainder of the wood should be understood to be shown in the same way as the path, by the same method.

original: rnam pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis she na /
translated: By what method?

original: song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa'i rnam pa dag gis te /
analyzed: song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa'i rnam pa dag gis te /
translated: By the method of the gone, the not-gone, and that being gone over.

original: ji ltar song ba la 'gro ba med pa dang / ma song ba la med pa dang / bgos pa la 'gro ba med pa de bzhin du bud shing bsregs pa la yang sreg pa med /
analyzed: ji ltar song ba la 'gro ba med pa dang / ma song ba la med pa dang / bgos pa la 'gro ba med pa de bzhin du bud shing bsregs pa la yang sreg pa med /
translated: Just as there is no going on that being gone over, there is no going on the gone, and there is no going on the not-gone, so too, there is no burning of fuel that is being burned,

original: @208b ma bsregs pa la yang med bsreg bzhin pa la yang sreg pa med do //
analyzed: @208b ma bsregs pa la yang med bsreg bzhin pa la yang sreg pa med do //
translated: there is no burning of fuel that is not being burned, and there is no burning of fuel that is being burned.

original: ji ltar song ba la 'gro ba'i rtsom pa don med pa dang / ma song ba la med pa dang / bgom pa la 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med pa de bzhin du bsregs pa la yang sreg pa'i rtsom pa med /
analyzed: ji ltar song ba la 'gro ba'i rtsom pa don med pa dang / ma song ba la med pa dang / bgom pa la 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med pa de bzhin du bsregs pa la yang sreg pa'i rtsom pa med /
translated: Just as it is meaningless to begin going where one has already gone, where one has not yet gone, or on that being gone over, so too it is meaningless to begin burning that which has already been burned, that which has not yet been burned, or that which is being burned.

original: ma bsregs pa la yang med /
analyzed: ma bsregs pa la yang med /
translated: Just as it is meaningless to begin going where one has gone, where one has not gone, and on that being gone over, so too, it is meaningless to begin burning where one has burned, where one has not burned, and where one is burning.

original: bsreg bzhin pa la yang sreg pa'i rtsom pa med do //
analyzed: bsreg bzhin pa la yang sreg pa'i rtsom pa med do //
translated: It is meaningless to begin burning where one has burned, where one has not burned, and where one is burning.

original: ji ltar 'gro ba po 'gro bar mi byed pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa mi byed pa dang / 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin par 'gro bar mi byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro ba po 'gro bar mi byed pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin pa mi byed pa dang / 'gro ba po yin pa dang / 'gro ba po ma yin par 'gro bar mi byed de /
translated: Just as the goer does not make one go, the nongoer does not make one go, and it is not tenable that the goer and the nongoer make one go,

original: med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du me yang sreg pa po yang sreg par mi byed /🔽sreg pa po ma yin pa yang mi byed /
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du me yang sreg pa po yang sreg par mi byed / sreg pa po ma yin pa yang mi byed /
translated: so too, fire does not burn the fuel,🔽the nonburner does not burn,

original: sreg pa po yin pa yang sreg par mi byed de /
analyzed: sreg pa po yin pa yang sreg par mi byed de /
translated: and it is not tenable that the burner and the nonburner burn.

original: med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because they do not exist.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang drang bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining lines should be interpreted in the same way.

original: shing nyid me ni ma yin te //
analyzed: shing nyid me ni ma yin te //
translated: Fire is not the fuel.

original: shing las gzhan la me yang med //🔽me ni shing dang ldan ma yin //🔽me la shing med der de med //
analyzed: shing las gzhan la me yang med // me ni shing dang ldan ma yin // me la shing med der de med //
translated: Fire does not exist in fuel,🔽Fire does not possess fuel,🔽Fire does not exist without fuel,

original: re zhig bud shing gang kho na yin pa de nyid me ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig bud shing gang kho na yin pa de nyid me ma yin te /
translated: First, fire is not just fuel,

original: byed pa po dang las dag gcig pa nyid kyi skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dag gcig pa nyid kyi skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the error of the identity of agent and action would ensue.

original: bud shing las gzhan la yang med de /
analyzed: bud shing las gzhan la yang med de /
translated: Nor does fire exist in something other than fuel,

original: gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the error of the consequence of not depending on fuel and so on would ensue.

original: me bud shing dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: me bud shing dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Fire does not possess fuel,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽ldan pa'i rkyen 'di me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid dam ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / ldan pa'i rkyen 'di me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid dam ;
translated: because of what?🔽If the condition of possession existed in fire and fuel,

original: / gzhan nyid la yod grang na /
analyzed: / gzhan nyid la yod grang na /
translated: would it exist in their identity or in their difference?

original: de dag gis de gnyi ga bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis de gnyi ga bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But both of these have already been refuted.

original: smras pa / mi rung ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mi rung ste /
translated: Objection: That is unacceptable,

original: 'jig rten na mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen in the world.

original: 'di ltar de ni 'jig rten na me 'di ni bud shing dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'jig rten na me 'di ni bud shing dang ldan no //
translated: In this way, in the world it is said, “This fire possesses fuel.”

original: me 'di ni bud shing med pa'o zhes bya bar mthong /
analyzed: me 'di ni bud shing med pa'o zhes bya bar mthong /
translated: It is seen that this fire is without fuel.

original: bshad pa / 'di ni de kho na bsam pa yin pas 'di la 'jig rten pa'i brjod pa gang la 'di ni bdag dang ldan no zhes kyang zer ba dag gis ci bya /🔽me la bud shing dag rdza bo na rgya shug ltar yod pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di ni de kho na bsam pa yin pas 'di la 'jig rten pa'i brjod pa gang la 'di ni bdag dang ldan no zhes kyang zer ba dag gis ci bya / me la bud shing dag rdza bo na rgya shug ltar yod pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Since this is the contemplation of reality, what is the point of worldly conventions, such as saying “This is associated with a self”?🔽Fuel is not in fire like a fig in the hand.

original: bud shing dag la me chu na pad ma dag ltar yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bud shing dag la me chu na pad ma dag ltar yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is fire in fuel like a lotus in a lake.

original: ci'i phyir med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med ce na /
translated: Why are they not so?

original: gzhan nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the error of their being different would ensue.🔽Fire and fuel

original: me dang shing gis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: me dang shing gis bdag dang ni //
translated: are like the self and appropriated.

original: nye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun //🔽bum snam sogs dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba'i rim pa kun // bum snam sogs dang lhan cig tu //
translated: All stages

original: ma lus par ni rnam par bshad //
analyzed: ma lus par ni rnam par bshad //
translated: are explained in the same way as the pot, cloth, and so on.🔽Fire and fuel are not the same because the error of their being different would ensue.🔽Fire is not in fuel like a fig in the hand.

original: me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang phan tshun ltos par mi 'thad pa'i rim pa thams cad bum pa dang snam @209a * //
analyzed: me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang phan tshun ltos par mi 'thad pa'i rim pa thams cad bum pa dang snam @209a * //
translated: Nor is fuel in fire like a lotus in a lake.🔽Why are they not so?

original: bu la sogs pa dag dang lhan cig tu ma lus par rnam par bshad pa khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: bu la sogs pa dag dang lhan cig tu ma lus par rnam par bshad pa khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: One should understand this explanation together with the son and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: ji ltar me bud shing dang gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad phan tshun ltos te grub pa yang mi 'thad pa de bzhin du bdag kyang nye bar blang ba dang gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar me bud shing dang gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad phan tshun ltos te grub pa yang mi 'thad pa de bzhin du bdag kyang nye bar blang ba dang gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin /
translated: Just as fire is not identical with fuel, nor is it tenable that it is different, nor is it tenable that it is established in mutual dependence, in the same way, the self is not identical with the appropriated,

original: gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad /
analyzed: gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad /
translated: nor is it tenable that it is different,

original: phan tshun ltos te 'grub par yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos te 'grub par yang mi 'thad do //
translated: nor is it tenable that it is established in mutual dependence.

original: ji ltar me gzhan las kyang mi 'ong bud shing la yang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang gzhan las kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: ji ltar me gzhan las kyang mi 'ong bud shing la yang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag kyang gzhan las kyang mi 'ong /
translated: Just as fire does not come from another, nor does it exist in fuel, in the same way, the self does not come from another,

original: nye bar blang ba la yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba la yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: nor does it exist in the appropriated.

original: ji ltar bud shing nyid kyang me ma yin //🔽bud shing las gzhan la yang me med /🔽me bud shing dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar bud shing nyid kyang me ma yin // bud shing las gzhan la yang me med / me bud shing dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Fuel is not fire.🔽Fire does not exist apart from fuel.🔽Fire does not possess fuel.

original: me la bud shing dag yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: me la bud shing dag yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Fuel does not exist in fire.

original: bud shing dag la me yod pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du nye bar blang bdag kyang bdag ma yin /
analyzed: bud shing dag la me yod pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du nye bar blang bdag kyang bdag ma yin /
translated: Just as fire does not exist in fuel, so the self does not exist in the appropriated.

original: nye bar blang ba las gzhan pa yang bdag med /🔽bdag nye bar blang ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba las gzhan pa yang bdag med / bdag nye bar blang ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: The self does not exist apart from the appropriated.🔽The self does not possess the appropriated.

original: bdag la nye bar blang ba dag yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: bdag la nye bar blang ba dag yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: The appropriated do not exist in the self.

original: nye bar blang bdag la bdag yod pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar blang bdag la bdag yod pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: The self does not exist in the appropriated.

original: ji ltar mes bud shing bsregs pa la yang sreg pa med ma bsregs pa la yang med /🔽bsreg bzhin pa la yang sreg pa med pa dang / ji ltar mes bsreg pa la yang sreg pa'i rtsom pa med ma bsregs pa la yang med /
analyzed: ji ltar mes bud shing bsregs pa la yang sreg pa med ma bsregs pa la yang med / bsreg bzhin pa la yang sreg pa med pa dang / ji ltar mes bsreg pa la yang sreg pa'i rtsom pa med ma bsregs pa la yang med /
translated: Just as fire does not burn that which is being burned, nor that which is not being burned,🔽nor that which will be burned,

original: bsreg bzhin pa la yang sreg pa'i rtsom pa med pa dang / ji ltar mes sreg pa po yang sreg par mi byed /
analyzed: bsreg bzhin pa la yang sreg pa'i rtsom pa med pa dang / ji ltar mes sreg pa po yang sreg par mi byed /
translated: just as fire does not commence burning that which is being burned, nor that which is not being burned,

original: sreg pa po ma yin pa yang mi byed /
analyzed: sreg pa po ma yin pa yang mi byed /
translated: nor that which will be burned,🔽just as fire does not burn the burner, nor does it not burn the burner,

original: sreg pa po yin pa dang / sreg pa po ma yin pa yang sreg par mi byed de /
analyzed: sreg pa po yin pa dang / sreg pa po ma yin pa yang sreg par mi byed de /
translated: nor does it burn both the burner and that which is not a burner,

original: med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du bdag gis nye bar blang ba la yang nye bar len pa med /🔽nye bar ma blangs pa la yang med /
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du bdag gis nye bar blang ba la yang nye bar len pa med / nye bar ma blangs pa la yang med /
translated: Just as it is said that “because it does not exist, the appropriator does not appropriate,” so too, the appropriator does not appropriate that which is being appropriated, nor that which is not being appropriated, nor that which is already appropriated.🔽And just as the appropriator does not initiate the act of appropriating that which is being appropriated, nor that which is not being appropriated, nor that which is already appropriated,

original: nye bar len bzhin pa la yang nye bar len pa med cing /
analyzed: nye bar len bzhin pa la yang nye bar len pa med cing /
translated: so too, the appropriator does not appropriate that which is being appropriated, nor that which is not being appropriated, nor that which is already appropriated.🔽And just as the appropriator does not initiate the act of appropriating that which is being appropriated, nor that which is not being appropriated, nor that which is already appropriated,

original: de bzhin du bdag gis nye bar blangs pa la yang nye bar len pa'i rtsom pa med /🔽nye bar ma blangs pa la yang med /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis nye bar blangs pa la yang nye bar len pa'i rtsom pa med / nye bar ma blangs pa la yang med /
translated: so too, the appropriator does not appropriate that which is being appropriated, nor that which is not being appropriated, nor that which is already appropriated.🔽And just as the appropriator does not initiate the act of appropriating that which is being appropriated, nor that which is not being appropriated, nor that which is already appropriated,

original: nye bar len bzhin pa la yang nye bar len pa'i rtsom pa med la /
analyzed: nye bar len bzhin pa la yang nye bar len pa'i rtsom pa med la /
translated: so too, the appropriator does not initiate the act of appropriating that which is being appropriated, nor that which is not being appropriated, nor that which is already appropriated.🔽And just as the appropriator does not initiate the act of appropriating that which is being appropriated, nor that which is not being appropriated, nor that which is already appropriated,

original: de bzhin du bdag gis nye bar len pa po yang nye bar len par mi byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis nye bar len pa po yang nye bar len par mi byed /
translated: so too, the appropriator does not initiate the act of appropriating that which is being appropriated, nor that which is not being appropriated, nor that which is already appropriated.🔽And just as the appropriator does not initiate the act of appropriating that which is being appropriated, nor that which is not being appropriated, nor that which is already appropriated,

original: nye bar len pa po ma yin pa yang mi byed /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po ma yin pa yang mi byed /
translated: so too, the appropriator does not initiate the act of appropriating that which is being appropriated, nor that which is not being appropriated, nor that which is already appropriated.🔽And just as the appropriator does not initiate the act of appropriating that which is being appropriated, nor that which is not being appropriated, nor that which is already appropriated,

original: nye bar len pa po yin pa dang / nye bar len pa po ma yin pa yang nye bar len par mi byed de /🔽med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽bum snam la sogs pa lhan cig @209b tu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye bar len pa po yin pa dang / nye bar len pa po ma yin pa yang nye bar len par mi byed de /🔽med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽bum snam la sogs pa lhan cig @209b tu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: so too, the appropriator does not initiate the act of appropriating that which is being appropriated, nor that which is not being appropriated, nor that which is already appropriated.

original: me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi rim pa gang dag rnam par bshad pa de dag bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dang yang lhan cig tu rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: me dang bud shing dag gis bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag gi rim pa gang dag rnam par bshad pa de dag bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag dang yang lhan cig tu rnam par bshad de /
translated: The order of self and that appropriated is explained by fire and fuel, and that is also explained together with the pot, cloth, and so on.

original: bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag dang bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa dag gi rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag dang nye bar blang ba dag dang bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa dag gi rim pa thams cad ma lus par rnam par bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that all the orders of self and that appropriated, as well as pot, cloth, and so on, are explained without exception.

original: de la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag ni /
analyzed: de la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag ni /
translated: In this regard, the pot, cloth, and so on,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dang / yan lag dang / yan lag can du gyur pa dang / yon tan dang / yon tan can du gyur pa dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa rnam pa de lta bu dag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dang / yan lag dang / yan lag can du gyur pa dang / yon tan dang / yon tan can du gyur pa dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhir gyur pa rnam pa de lta bu dag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as cause and effect, as parts and wholes, as qualities and those possessing qualities, and as characteristics and the bases of those characteristics.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: 'jim pa nyid bum pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jim pa nyid bum pa ma yin te /
translated: clay is not the pot,

original: 'jim pas 'bras bu bum pa byed pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jim pas 'bras bu bum pa byed pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because clay would not be the cause of the effect, the pot.

original: 'jim pa las bum pa gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jim pa las bum pa gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: A pot is not different from clay,

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be permanent, that is, not dependent on another.

original: de dag phan tshun ltos par yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de dag phan tshun ltos par yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: They cannot be established as mutually dependent,

original: grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that that which is established and that which is not established are mutually dependent.

original: lo ma nyid shing ljon pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lo ma nyid shing ljon pa ma yin te /
translated: A leaf is not a tree,

original: lo ma lhags na shing ljon pa 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lo ma lhags na shing ljon pa 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that when the leaves fall the tree would be destroyed.

original: lo ma las shing ljon pa gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: lo ma las shing ljon pa gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: A tree is not different from a leaf,

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be permanent, that is, not dependent on another.

original: de dag la phan tshun ltos par yang mi 'grub ste //
analyzed: de dag la phan tshun ltos par yang mi 'grub ste //
translated: They cannot be established as mutually dependent,

original: grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that that which is established and that which is not established are mutually dependent.

original: sngon po nyid lo ma ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po nyid lo ma ma yin te /
translated: Blue is not a leaf,

original: sngon po ya lan lo ma yin par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po ya lan lo ma yin par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that a second blue color would be a leaf.

original: sngon po las lo ma gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po las lo ma gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the leaf different from the blue,

original: lo ma lhags kyang sngon po gnas par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: lo ma lhags kyang sngon po gnas par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it follows that when the leaf falls, the blue remains.

original: / de dag phan tshun ltos par yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: / de dag phan tshun ltos par yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: Nor is it established that they are mutually dependent,

original: grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that the established and the nonestablished are mutually dependent.

original: mtshan nyid mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin te /
translated: The characteristic is not the basis of the characteristic,

original: sgrub pa dang bsgrub par bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir dang / grangs tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang bsgrub par bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir dang / grangs tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the proof and that which is to be proven are different and because the number is different.

original: mtshan nyid las mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid las mtshan nyid kyi gzhi gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the basis of the characteristic different from the characteristic,

original: dngos po mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa rab tu mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa rab tu mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a thing that is not to be characterized is not established.

original: de dag phan tshun ltos par yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de dag phan tshun ltos par yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: Nor is it established that they are mutually dependent,

original: grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa dang ma grub pa dag ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that the established and the nonestablished are mutually dependent.

original: ji ltar me gzhan las mi 'ong ba dang / bud shing yang ma yod pa ma yin pa dang / bud shing nyid me ma yin pa @210a * //🔽dang / bud shing las gzhan la yang me med pa dang / me bud shing dang ldan pa yang ma yin pa dang / me la bud shing dag med pa dang / bud shing dag la me med par bstan pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yang gzhan las mi 'ong ba dang /🔽rgyu la yang 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa dang / rgyu nyid 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / rgyu las gzhan la yang 'bras bu med pa dang / 'bras bu rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / 'bras bu la rgyu dag med pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar me gzhan las mi 'ong ba dang / bud shing yang ma yod pa ma yin pa dang / bud shing nyid me ma yin pa @210a * // dang / bud shing las gzhan la yang me med pa dang / me bud shing dang ldan pa yang ma yin pa dang / me la bud shing dag med pa dang / bud shing dag la me med par bstan pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yang gzhan las mi 'ong ba dang / rgyu la yang 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa dang / rgyu nyid 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / rgyu las gzhan la yang 'bras bu med pa dang / 'bras bu rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / 'bras bu la rgyu dag med pa dang /
translated: Just as fire does not come from another, fuel does not exist without it, fuel is not fire, fire does not exist in fuel, fire does not exist in fuel, and fuel does not exist in fire,🔽so too, the effect does not come from another, the effect does not exist in the cause, the cause is not the effect, the effect does not exist in what is other than the cause, the effect is not concomitant with the cause, the effect does not exist in the cause,🔽and the cause does not exist in the effect.

original: rgyu dag la 'bras bu med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dag la 'bras bu med pa'o //
translated: Just as fire does not come from another place, fuel does not exist without it, fuel is not fire, fire does not exist in fuel, fuel does not exist in fire, and fire does not have fuel, and fuel does not have fire, in the same way, an effect does not come from another place, an effect does not exist in its cause, a cause is not an effect, an effect does not exist in a cause other than that, an effect does not have a cause, an effect does not have causes, and causes do not have an effect.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang ji ltar ji srid pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang ji ltar ji srid pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, everything should be applied as much as possible.

original: de'i phyir de ltar ngo bo nyid kyis bdag dang dngos po rnams rnam pa du mar mi 'thad pa na rtog pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa mkhas pa'i nga rgyal can /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ngo bo nyid kyis bdag dang dngos po rnams rnam pa du mar mi 'thad pa na rtog pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa mkhas pa'i nga rgyal can /
translated: Therefore, since the self and things are not tenable in any way by way of their own intrinsic reality, those who are conceited with the pride of being wise,🔽but who are of the nature of conceptual thought,

original: gang dag bdag dang dngos po rnams //
analyzed: gang dag bdag dang dngos po rnams //
translated: who teach that the self and things

original: de bcas nyid dang tha dad par //🔽ston pa de dag bstan don la //
analyzed: de bcas nyid dang tha dad par // ston pa de dag bstan don la //
translated: are both the same and different,

original: mkhas so snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: mkhas so snyam du mi sems so //
translated: we do not think that they are wise🔽with regard to the meaning of their teachings.

original: gang dag pa de dang bcas pa nyid dang tha dad pa dang / dngos po rnams de dang bcas pa nyid dang / tha dad par ston pa de dag bstan pa'i don la mkhas pa yin par kho bo mi sems so //🔽de bcas zhes bya ba ni de dang bcas pa'o //🔽de dang bcas pa'i dngos po ni de dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang dag pa de dang bcas pa nyid dang tha dad pa dang / dngos po rnams de dang bcas pa nyid dang / tha dad par ston pa de dag bstan pa'i don la mkhas pa yin par kho bo mi sems so // de bcas zhes bya ba ni de dang bcas pa'o // de dang bcas pa'i dngos po ni de dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: We do not think that those who teach that the self and things are both the same and different are wise with regard to the meaning of their teachings.🔽“The same” means together with.🔽A thing that is together with that is “the same as that.”

original: bdag de dang bcas pa'i dngos po ni bdag de dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag de dang bcas pa'i dngos po ni bdag de dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: A thing that is together with the self is “the same as the self.”

original: dngos po rnams de dang bcas pa'i dngos po yang dngos po rnams de dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po rnams de dang bcas pa'i dngos po yang dngos po rnams de dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: and things that are endowed with that are things that are endowed with that.

original: gang gis bdag gam dngos po rnams su gdags pa de dang bcas pa nyid de ni bdag nyid dam dngos po rnams yin te /
analyzed: gang gis bdag gam dngos po rnams su gdags pa de dang bcas pa nyid de ni bdag nyid dam dngos po rnams yin te /
translated: That which is endowed with that by which the self or things are imputed is the self or things themselves.

original: tha dad par gyur pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha dad par gyur pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It does not become different.

original: 'di lta ste nye bar blang ba gang gis bdag tu gdags pa'i nye bar blang ba de nyid dang bcas pa de ni bdag nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di lta ste nye bar blang ba gang gis bdag tu gdags pa'i nye bar blang ba de nyid dang bcas pa de ni bdag nyid yin gyi /
translated: For example, that which is endowed with the appropriated aggregates by which the self is imputed is the self itself.

original: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the aggregates alone.

original: gang dag bdag nyi bar blang ba dang bcas pa'i dngos po de de dang bcas pa nyid du ston par byed pa dang / gang dag bdag tha dad par gyur pa lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na dngos po 'ga' zhig gnas pa yod do zhes ston par byed pa dang /
analyzed: gang dag bdag nyi bar blang ba dang bcas pa'i dngos po de de dang bcas pa nyid du ston par byed pa dang / gang dag bdag tha dad par gyur pa lta ba la sogs pa dag gi snga rol na dngos po 'ga' zhig gnas pa yod do zhes ston par byed pa dang /
translated: Those who teach that the self is endowed with the appropriated aggregates and those who teach that prior to such things as seeing, the self exists as a certain entity that is different from them

original: de bzhin du dngos po rnams la yang bud shing gang gis mer gdags pa'i bud shing de nyid dang bcas pa de ni me nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po rnams la yang bud shing gang gis mer gdags pa'i bud shing de nyid dang bcas pa de ni me nyid yin gyi /
translated: So too, things are also like this, for that which is fire in dependence on fuel possesses fuel and is fire.

original: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /🔽gang dag me bud shing dang bcas pa'i dngos po de de dang bcas pa nyid du ston par byed pa dang / de bzhin @210b du gang dag yon tan can lo ma yang yon tan sngon po la sogs pa de dag dang bcas pa nyid na lo ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te / gang dag me bud shing dang bcas pa'i dngos po de de dang bcas pa nyid du ston par byed pa dang / de bzhin @210b du gang dag yon tan can lo ma yang yon tan sngon po la sogs pa de dag dang bcas pa nyid na lo ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not fire alone.

original: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa dang / de bzhin du gang dag 'bras bu snam bu yang rgyu spun de dag dang bcas pa nyid na 'bras bu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa dang / de bzhin du gang dag 'bras bu snam bu yang rgyu spun de dag dang bcas pa nyid na 'bras bu yin gyi /
translated: Those who assert that the entity that possesses fuel is fire alone and that the entity that possesses leaves is a tree alone, and those who assert that the possessor of qualities such as blue is a leaf alone and not a possessor of qualities, and those who assert that the possessor of thread is cloth alone and not a possessor of thread, and those who assert that the possessor of a cause is an effect alone and not a cause, are all similar to those who assert that the possessor of form is consciousness alone and not a possessor of form.

original: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa dang / de bzhin du gang dag yan lag can lus kyang yan lag lag pa la sogs pa de dag dang bcas pa nyid na yan lag can yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa dang / de bzhin du gang dag yan lag can lus kyang yan lag lag pa la sogs pa de dag dang bcas pa nyid na yan lag can yin gyi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa dang /
translated: and in the same way, it shows that the body, which is the possessor of parts, is the body only when it possesses parts such as arms,

original: de bzhin du gang dag mtshan nyid kyis gzhi ba lang yang mtshan nyid rva la sogs pa de dag dang bcas pa nyid na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag mtshan nyid kyis gzhi ba lang yang mtshan nyid rva la sogs pa de dag dang bcas pa nyid na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin gyi /
translated: and in the same way, it shows that the basis of characteristics, the cow, is the basis of characteristics only when it possesses characteristics such as a dewlap,

original: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa dang / gang dag dngos po rnams tha dad pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa dang / gang dag dngos po rnams tha dad pa nyid du ston te /
translated: and in the same way, it shows that things are different from each other:

original: me yang gzhan nyid la bud shing yang gzhan nyid yin /
analyzed: me yang gzhan nyid la bud shing yang gzhan nyid yin /
translated: fire is different from fuel,

original: yon tan can lo ma yang gzhan nyid la yon tan sngon po la sogs pa dag kyang gzhan nyid yin /
analyzed: yon tan can lo ma yang gzhan nyid la yon tan sngon po la sogs pa dag kyang gzhan nyid yin /
translated: the quality of a leaf is different from the possessor of the quality, and so on,

original: 'bras bu snam bu yang gzhan nyid la rgyu spun dag kyang gzhan nyid yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu snam bu yang gzhan nyid la rgyu spun dag kyang gzhan nyid yin /
translated: the effect, cloth, is different from the cause, thread,🔽and so on.

original: yan lag can lus kyang gzhan nyid la yan lag lag pa la sogs pa dag kyang gzhan nyid yin /
analyzed: yan lag can lus kyang gzhan nyid la yan lag lag pa la sogs pa dag kyang gzhan nyid yin /
translated: The body that has parts is one thing, and the parts, the arms and so on, are other things.🔽The basis of the characteristics, the cow, is one thing, and the characteristics, the horns and so on, are other things.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang yang gzhan nyid la mtshan nyid rva la sogs pa dag kyang gzhan nyid yin no zhes ston par byed pa de dag ni bstan pa'i don la mkhas pa yin no snyam du kho bo mi sems so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ba lang yang gzhan nyid la mtshan nyid rva la sogs pa dag kyang gzhan nyid yin no zhes ston par byed pa de dag ni bstan pa'i don la mkhas pa yin no snyam du kho bo mi sems so //
translated: We do not think that those who teach this are skilled in the meaning of the scriptures.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de dang bcas pa'i dngos po ni de dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: de dang bcas pa'i dngos po ni de dang bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po zhig yin grang na /
translated: If that which possesses something is the same as that which it possesses, then that which possesses something is either the same as or different from that which it possesses.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad de tshigs su bcad pa gong mar bstan zin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed par yang gcig n'a lhan cig yod min te zhes rgyas par bstan pas lhan cig nyid dgag pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad de tshigs su bcad pa gong mar bstan zin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed par yang gcig n'a lhan cig yod min te zhes rgyas par bstan pas lhan cig nyid dgag pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Both are untenable because it has been explained in the previous verse and because it has been extensively taught in the chapter on “Attachment and One Who Is Attached” that if they are identical, they do not exist together.

original: me dang bud shing brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu pa'o /
analyzed: me dang bud shing brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu pa'o /
translated: This is the tenth chapter, called the Critique of Fire and Fuel.

original: // / smras pa /
analyzed: // / smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: The self surely exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'khor ba yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'khor ba yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because cyclic existence exists.

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis //
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis //
translated: In this regard, the Bhagavān has said:

original: dam chos rnam par mi shes pa'i //
analyzed: dam chos rnam par mi shes pa'i //
translated: The fool who does not know the holy Dharma

original: byis pa la ni 'khor ba ring //
analyzed: byis pa la ni 'khor ba ring //
translated: Has a long journey in cyclic existence.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: And he also said:

original: de bzhin du dge slong dag de lta bas na khyod kyis 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir nan tan bya zhing de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes kyang @211a * //🔽bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong dag de lta bas na khyod kyis 'khor ba zad par bya ba'i phyir nan tan bya zhing de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes kyang @211a * //🔽bka' stsal to //
translated: “Bhikṣhus, therefore you should make an effort to end cyclic existence. You should train in that way.”

original: de'i phyir / gang ring bar bstan pa dang / gang zad par bya ba'i phyir nan tan bya ba bstan pa'i 'khor ba de yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang ring bar bstan pa dang / gang zad par bya ba'i phyir nan tan bya ba bstan pa'i 'khor ba de yod do //
translated: samsara is taught to be long and to be earnestly applied to its exhaustion.

original: med du zin kyang ji lta ring ba dang zad par 'gyur /
analyzed: med du zin kyang ji lta ring ba dang zad par 'gyur /
translated: But if it does not exist, how could it be long or exhausted?

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: ring ba dang zad par gsungs pas 'khor ba yod do //
analyzed: ring ba dang zad par gsungs pas 'khor ba yod do //
translated: samsara exists because it is taught to be long and to be exhausted.

original: 'khor ba na yod na 'khor ba po yang yod par mngon no //
analyzed: 'khor ba na yod na 'khor ba po yang yod par mngon no //
translated: If it exists in samsara, then it is evident that the samsaric being exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'ongs shing 'ongs shing yang dang yang der 'gro bas na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'ongs shing 'ongs shing yang dang yang der 'gro bas na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'khor ba zhes bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is called “samsara” since it comes and goes again and again.

original: gang 'ongs shing 'ongs shing 'gro ba de ni bdag yin no //
analyzed: gang 'ongs shing 'ongs shing 'gro ba de ni bdag yin no //
translated: That which comes and goes again and again is the self.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore the self surely exists.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / ci khyod kyis sbrang rtsi mthong la g-yang sa ma mthong ngam ;
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod kyis sbrang rtsi mthong la g-yang sa ma mthong ngam ;
translated: Do you see honey but not the precipice?

original: khyod kyis 'khor ba ring ba dang zad par gsungs pa mthong la /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'khor ba ring ba dang zad par gsungs pa mthong la /
translated: You see that samsara is taught to be long and to be exhausted,

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: but you do not see that the Blessed One said:

original: gzhan 'di ma mthong ko //
analyzed: gzhan 'di ma mthong ko //
translated: But you have not seen this other one.

original: sngon mtha' mngon nam zhes zhus tshe //
analyzed: sngon mtha' mngon nam zhes zhus tshe //
translated: When asked, “Is the prior limit evident?”

original: thub pa chen pos min zhes gsungs //
analyzed: thub pa chen pos min zhes gsungs //
translated: The Great Sage said, “It is not.”

original: 'khor ba thog ma tha med de //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma tha med de //
translated: Cyclic existence has no beginning or end.

original: de la sngon med phyi ma med //
analyzed: de la sngon med phyi ma med //
translated: It has no prior limit and no posterior limit.

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: The Bhagavān is omniscient,

original: thams cad gzigs pa /
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa /
translated: he is all-seeing,

original: thub pa chen pos dge slong dag 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med do //
analyzed: thub pa chen pos dge slong dag 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med do //
translated: the Great Sage said, “Monks, cyclic existence has no beginning or end.

original: sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes bka' stsal pas de'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med par gsungs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba yang ngo bo nyid stong par bstan to //🔽'di ltar gal te 'khor ba pa zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur pa na de la thog ma yang yod /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' mi mngon no zhes bka' stsal pas de'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med par gsungs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor ba yang ngo bo nyid stong par bstan to // 'di ltar gal te 'khor ba pa zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur pa na de la thog ma yang yod /
translated: The prior limit is not evident.” Therefore, because he said that it has no beginning or end, the Bhagavān taught that cyclic existence is empty of essence.

original: tha ma yang yod par 'gyur bar the tshom med do //
analyzed: tha ma yang yod par 'gyur bar the tshom med do //
translated: Thus, if something called “cyclic existence” were an existent thing, then undoubtedly it would have a beginning and an end.

original: 'di ltar dngos po yod pa la thog ma med pa dang tha ma med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po yod pa la thog ma med pa dang tha ma med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could an existent thing be without a beginning and without an end?

original: de lta bas na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis 'khor ba ring ba dang / zad par gsungs kyi bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam pa bstan pa'i dbang gis ni /🔽de la ston med phyi ma med //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis 'khor ba ring ba dang / zad par gsungs kyi bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam pa bstan pa'i dbang gis ni / de la ston med phyi ma med //
translated: but not by the power of the teaching of ultimate reality.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has said, “It has no beginning and no end.”

original: de lta bas na thog ma dang tha ma med par gsungs pas 'khor ba zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na thog ma dang tha ma med par gsungs pas 'khor ba zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, since it is said to be without beginning and end, it is not tenable to posit any thing called “samsara.”

original: de med na 'khor ba po ji lta bu zhig 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na 'khor ba po ji lta bu zhig 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: If that does not exist, how could a samsara-goer be tenable?

original: smras pa / de ltar 'khor pa'i thog ma dang tha ma bkag tu zin kyang /
analyzed: smras pa / de ltar 'khor pa'i thog ma dang tha ma bkag tu zin kyang /
translated: Objection: Although the beginning and end of samsara have been refuted in this way,

original: dbus ma bkag pas de yod pa'i 'khor ba yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: dbus ma bkag pas de yod pa'i 'khor ba yod pa kho na ste /
translated: samsara definitely exists because its middle has not been refuted.

original: 'di ltar dngos po med pa la dbus yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po med pa la dbus yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the middle of a nonexistent thing exist?

original: de lta bas na dbus yod pa'i phyir 'khor ba yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbus yod pa'i phyir 'khor ba yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, because its middle exists, samsara definitely exists.

original: 'khor ba yod pa'i phyir 'khor ba po yang yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba yod pa'i phyir 'khor ba po yang yod pa kho na'o //
translated: And because samsara exists, the samsara-goer also definitely exists.

original: bshad pa / @211b gal te dbus nyid yod par gyur na ni dbus yod pa'i phyir 'khor ba yang yod par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: bshad pa / @211b gal te dbus nyid yod par gyur na ni dbus yod pa'i phyir 'khor ba yang yod par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If the middle existed, then since the middle exists, samsara would also exist.

original: de'i dbus nyid mi 'thad pas de yod pa'i phyir 'khor ba yod par gal 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i dbus nyid mi 'thad pas de yod pa'i phyir 'khor ba yod par gal 'gyur /
translated: But since the middle itself is untenable, how could samsara exist because it exists?

original: gang la thog med tha med pa //
analyzed: gang la thog med tha med pa //
translated: How could that which has no beginning or end

original: de la dbus ni ga la yod //
analyzed: de la dbus ni ga la yod //
translated: Have a middle?

original: gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de la dbus yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de la dbus yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could that which has no beginning or end have a middle?

original: 'di ltar thog ma dang tha ma la ltos nas dbus 'grub par 'gyur ba yin na de la thog ma dang tha ma de yang med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar thog ma dang tha ma la ltos nas dbus 'grub par 'gyur ba yin na de la thog ma dang tha ma de yang med de /
translated: In that case, the middle would be established in reliance on the beginning and end. But that beginning and end do not exist.

original: de med pa'i phyir de'i dbus yod par gal 'gyur /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir de'i dbus yod par gal 'gyur /
translated: Since they do not exist, how could the middle exist because it exists?

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Āryadeva also says:

original: thog ma dbus dang tha ma med //
analyzed: thog ma dbus dang tha ma med //
translated: It has no beginning, middle, or end.

original: skye ba'i snga rol mi srid de //
analyzed: skye ba'i snga rol mi srid de //
translated: It is impossible prior to arising.

original: gnyis gnyis dag ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis dag ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the two

original: re res rtsom par ji ltar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: re res rtsom par ji ltar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: How could one arise?

original: de phyir de la snga phyi dang // lhan cig rim pa mi 'thad do //🔽de'i phyir de la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi go rims dag mi srid do //
analyzed: de phyir de la snga phyi dang // lhan cig rim pa mi 'thad do // de'i phyir de la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi go rims dag mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous is untenable.🔽Therefore, the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous is impossible.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir 'khor ba la thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma dag med pa de'i phyir 'dir 'khor ba po'i skye ba dang rga shi dag la yang snga phyi lhan cig gi rim pa dag med do //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir 'khor ba la thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma dag med pa de'i phyir 'dir 'khor ba po'i skye ba dang rga shi dag la yang snga phyi lhan cig gi rim pa dag med do //
translated: Since cyclic existence has no beginning, middle, or end, therefore, birth, aging, and death of one who is in cyclic existence have no sequence of prior, subsequent, or simultaneous.

original: de dag ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gal te skye ba sngar gyur pa //
analyzed: gal te skye ba sngar gyur pa //
translated: If birth were prior

original: rga shi 'phyi ba yin na ni //
analyzed: rga shi 'phyi ba yin na ni //
translated: and aging and death were subsequent,🔽birth would occur without aging and death,

original: skye ba rga shi med pa dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur //🔽gal te skye ba snga bar gyur la //🔽de'i 'og tu phyis rga shi dag la yang snga phyi 'byung ba yin na de lta na skye ba de la rga shi med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba rga shi med pa dang // ma shi bar yang skye bar 'gyur // gal te skye ba snga bar gyur la // de'i 'og tu phyis rga shi dag la yang snga phyi 'byung ba yin na de lta na skye ba de la rga shi med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and one would be born without dying.🔽If birth were prior and aging and death were subsequent, then in that birth there would be no aging and death.

original: de la rga shi med par gyur na phyis rga shi ga las 'ong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la rga shi med par gyur na phyis rga shi ga las 'ong bar 'gyur /
translated: If birth were to occur without aging and death, then later, from what cause would aging and death arise?

original: ci ste 'ong na ni rga shi gzhi med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'ong na ni rga shi gzhi med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it does come, then it follows that aging and death would be without a basis.

original: de dang phrad du zin na yang de la cing yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang phrad du zin na yang de la cing yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if it did make contact with it, it would not do anything to it,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis rga shi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis rga shi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be devoid of aging and death by its very intrinsic reality.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: ma shi ba yang skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma shi ba yang skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: one who has not died would be born,

original: 'di ltar skye ba snga bar brtags na de sngar gzhan du ma shi bar 'dir skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba snga bar brtags na de sngar gzhan du ma shi bar 'dir skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because if birth were imagined to be prior, then it follows that without dying in another place, one would be born here.

original: de lta na 'khor ba thog ma dang ldan par 'gyur te //
analyzed: de lta na 'khor ba thog ma dang ldan par 'gyur te //
translated: In that case, samsara would have a beginning.

original: de yang mi 'dod pas de'i phyir skye ba snga la rga shi 'phyi bar mi 'thad do //🔽ci ste skyon de gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas rga shi snga ma kho na yin la /
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod pas de'i phyir skye ba snga la rga shi 'phyi bar mi 'thad do // ci ste skyon de gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas rga shi snga ma kho na yin la /
translated: But since that is unacceptable, therefore it is untenable that birth is prior and aging and death are subsequent.

original: skye ba 'phyi'o zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba 'phyi'o zhe na /
translated: But if you think that it is not tenable that those errors would occur, then aging and death are prior and birth is subsequent.

original: de la bshad par bya ste /🔽gal te skye ba 'phyi gyur pa //
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste / gal te skye ba 'phyi gyur pa //
translated: In response to that, Nāgārjuna explains:🔽If aging and death were prior

original: rga shi snga ba yin na ni //🔽skye ba med pa'i rga shi ni //
analyzed: rga shi snga ba yin na ni // skye ba med pa'i rga shi ni //
translated: And birth were subsequent,🔽How could there be aging and death

original: rgyu med par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu med par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: Without birth, without a cause?

original: gal te de'i rga shi snga bar gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de'i rga shi snga bar gyur la /
translated: If its aging and death were to occur earlier,

original: skye ba 'phyi bar gyur na de lta na gzhi med pa'i rga shi rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur pas de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: skye ba 'phyi bar gyur na de lta na gzhi med pa'i rga shi rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur pas de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: and its birth were to occur later, then aging and death would occur without a basis and without a cause. But that is unacceptable.

original: @212a * // 'di ltar ma skyes shing med pa'i rga shi gzhi med cing rgyu med par ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: @212a * // 'di ltar ma skyes shing med pa'i rga shi gzhi med cing rgyu med par ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Thus, how could aging and death occur without a basis and without a cause, since they have not yet arisen and do not yet exist?

original: skyes shing yod pa la rga shi bstan par rigs so //
analyzed: skyes shing yod pa la rga shi bstan par rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to teach that aging and death occur for that which has arisen and exists.

original: de lta bas na skye ba 'phyi la rga shi snga bar yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba 'phyi la rga shi snga bar yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is also untenable that birth occurs later and aging and death occur earlier.

original: smras pa / de dag la snga phyi med de /
analyzed: smras pa / de dag la snga phyi med de /
translated: Objection: They do not occur earlier or later.

original: de ni rga shi dang rjes su 'brel bzhin pa kho nar skye'o //
analyzed: de ni rga shi dang rjes su 'brel bzhin pa kho nar skye'o //
translated: Birth occurs only in conjunction with aging and death.

original: bshad pa / skye ba dang ni rga shi dag / lhan cig rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / skye ba dang ni rga shi dag / lhan cig rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Birth and aging and death Are not tenable as simultaneous.

original: skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Birth and aging and death are not tenable as simultaneous.

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni /
translated: If they were,

original: skye bzhin pa na 'chi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa na 'chi 'gyur zhing //
translated: One would die even while being born.

original: gnyi ga rgyu med can du 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyi ga rgyu med can du 'gyur //
translated: Both would be causeless.

original: gal te skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig nyid du gyur na de lta na skye bzhin pa nyid na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig nyid du gyur na de lta na skye bzhin pa nyid na /
translated: If birth and aging and death were to occur simultaneously, then

original: 'chi bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'chi bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: in that case, one who is being born would also die. But that is untenable.

original: 'di ltar skye ba dang 'gag pa mi mthun pa gnyis gnyis gcig la dus gcig tu ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba dang 'gag pa mi mthun pa gnyis gnyis gcig la dus gcig tu ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Thus, how could two incompatible states, such as birth and cessation, occur simultaneously in one entity?

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: both would be causeless.

original: gal te skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig nyid du 'byung bar gyur na de'i skye ba 'chi ba sngon du 'gro ba ma yin cing /
analyzed: gal te skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig nyid du 'byung bar gyur na de'i skye ba 'chi ba sngon du 'gro ba ma yin cing /
translated: If birth and aging and death were to occur simultaneously, then birth would not precede death.

original: de'i skye ba snga bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i skye ba snga bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that birth would be prior.

original: skye ba snga bar gyur na rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba snga bar gyur na rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If birth were prior, it would follow that it would be causeless.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa 'jigs med kyis kyang /🔽gal te las la lus skye la //🔽lus ma gtogs par las med na //
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa 'jigs med kyis kyang / gal te las la lus skye la // lus ma gtogs par las med na //
translated: Ācārya Ārya Āśvaghoṣa also states:🔽If the body were born from karma

original: sngon lus las las ma skyes pa //
analyzed: sngon lus las las ma skyes pa //
translated: and karma does not exist apart from the body,

original: gang gi rgyus ni skyes par gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi rgyus ni skyes par gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: then from what cause would the body be born🔽that arose prior to the body and karma?

original: de ltar lhan cig tu skye na de'i rga shi skye ba la mi ltos par rang las rab tu grub pa dang / rga shi gzhi med pa dang / rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ltar lhan cig tu skye na de'i rga shi skye ba la mi ltos par rang las rab tu grub pa dang / rga shi gzhi med pa dang / rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: If birth and aging and death arose simultaneously, then the aging and death of that would be established from itself without depending on birth, and aging and death would be groundless and causeless. But that is unacceptable,

original: skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would absurdly follow that many errors would ensue.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig tu yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig tu yang mi 'thad do //
translated: it is also untenable that birth and aging and death arise simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'dir khyod kyis brtags pa'i 'khor ba la skye ba dang rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag ni srid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'dir khyod kyis brtags pa'i 'khor ba la skye ba dang rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag ni srid de /
translated: Thus, in this way, the sequence of birth and aging and death that you imagine in saṃsāra is not possible.

original: de med na skye ba dang rga shi med pa'i bdag ces bya ba gang yang 'khor bar 'gyur ba de gang yin /
analyzed: de med na skye ba dang rga shi med pa'i bdag ces bya ba gang yang 'khor bar 'gyur ba de gang yin /
translated: If they do not exist, then what is that self that cycles in saṃsāra without birth and aging and death?

original: smras pa / de dag la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag yod kyang rung med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: smras pa / de dag la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag yod kyang rung med kyang rung ste /
translated: Objection: Whether or not the sequence of birth and aging and death exists,

original: yod na skye ba dang rga shi dag ni re zhig yod do //
analyzed: yod na skye ba dang rga shi dag ni re zhig yod do //
translated: if it exists, then birth and aging and death would exist.

original: de dag kyang gzhi med pa ma yin pas 'ga' zhig kho na'i yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhi med pa ma yin pas 'ga' zhig kho na'i yin te /
translated: Since they are not without a basis, they are of something.

original: 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid de ni bdag yin pas bdag ni yod pa kho na'o //🔽bshad pa / gang la snga phyi lhan cig gi / rim pa de dag mi srid pa'i /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid de ni bdag yin pas bdag ni yod pa kho na'o // bshad pa / gang la snga phyi lhan cig gi / rim pa de dag mi srid pa'i /
translated: Since that which exists is the self, the self definitely exists.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:🔽What is born and dies🔽in whom the sequence🔽of earlier, later, and simultaneous

original: skye ba de dang @212b rga shi de //
analyzed: skye ba de dang @212b rga shi de //
translated: is impossible,

original: ci yi phyir na spros par byed //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na spros par byed //
translated: why do you fabricate?

original: de ltar rigs pa sngon du btang ste brtags na skye ba gang dang rga shi gang la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi srid cing med pa de la khyod skye ba ni de yin na shi ni de yin zhes ci'i phyir spros par byed🔽cing rjod par byed /🔽gal te skye ba 'am /
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa sngon du btang ste brtags na skye ba gang dang rga shi gang la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi srid cing med pa de la khyod skye ba ni de yin na shi ni de yin zhes ci'i phyir spros par byed cing rjod par byed / gal te skye ba 'am /
translated: When analyzed with the reasoning presented above, birth and aging and death in whom the sequence of earlier, later, and simultaneous is impossible and does not exist, why do you fabricate and say, “This is birth, this is aging and death”?🔽If birth or aging and death existed,

original: rga shi 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de snga ba 'am /🔽'phyi ba 'am /
