analyzed: rga shi 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de snga ba 'am / 'phyi ba 'am /
translated: it would definitely be the case that they would be earlier,

original: lhan cig tu 'gyur bar nges na /
analyzed: lhan cig tu 'gyur bar nges na /
translated: later, or simultaneous.

original: skye ba dang rga shi yod do zhes bya ba de dag la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag med pa rang bzhin du gnas pa su zhig de skad rjod par byed /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi yod do zhes bya ba de dag la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag med pa rang bzhin du gnas pa su zhig de skad rjod par byed /
translated: Who would naturally say that birth and aging and death exist, but that they are not sequential, that is, that one occurs earlier and the other later, or that they are simultaneous?

original: sems pa dang bcas pa su zhig 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: sems pa dang bcas pa su zhig 'dzin par byed /
translated: What sane person would assert that?

original: de lta bas na skye ba dang rga shi dag mi 'thad do ;
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba dang rga shi dag mi 'thad do ;
translated: Therefore birth and aging and death are untenable.🔽If they do not exist, how could the self be tenable? Therefore, give up this view that is inconsistent with reason, namely, that the self exists.

original: / de med na bdag yod par ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur de'i phyir bdag tu smra bar rigs pa dang 'gal ba de thong shig / rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni //
analyzed: / de med na bdag yod par ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur de'i phyir bdag tu smra bar rigs pa dang 'gal ba de thong shig / rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni //
translated: Cause and effect,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni mtshan gzhi nyid //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni mtshan gzhi nyid //
translated: characteristics and the basis of those characteristics,

original: tshor dang tshor po nyid dang ni //
analyzed: tshor dang tshor po nyid dang ni //
translated: feeling and the feeler,

original: don yod gang dag ci yang rung //
analyzed: don yod gang dag ci yang rung //
translated: and whatever else exists

original: ji ltar brtags na skye ba dang // rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pa de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu dang mtshan nyid dang // mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / tshor ba dang / tshor ba po dang /
analyzed: ji ltar brtags na skye ba dang // rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pa de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu dang mtshan nyid dang // mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / tshor ba dang / tshor ba po dang /
translated: How is it to be examined? Just as the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous is untenable for birth and aging and death, so too the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous is untenable for any existent thing that is imagined to exist in any way, such as cause and effect, characteristic and the basis that is characterized, feeling and the feeler,

original: don gzhan gang dag ci yang rung ba rnam par grol ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / shes pa dang / shes bya dang / tshad ma dang / gzhal bya la sogs pa yod par brtags pa de dag thams cad la yang snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad do //
analyzed: don gzhan gang dag ci yang rung ba rnam par grol ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / shes pa dang / shes bya dang / tshad ma dang / gzhal bya la sogs pa yod par brtags pa de dag thams cad la yang snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad do //
translated: and any other object that is imagined to exist in any way, such as liberation and nirvāṇa, cognition and the cognized, valid knowledge and the object of valid knowledge, and so on.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it to be examined?

original: re zhig gal te 'bras bu snga bar gyur la /🔽rgyu 'phyi bar gyur na de lta na 'bras bu rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re zhig gal te 'bras bu snga bar gyur la / rgyu 'phyi bar gyur na de lta na 'bras bu rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: First, if the effect were to occur earlier🔽and the cause were to occur later, in that case the effect would be without a cause.

original: 'bras bu yod na yang rgyus ci bya ste rgyur brtags pa don med pa nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod na yang rgyus ci bya ste rgyur brtags pa don med pa nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the effect exists, what would the cause do? It follows that the imputation of a cause would be meaningless.

original: ci ste rgyu snga bar gyur la 'bras bu 'phyi bar gyur na yang rgyu 'bras bu med pa can du 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu snga bar gyur la 'bras bu 'phyi bar gyur na yang rgyu 'bras bu med pa can du 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: But if the cause were to come first and the effect were to come later, then the cause would be without an effect. That also is untenable.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu med na ji ltar rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu med na ji ltar rgyur 'gyur /
translated: In this way, if there is no effect, how could there be a cause?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni de lta na rgyu ma yin par gang yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni de lta na rgyu ma yin par gang yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if there were, then nothing would not be a cause.

original: ci ste rgyu dang 'bras bu dag lhan cig tu gyur na de lta na yang skyon de nyid de /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu dang 'bras bu dag lhan cig tu gyur na de lta na yang skyon de nyid de /
translated: But if the cause and effect were to come together, then in that case, the error would be just that.

original: gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Both would be without a cause, and the effect would be fully established from itself alone, without depending on the cause. That also is untenable.

original: de bzhin du gal te mtshan nyid snga bar gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te mtshan nyid snga bar gyur la /
translated: In the same way, if the characteristic were to come first

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'phyi bar gyur na de lta na yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi @213a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'phyi bar gyur na de lta na yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi @213a * //
translated: and the basis of the characteristic were to come later, then in that case, the basis of the characteristic

original: ma skyes na de gang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: ma skyes na de gang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
translated: would not have arisen. What would the characteristic be the characteristic of?

original: 'dis mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid ces bya na /
analyzed: 'dis mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid ces bya na /
translated: If it is called a characteristic because it is that which characterizes,

original: 'dis gang mtshon par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi de yang ma skyes pas med de /
analyzed: 'dis gang mtshon par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi de yang ma skyes pas med de /
translated: Also, the basis of the characteristics that is to be signified does not exist because it is not produced.

original: de med na mtshon par mi byed pa de ci ltar mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na mtshon par mi byed pa de ci ltar mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
translated: If it does not exist, how could that which does not signify be a characteristic?

original: ci ste yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi snga bar gyur la mtshan nyid 'phyi bar gyur na de lta na yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mtshan nyid med pa can du thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ci ste yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi snga bar gyur la mtshan nyid 'phyi bar gyur na de lta na yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mtshan nyid med pa can du thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Moreover, if the basis of the characteristics existed first and the characteristics existed later, then it follows that the basis of the characteristics would be without characteristics. That also is untenable.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: In that case, how could a thing without characteristics exist?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did, then even the horns of a rabbit and so on would exist.

original: mtshan nyid du brtag pa don med pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid du brtag pa don med pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the postulation of characteristics would be pointless.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid du 'dod pa yin na de gal te mtshan nyid de med pa nyid du yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi grub na de la yang mtshan nyid kyis ci bya /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid du 'dod pa yin na de gal te mtshan nyid de med pa nyid du yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi grub na de la yang mtshan nyid kyis ci bya /
translated: If you assert that a characteristic is for the sake of establishing the basis of those characteristics, then if the basis of those characteristics is established even without those characteristics, what would a characteristic do for it?

original: ci ste yang mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag lhan cig tu gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste yang mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dag lhan cig tu gyur na /
translated: But if the characteristic and the basis of those characteristics were to occur simultaneously,

original: de lta na yang skyon de nyid de gnyi ga rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ba dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta na yang skyon de nyid de gnyi ga rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ba dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mtshan nyid la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: then in that case the error would be that neither would have a cause, and the basis of those characteristics would be established from itself alone, without depending on a characteristic. But that is untenable.

original: de bzhin du gal te tshor ba po snga bar gyur la tshor ba 'phyi bar gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te tshor ba po snga bar gyur la tshor ba 'phyi bar gyur na /
translated: So too, if the feeler were to occur earlier and feeling were to occur later,

original: de lta na yang tshor ba med cing ma skyes na de gang gi tshor ba por 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang tshor ba med cing ma skyes na de gang gi tshor ba por 'gyur /
translated: then in that case, if feeling does not exist and has not yet arisen, what would be the feeler?

original: tshor bar byed pa na tshor ba po yin na tshor ba de nyid ni ma skyes te /
analyzed: tshor bar byed pa na tshor ba po yin na tshor ba de nyid ni ma skyes te /
translated: If one is a feeler when one is causing feeling, then that feeling has not yet arisen.

original: de med na des ci zhig tshor bar byed pa /
analyzed: de med na des ci zhig tshor bar byed pa /
translated: If it does not exist, what does it cause to feel?

original: tshor bar mi byed na ni ji ltar tshor ba por 'gyur /
analyzed: tshor bar mi byed na ni ji ltar tshor ba por 'gyur /
translated: If it does not cause feeling, how could it be a feeler?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni thams cad kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad dang ma phrad par tshor ba por 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni thams cad kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad dang ma phrad par tshor ba por 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: If it could, then even without encountering any pleasure or pain, it would be a feeler. But that is unacceptable.

original: ci ste yang tshor ba snga bar gyur la tshor ba po 'phyi bar gyur na de lta na yang tshor bar mi byed bzhin du tshor bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ci ste yang tshor ba snga bar gyur la tshor ba po 'phyi bar gyur na de lta na yang tshor bar mi byed bzhin du tshor bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: But if feeling were to occur earlier and the feeler were to occur later, then even without causing feeling, it would be a feeler. But that is unacceptable.

original: 'di ltar tshor bar mi byed pa ji ltar tshor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshor bar mi byed pa ji ltar tshor bar 'gyur /
translated: In that case, how could that which does not cause feeling be a feeler?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni gang yang gang gi tshe gang du yang tshor ba dang bral bar mi 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni gang yang gang gi tshe gang du yang tshor ba dang bral bar mi 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: If it could, then no one would ever be without feeling. But that is unacceptable.

original: ci ste yang tshor ba dang tshor ba po dag lhan cig nyid du rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste yang tshor ba dang tshor ba po dag lhan cig nyid du rtog na /
translated: But if you imagine that feeling and the feeler occur simultaneously,

original: de lta na yang skyon de nyid de gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba dang / tshor ba po tshor ba la mi ltos pa kho na tshor bar mi byed bzhin du rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur ba dang / tshor ba yang tshor ba po la mi ltos pa kho na sus kyang @213b tshor bar mi byed bzhin du rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do /
analyzed: de lta na yang skyon de nyid de gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba dang / tshor ba po tshor ba la mi ltos pa kho na tshor bar mi byed bzhin du rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur ba dang / tshor ba yang tshor ba po la mi ltos pa kho na sus kyang @213b tshor bar mi byed bzhin du rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do /
translated: But that is also untenable, because in that case both would be causeless, the experiencer would not rely on feeling, and it would be established from itself without feeling, and feeling would not rely on the experiencer, and it would be established from itself without anyone feeling it.

original: de bzhin du gal te rnam par grol bas de yang mi 'thad mya ngan las 'das pa snga bar gyur na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa yang mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te rnam par grol bas de yang mi 'thad mya ngan las 'das pa snga bar gyur na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa yang mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te /
translated: If nirvana were prior to the liberated being, then the being with afflictions would also attain nirvana.

original: de lta na su yang mya ngan las ma 'das par mi 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta na su yang mya ngan las ma 'das par mi 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But that is untenable, because then no one would not attain nirvana.

original: ci ste rnam par grol bas mya ngan las 'das pa 'phyi bar gyur na ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma thob pa nyid du yang rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste rnam par grol bas mya ngan las 'das pa 'phyi bar gyur na ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma thob pa nyid du yang rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if nirvana were later than liberation, then one would be liberated without having attained nirvana.

original: de lta na yang mya ngan las 'das pa ma thob pa thams cad rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de lta na yang mya ngan las 'das pa ma thob pa thams cad rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: And in that case, all those who have not attained nirvana would be liberated.

original: rnam par grol nas phyis mya ngan las 'da' ba don mod pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol nas phyis mya ngan las 'da' ba don mod pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And having been liberated, it would be pointless to attain nirvana later.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma skyes pa ma byung ba zhes bya na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma skyes pa ma byung ba zhes bya na /
translated: Nirvana is called “unborn” and “non-arisen.”

original: sngon ma byung la phyis byung bar gyur na skye ba can dang mtshungs par yang 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: sngon ma byung la phyis byung bar gyur na skye ba can dang mtshungs par yang 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: But if it were non-existent before and arose later, it would be similar to that which is born, and that is unacceptable.

original: ci ste yang rnam par grol ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis lhan cig nyid du yang gyur na de lta na yang skyon de nyid de gnyi ga rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par grol ba mya ngan las 'das pa la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ci ste yang rnam par grol ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis lhan cig nyid du yang gyur na de lta na yang skyon de nyid de gnyi ga rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par grol ba mya ngan las 'das pa la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: But if liberation and nirvana were to exist simultaneously, then in that case also that error would ensue: both would be causeless, and liberation would be established from itself alone, without depending on nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang rnam par grol ba la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang rnam par grol ba la mi ltos pa kho nar rang las rab tu grub par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: And nirvana would be established from itself alone, without depending on liberation. But that is unacceptable.

original: de bzhin du shes pa dang / shes bya dang / tshad ma dang / gzhal bya la sogs pa dag la yang blta bar bya'o //🔽'khor ba 'ba' zhig sngon gyi mtha' //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa dang / shes bya dang / tshad ma dang / gzhal bya la sogs pa dag la yang blta bar bya'o // 'khor ba 'ba' zhig sngon gyi mtha' //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood in regard to knowledge and the knowable, valid cognition and the object of valid cognition, and so on.🔽Samsara alone does not have a beginning.

original: yod ma yin par ma zad kyi //
analyzed: yod ma yin par ma zad kyi //
translated: Not only that,

original: dngos rnams thams cad nyid la yang //
analyzed: dngos rnams thams cad nyid la yang //
translated: All things

original: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod ma yin //
translated: Do not have a beginning.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na dngos po thams cad la snga phyi dang / lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'khor ba 'ba' zhig la sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na dngos po thams cad la snga phyi dang / lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'khor ba 'ba' zhig la sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: Because in this way, when one analyzes things as they are, the sequence of prior, subsequent, and simultaneous is untenable for all things, therefore not only does cyclic existence not have a beginning,

original: dngos por 'dod pa thams cad la yang sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin pas dngos por snang ba ni sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / gzugs brnyan bzhin du grub bo //
analyzed: dngos por 'dod pa thams cad la yang sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin pas dngos por snang ba ni sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / gzugs brnyan bzhin du grub bo //
translated: but also all things that are asserted to be entities do not have a beginning. Therefore, the appearance of entities is established to be like an illusion, a mirage, a city of smell-eaters, and a reflection.

original: 'khor ba brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: 'khor ba brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This is the eleventh chapter, called the Critique of Cyclic Existence.

original: // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta /
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta /
translated: BUDDHAPĀLITA’S COMMENTARY ON THE ROOT TEXT OF THE MIDDLE WAY

original: bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga pa /
translated: FIfth section

original: smras pa / bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Objection: The self surely exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sdug bsngal yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because suffering exists.

original: @214a * // 'di na lus dang dbang po 'byung ba ni sdug bsngal yin no zhes bya bar thams cad kyis shes la /
analyzed: @214a * // 'di na lus dang dbang po 'byung ba ni sdug bsngal yin no zhes bya bar thams cad kyis shes la /
translated: Here, all know that the arising of the body and faculties is suffering.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The Bhagavān also said:🔽In brief, the five appropriated aggregates are suffering.

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal yod do //
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal yod do //
translated: Therefore, suffering exists.

original: gzhi med par sdug bsngal yod par mi rigs pas sdug bsngal de dag gi yin pa de 'ga' zhig kyang yod de /
analyzed: gzhi med par sdug bsngal yod par mi rigs pas sdug bsngal de dag gi yin pa de 'ga' zhig kyang yod de /
translated: Since it is illogical that suffering exists without a basis, that which is the basis of those sufferings exists.

original: sdug bsngal de dag gi yin pa de ni bdag yin pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de dag gi yin pa de ni bdag yin pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since that which is the basis of those sufferings is the self, therefore the self alone exists.

original: bshad pa / gal te sdug bsngal nyid 'thad na ni bdag kyang yod pa zhig na /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te sdug bsngal nyid 'thad na ni bdag kyang yod pa zhig na /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If suffering itself were tenable, the self would also exist.

original: sdug bsngal nyid mi 'thad pas bdag yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid mi 'thad pas bdag yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: But since suffering itself is untenable, how could the self exist?

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: kha cig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas //
analyzed: kha cig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas //
translated: Some assert that suffering is self-created,

original: gzhan gyis byas dang gnyi gas byas //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas dang gnyi gas byas //
translated: that it is created by another, that it is created by both,

original: rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod //
translated: and that it arises without a cause.

original: de ni bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: That is not tenable.

original: 'di la sdug bsngal du smra ba rnams la kha cig ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par 'dod //
analyzed: 'di la sdug bsngal du smra ba rnams la kha cig ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par 'dod //
translated: In this regard, some proponents of the doctrine of suffering say that suffering is self-produced.

original: kha cig ni sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'dod //
analyzed: kha cig ni sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'dod //
translated: Some say that suffering is produced by another.

original: kha cig ni sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gyis byas par 'dod //
analyzed: kha cig ni sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gyis byas par 'dod //
translated: Some say that suffering is produced by both self and another.

original: kha cig ni sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las glo bur kho nar byung bar 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las glo bur kho nar byung bar 'dod do //
translated: Some say that suffering arises adventitiously without a cause.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyi gas byas par smra ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal de ni bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyi gas byas pa'i phyir bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i bya ba yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyi gas byas par smra ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal de ni bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyi gas byas pa'i phyir bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i bya ba yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, in the case of those who say that suffering is produced by self, by another, or by both self and another, it follows that suffering is produced by the activity of self, another, and both, because suffering is produced by self, by another, and by both self and another.

original: de ni bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: That is not tenable.

original: sdug bsngal de ni de dag gi bya ba yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de ni de dag gi bya ba yin par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not tenable that suffering is produced by the activity of those.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te sdug bsngal bdag nyid kyis byed par gyur na yod pa'am /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal bdag nyid kyis byed par gyur na yod pa'am /
translated: If suffering were produced by itself, it would be produced by that which exists.

original: med pa zhig byed par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: med pa zhig byed par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If it is nonexistent, what is it that is made?

original: de la re zhig gal te sdug bsngal yod pa bdag nyid kyis byed do zhes rtog na /
analyzed: de la re zhig gal te sdug bsngal yod pa bdag nyid kyis byed do zhes rtog na /
translated: First, if you think that an existent suffering is made by itself,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal yod pa yang ci bya dgos //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal yod pa yang ci bya dgos //
translated: Why? Because what need is there for an existent suffering?

original: ci ste byed na ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste byed na ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is made, then it is not existent.

original: sdug bsngal yod pa bdag nyid kyis byed pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu med pa las byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yod pa bdag nyid kyis byed pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu med pa las byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If an existent suffering is made by itself, then it would arise without a cause.

original: de yang bdag nyid kyis byas na /
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid kyis byas na /
translated: Moreover, if it is made by itself,🔽then it would follow, absurdly, that there would be an infinite regress.

original: de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //🔽ci ste sdug bsngal med pa bdag nyid kyis byed do zhes bya bar rtog na /
analyzed: de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do // ci ste sdug bsngal med pa bdag nyid kyis byed do zhes bya bar rtog na /
translated: But that is unacceptable.🔽If you think that a nonexistent suffering is made by itself,

original: ji ltar med pa bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid byed par 'gyur /
translated: how could a nonexistent suffering make itself?

original: ci ste byed na ni ri bong gi rvas kyang bdag nyid byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste byed na ni ri bong gi rvas kyang bdag nyid byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it could, then the horn of a rabbit could make itself.

original: @214b de ltar re zhig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par mi rigs so //
analyzed: @214b de ltar re zhig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, first, it is illogical for suffering to be made by itself.

original: sdug bsngal ma byas shing med pa la gzhan yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma byas shing med pa la gzhan yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could suffering exist for one who has not created it and does not exist?

original: gzhan med pa kho na'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan med pa kho na'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par mi rigs so //
translated: Since it does not exist, it is illogical that suffering is created by another.

original: 'di nyid kyis bdag dang gzhan gyis byas par mi rigs pa kho nar yang rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis bdag dang gzhan gyis byas par mi rigs pa kho nar yang rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains why it is illogical that suffering is created by both self and another.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
translated: If it were created by itself,

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: then it would not arise in dependence.

original: gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
analyzed: gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
translated: Because these aggregates

original: brten nas phung po de dag 'byung //
analyzed: brten nas phung po de dag 'byung //
translated: arise in dependence on those aggregates.

original: gal te sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par gyur na de lta na brten nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par gyur na de lta na brten nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If suffering were created by itself, then it would not arise in dependence.

original: brten nas kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: brten nas kyang 'byung ste /
translated: But it does arise in dependence.

original: gang gi phyir da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag la brten nas ma 'ongs pa'i phung po de dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag la brten nas ma 'ongs pa'i phung po de dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because those future aggregates arise in dependence on these present aggregates.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Lord also said, “Name and form have consciousness as their condition.”

original: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par gyur na sdug bsngal rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par mi rigs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par gyur na sdug bsngal rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par mi rigs so //
translated: If suffering were self-produced, it would not arise through the power of causes and conditions. Therefore, it is not logical that suffering is self-produced.

original: smras pa / de de bzhin te sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas te /
analyzed: smras pa / de de bzhin te sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas te /
translated: Objection: That is so! Suffering is not self-produced.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so //
translated: In this way, suffering is produced by another.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir phung po gzhan du gyur ba 'di dag la brten nas phung po de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phung po gzhan du gyur ba 'di dag la brten nas phung po de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because these aggregates transform and those aggregates arise in dependence on them.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa // sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: bshad pa // sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Suffering is not produced by another.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gal te de las 'di gzhan zhing //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gal te de las 'di gzhan zhing //
translated: Why is that?🔽If this were different from that

original: gal te 'di las de gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te 'di las de gzhan na //
translated: and if that were different from this,

original: gzhan de dag gis 'di byas pas //
analyzed: gzhan de dag gis 'di byas pas //
translated: then that other would produce this.

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur /
translated: Suffering would be produced by another.

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i phung po de dag las da ltar gyi phung po gang dag yin pa 'di dag gzhan yin par gyur cing da ltar gyi phung po 'di las kyang ma 'ongs pa'i phung po gang dag yin pa de dag gzhan yin par gyur na ni
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i phung po de dag las da ltar gyi phung po gang dag yin pa 'di dag gzhan yin par gyur cing da ltar gyi phung po 'di las kyang ma 'ongs pa'i phung po gang dag yin pa de dag gzhan yin par gyur na ni
translated: and the future aggregates were different from the present aggregates,🔽then the future aggregates would be produced by the present aggregates,

original: de lta na da ltar gyi phung po gzhan de dag gis ma 'ongs pa'i phung po gzhan 'di dag byas pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de lta na da ltar gyi phung po gzhan de dag gis ma 'ongs pa'i phung po gzhan 'di dag byas pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: and suffering would be produced by another.

original: de dag las kyang 'di dag gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag las kyang 'di dag gzhan ma yin la /
translated: But they are not different from those,

original: 'di dag las kyang de dag gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag las kyang de dag gzhan ma yin no //
translated: and those are not different from them.

original: gzhan nyid med na ji ltar sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pas 'thad /
analyzed: gzhan nyid med na ji ltar sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pas 'thad /
translated: If they are not different, how could suffering be produced by another?

original: de la 'di snyam du ji ltar de dag gzhan nyid ma yin snyam na de ni 'og nas /🔽gang la brten @215a * //
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du ji ltar de dag gzhan nyid ma yin snyam na de ni 'og nas / gang la brten @215a * //
translated: If you think in that case how could they not be different,🔽then later it is said:

original: te gang yin pa //
analyzed: te gang yin pa //
translated: That which depends on this

original: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //
translated: is not tenable as different from this.

original: ces 'byung bas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: ces 'byung bas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is also untenable that suffering is created by another.

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal byas pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang mi smra'i /
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal byas pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang mi smra'i /
translated: Objection: I do not say that suffering is created by suffering itself, and therefore suffering is created by itself.

original: sdug bsngal rgyu dang rkyen las byung bas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes kyang mi smra'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu dang rkyen las byung bas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes kyang mi smra'o //
translated: I also do not say that suffering is created by another, because suffering arises from causes and conditions.

original: sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas pas de'i phyir re zhig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang smra la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas pas de'i phyir re zhig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang smra la /
translated: I say that suffering is created by itself, because suffering is created by the person himself.🔽I also say that suffering is created by another, because suffering is created by another person.

original: sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas pas de'i phyir /🔽re zhig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang smra la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas pas de'i phyir / re zhig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang smra la /
translated: I say that suffering is created by itself, because suffering is created by the person himself.

original: sdug bsngal gang zag gzhan gyis byas pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes kyang smra'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang zag gzhan gyis byas pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes kyang smra'o //
translated: I also say that suffering is created by another, because suffering is created by another person.

original: bshad pa / gal te gang zag bdag gis ni //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te gang zag bdag gis ni //
translated: If suffering is created by the person himself,

original: sdug bsngal byas na gang bdag gis //
analyzed: sdug bsngal byas na gang bdag gis //
translated: then who is this person who creates suffering?

original: sdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag ni //
translated: The person who creates suffering

original: sdug bsngal med pa de dag yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa de dag yin //
translated: is one who is without suffering.

original: gal te gang zag bdag gis phung po sdug bsngal byas so zhes zer na //
analyzed: gal te gang zag bdag gis phung po sdug bsngal byas so zhes zer na //
translated: If you say that the person creates the suffering of the aggregates,

original: khyod kyi gang phung po sdug bsngal med pa gsal bar byed pa med pas bdag gis phung po sdug bsngal de byas pa'i gang zag sdug bsngal med pa de gang yin pa de ji smros shig /'di ltar phung po sdug bsngal med pa gsal bar byed pa med
analyzed: khyod kyi gang phung po sdug bsngal med pa gsal bar byed pa med pas bdag gis phung po sdug bsngal de byas pa'i gang zag sdug bsngal med pa de gang yin pa de ji smros shig /'di ltar phung po sdug bsngal med pa gsal bar byed pa med
translated: then you must explain what is the person who is without suffering, who creates the suffering of the aggregates, since you have not clarified the person who is without the suffering of the aggregates.

original: pa'i gang zag 'ba' zhig pa gang yin pa la gdags pa yang med na des ji ltar sdug bsngal byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa'i gang zag 'ba' zhig pa gang yin pa la gdags pa yang med na des ji ltar sdug bsngal byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If the person is a mere designation, and is not the creator of the suffering of the aggregates, then how could he create suffering?

original: de'i phyir gang zag bdag gis sdug bsngal byas zhes bya ba yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag bdag gis sdug bsngal byas zhes bya ba yang mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it makes no sense to say that the person creates the suffering of the aggregates.

original: gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas so zhes gang smras pa de la'ang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas so zhes gang smras pa de la'ang bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, we must explain what has been said, namely, that suffering is created by another person.

original: gal te gang zag gzhan las ni //
analyzed: gal te gang zag gzhan las ni //
translated: If suffering is created by another person,

original: sdug bsngal byung na gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: sdug bsngal byung na gzhan zhig gis //
translated: If suffering is created by another,

original: sdug bsngal de byas gang sbyin de //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de byas gang sbyin de //
translated: then who is that one who gives it to another?🔽How could it be tenable that one who is without suffering

original: sdug bsngal med par ji ltar rung //🔽gal te gang zag gzhan gyis phung po 'di sdug bsngal byas shing des de byas nas gzhan la sbyin par byed na gzhan gyis de byas nas gang la sbyin par bya ba de sdug bsngal med cing /🔽sdug bsngal dang bral ba gsal bar byed pa med pa 'ba' zhig par ji ltar rung bar 'gyur ba de je smros shig /'di ltar nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa gang la gdags pa yang med na gsal bar byed pa med de gzhan yin du
analyzed: sdug bsngal med par ji ltar rung // gal te gang zag gzhan gyis phung po 'di sdug bsngal byas shing des de byas nas gzhan la sbyin par byed na gzhan gyis de byas nas gang la sbyin par bya ba de sdug bsngal med cing / sdug bsngal dang bral ba gsal bar byed pa med pa 'ba' zhig par ji ltar rung bar 'gyur ba de je smros shig /'di ltar nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa gang la gdags pa yang med na gsal bar byed pa med de gzhan yin du
translated: creates suffering?

original: @215b zin kyang ji ltar sdug bsngal byed par 'gyur /🔽nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa de ni /
analyzed: @215b zin kyang ji ltar sdug bsngal byed par 'gyur /🔽nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa de ni /
translated: If the suffering of these aggregates is created by another person and that one creates it and gives it to another, then how could it be tenable that one who is without suffering and is free of suffering and is not an illuminator, that is, is not a creator, that is, is not a person, that is, is not a sentient being, that is, is not a living being, that is, is not a human being, that is, is not a man, that is, is not a woman, that is, is not a neuter, that is, is not a child, that is, is not a youth, that is, is not an elder, that is, is not a monk, that is, is not a brahman, that is, is not a god, that is, is not a demon, that is, is not a ghost, that is, is not a hungry ghost, that is, is not a hell being, that is, is not a human being, that is, is not a nonhuman being, that is, is not a sentient being, that is, is not a living being, that is, is not a person, that is, is not a human being, that is, is not a man, that is, is not a woman, that is, is not a neuter, that is, is not a child, that is, is not a youth, that is, is not an elder, that is, is not a monk, that is, is not a brahman, that is, is not a god, that is, is not a demon, that is, is not a ghost, that is, is not a hungry ghost, that is, is not a hell being, that is, is not a human being, that is, is not a nonhuman being, that is, is not a sentient being, that is, is not a living being, that is, is not a person, that is, is not a human being, that is, is not a man, that is, is not a woman, that is, is not a neuter, that is, is not a child, that is, is not a youth, that is, is not an elder, that is, is not a monk, that is, is not a bra

original: rnam pa thams cad du mi srid pa yin na de'i sdug bsngal byed pa gzhan ga la yod na sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes bag tsha ba med par smra /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mi srid pa yin na de'i sdug bsngal byed pa gzhan ga la yod na sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes bag tsha ba med par smra /
translated: If it is utterly impossible, then how could the suffering of another exist that is produced by another?

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: bdag gis byas par ma grub pas //
analyzed: bdag gis byas par ma grub pas //
translated: Since self-production is not established,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
translated: how could suffering be produced by another?

original: 'di la gal te sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes bya ba de rab tu grub par gyur na ni des na sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes bya ba de yang 'thad par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes bya ba de rab tu grub par gyur na ni des na sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes bya ba de yang 'thad par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: In this regard, if the statement “Suffering is produced by itself” were established, then the statement “Suffering is produced by another” would also be tenable.

original: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes bya ba de ni rab tu ma grub ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes bya ba de ni rab tu ma grub ste /
translated: But the statement “Suffering is produced by itself” is not established.

original: de sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pas rab tu ma grub pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pas rab tu ma grub pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since the statement “Suffering is produced by itself” is not established, how could suffering be produced by another?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa //
translated: If suffering produced by another

original: de ni de yi bdag byas 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni de yi bdag byas 'gyur //
translated: existed, then it would be produced by that self.

original: gal te gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa de gzhan de'i bdag gis byas pa nyid du gyur na gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin no //🔽ci ste de des bdag gis byas pa ma yin na ji ltar /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa de gzhan de'i bdag gis byas pa nyid du gyur na gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin no // ci ste de des bdag gis byas pa ma yin na ji ltar /
translated: If the suffering that is created by another were created by that other’s self, then it would not be created by another.

original: cig shos kyi de gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur /
analyzed: cig shos kyi de gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur /
translated: But if it is not created by that other’s self, how could it be created by another?

original: de'i phyir bdag gis byas pa de gzhan gyi thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis byas pa de gzhan gyi thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it would follow that what is created by oneself would be created by another.

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par mi 'thad pa de ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par mi 'thad pa de ni bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been demonstrated that it is untenable that suffering is created by another.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par rab tu ma grub pas sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa med na sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur bas sdug bsngal gang gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur ba gang yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par rab tu ma grub pas sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa med na sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur bas sdug bsngal gang gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur ba gang yin /
translated: Therefore, since suffering is not created by oneself, how could suffering be created by another? What suffering is created by another?

original: de'i phyir gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas so zhes bya bar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas so zhes bya bar yang mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is also unreasonable to say that suffering is created by another person.

original: smras pa / ci khyod smra ba po'i bsam pa ma rtogs par rang gi blo gros kyi rtogs pas sbyar ba'i don la tshig gis skyon 'dogs par byed dam /
analyzed: smras pa / ci khyod smra ba po'i bsam pa ma rtogs par rang gi blo gros kyi rtogs pas sbyar ba'i don la tshig gis skyon 'dogs par byed dam /
translated: Objection: Do you not understand the intention of the speaker but rather are you just looking for verbal faults in the meaning of the statement according to your own understanding?

original: 'di ltar kho bo ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhe 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhe 'am /
translated: We do not say that suffering is self-created or

original: gzhan gyis byas so zhes mi smra'i /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas so zhes mi smra'i /
translated: that it is created by another.🔽Because it is said that suffering is created by the person himself,

original: 'di ltar gang gi phyir re zhig gang zag bdag gis de byas pas de'i phyir gang zag bdag gis byas so zhes smra ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir re zhig gang zag bdag gis de byas pas de'i phyir gang zag bdag gis byas so zhes smra ste /
translated: since it is created by that person,🔽and because suffering is not other than the person,

original: sdug bsngal de las gang zag dang gzhan ma yin pas sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal de byas pa'i phyir rnam grangs las sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang smra zhing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de las gang zag dang gzhan ma yin pas sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal de byas pa'i phyir rnam grangs las sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang smra zhing /
translated: it is said that suffering is created by the person.

original: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pas rnam grangs las sdug bsngal gzhan gyis @216a * //🔽byas so zhes kyang smra'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pas rnam grangs las sdug bsngal gzhan gyis @216a * //🔽byas so zhes kyang smra'o //
translated: Since the person is not suffering, it is said that suffering is created by another.

original: bshad pa // ci khyod shing ljon pa rtsa ba rul pa la chu ldugs par byed dam /
analyzed: bshad pa // ci khyod shing ljon pa rtsa ba rul pa la chu ldugs par byed dam /
translated: Do you pour water on a tree whose roots are rotten?

original: khyod gang zag nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pa la sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas so smra'am /
analyzed: khyod gang zag nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pa la sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas so smra'am /
translated: Do you say that suffering is produced by the person himself when it is completely untenable that the person exists without appropriation?

original: 'di ltar gal te gang zag nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa 'ga' zhig rab tu grub par gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te gang zag nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa 'ga' zhig rab tu grub par gyur na ni /
translated: In that case, if the person existed without appropriation,

original: des na sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas so zhes de skad smra bar yang rigs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas so zhes de skad smra bar yang rigs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then it would be reasonable to say, “Suffering is produced by the person himself.”

original: gang zag nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa ni ji ltar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang zag nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa ni ji ltar yang mi rigs so //
translated: But the person who exists without appropriation is untenable in any way.

original: de med na /
analyzed: de med na /
translated: If that does not exist,

original: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //
translated: Suffering is not self-produced.

original: gang zag nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa de med na sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin pas re zhig sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis ma byas so //
analyzed: gang zag nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa de med na sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin pas re zhig sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis ma byas so //
translated: If the person who exists without appropriation does not exist, then suffering is not produced by the person himself. Therefore, for the time being, suffering is not produced by the person himself.

original: sdug bsngal de las gang zag de gzhan ma yin pas sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal de byas pa'i phyir rnam grangs las sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang smra'o zhes gang smras pa de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de las gang zag de gzhan ma yin pas sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal de byas pa'i phyir rnam grangs las sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang smra'o zhes gang smras pa de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: But since that person is not different from suffering, suffering is produced by suffering. Therefore, it is said that suffering is self-produced.

original: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //
translated: That itself does not produce that.

original: de lta na sdug bsngal de nyid kyis sdug bsngal de ma byas so //
analyzed: de lta na sdug bsngal de nyid kyis sdug bsngal de ma byas so //
translated: In that case, that suffering does not produce that suffering.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar zin pa'i sdug bsngal las de gzhan ma yin par brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zin pa'i sdug bsngal las de gzhan ma yin par brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is said that it is not different from the appropriated suffering.

original: nye bar len pa las gzhan ma yin par gyur pa 'dis ci yang ma byas te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa las gzhan ma yin par gyur pa 'dis ci yang ma byas te /
translated: This appropriated suffering does not produce anything at all.

original: des nye bar len pa'i sdug bsngal de nyid byas grang na /
analyzed: des nye bar len pa'i sdug bsngal de nyid byas grang na /
translated: If it were to produce that appropriated suffering,

original: gang gi phyir byas pa las de gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba de'i phyir gang zag nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa des ni ma byas pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal de nyid kyis sdug bsngal de byas so zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa🔽ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byas pa las de gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba de'i phyir gang zag nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa des ni ma byas pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal de nyid kyis sdug bsngal de byas so zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the action is not different from the agent, therefore, since the person alone, without appropriation, does not perform the action, it is illogical to say, “That suffering is produced by that very suffering.”

original: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pas rnam grangs las sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes gang smras pa de la yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pas rnam grangs las sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes gang smras pa de la yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: Since the person is not the suffering, it is illogical to say, “Suffering is produced by another.”

original: gal te gzhan bdag ma byas na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan bdag ma byas na //
translated: If the other is not self-produced,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan byas ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan byas ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could suffering be produced by another?

original: gal te gang zag de bdag nyid kyis ma byas shing bdag nyid rab tu ma grub ste /
analyzed: gal te gang zag de bdag nyid kyis ma byas shing bdag nyid rab tu ma grub ste /
translated: If the person is not self-produced and does not exist by itself,

original: sdug bsngal med pa 'ba' zhig pa yod pa nyid ma yin na rang gi bdag nyid rab tu ma grub pa gzhan du gyur pa de med pas sdug bsngal de gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa 'ba' zhig pa yod pa nyid ma yin na rang gi bdag nyid rab tu ma grub pa gzhan du gyur pa de med pas sdug bsngal de gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur /
translated: and if the person alone, without appropriation, does not exist, then since the person alone, without appropriation, does not exist, how could suffering be produced by another?

original: nye bar len pa de @216b ma skyes shing /
analyzed: nye bar len pa de @216b ma skyes shing /
translated: If appropriation does not arise,

original: med na gang zag de yod du zin kyang gzhan du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: med na gang zag de yod du zin kyang gzhan du ga la 'gyur /
translated: and does not exist, then even if the person exists, how could it be other?

original: de lta bas na de dag thams cad sngar lan btab zin pa la khyod tshig gzhan gyis don gzhan du bsams shing de dag nyid yang smras par gyur to //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag thams cad sngar lan btab zin pa la khyod tshig gzhan gyis don gzhan du bsams shing de dag nyid yang smras par gyur to //
translated: Therefore, you have thought about the meaning of other words and have repeated those very words in response to all of those previous arguments.

original: smras pa / sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan so so byas par mi rigs su zin kyang ;
analyzed: smras pa / sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan so so byas par mi rigs su zin kyang ;
translated: Objection: Although it is illogical that suffering is produced by each of self and other,

original: / sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan nyid gnyi ga 'dus pas byas pa ni yod do //
analyzed: / sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan nyid gnyi ga 'dus pas byas pa ni yod do //
translated: suffering is produced by both self and other together.

original: bshad pa / gal te re res byas gyur na //🔽sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te re res byas gyur na // sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur //
translated: In response Nāgārjuna explains:🔽If suffering were produced by each,🔽suffering would be produced by both.

original: gal te re res byas pa yod par gyur na ni sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas pa de nyid kyang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te re res byas pa yod par gyur na ni sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas pa de nyid kyang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If suffering were produced by each, then that suffering produced by both self and other would exist.

original: sdug bsngal re res byas par mi rigs pa de ni bstan zin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal re res byas par mi rigs pa de ni bstan zin te /
translated: But it has been shown that it is illogical that suffering is produced by each.

original: sdug bsngal re res byas pa med na sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas pas 'thad par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal re res byas pa med na sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas pas 'thad par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If suffering is not produced by each, how could it be tenable that suffering is produced by both?

original: gang gi tshe bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga sdug bsngal med pa 'ba' zhig par mi srid pa de'i tshe ji ltar de nyid kyis sdug bsngal byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga sdug bsngal med pa 'ba' zhig par mi srid pa de'i tshe ji ltar de nyid kyis sdug bsngal byed par 'gyur te /
translated: When it is impossible that both self and other are only without suffering, then how could suffering be produced by that?

original: de'i phyir bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas sdug bsngal byas so zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas sdug bsngal byas so zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is also untenable to state, “Suffering is produced by both self and other.”

original: smras pa / gal te sdug bsngal re res kyang ma byas la gnyi gas byas par yang mi rigs na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te sdug bsngal re res kyang ma byas la gnyi gas byas par yang mi rigs na /
translated: Objection: If suffering is not produced by each, and it is also not tenable that suffering is produced by both,

original: 'o na de lta na sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi gas ma byas pas rgyu med pa las byung ba yin no / bshad pa /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi gas ma byas pas rgyu med pa las byung ba yin no / bshad pa /
translated: then in that case, since suffering is not produced by self, other, or both, it is produced without a cause.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gzhan gyis ma byas bdag ma byas //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas bdag ma byas //
translated: Not produced by another, not produced by self,

original: sdug bsngal rgyu med ga la 'gyur //🔽gzhan gyis byas pa ni gzhan gyis de byas pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu med ga la 'gyur // gzhan gyis byas pa ni gzhan gyis de byas pa ste /
translated: how could suffering be without a cause?🔽“Produced by another” means that suffering is produced by another.

original: gzhan gyis de byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with “another produces that.”

original: gzhan gyis ma byas pa ni gzhan gyis mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas pa ni gzhan gyis mi byed pa'o //
translated: “Not done by another” means not done by another.

original: bdag gis byas pa ni bdag gis de byas pa ste bdag gis de byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa ni bdag gis de byas pa ste bdag gis de byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Done by oneself” means done by oneself, that is, done by oneself.

original: bdag gis ma byas pa ni bdag gis mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis ma byas pa ni bdag gis mi byed pa'o //
translated: “Not done by oneself” means not done by oneself.

original: gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang bdag gis ma byas pa ni gzhan gyis mi byed pa dang bdag gis mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang bdag gis ma byas pa ni gzhan gyis mi byed pa dang bdag gis mi byed pa'o //
translated: “Not done by another and not done by oneself” means not done by another and not done by oneself.

original: de ltar gzhan gyis kyang ma byas na sdug bsngal glo bur bar 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyis kyang ma byas na sdug bsngal glo bur bar 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If it is not done by another, how could it be tenable that suffering arises adventitiously?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni rtag tu thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni rtag tu thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did, it would arise constantly and from everything.

original: de lta yin na ni rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid dang / 'dres pa'i skyon chen por yang 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid dang / 'dres pa'i skyon chen por yang 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: If that were so, all undertakings would be pointless, and the great error of confusion would occur. Therefore, this is unacceptable.

original: de bas na sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung ba zhes bya ba de ni bzang po ma yin pa nyid do //🔽smras pa / gal te de ltar @217a * //
analyzed: de bas na sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung ba zhes bya ba de ni bzang po ma yin pa nyid do // smras pa / gal te de ltar @217a * //
translated: Therefore, this statement, “Suffering arises without a cause,” is not good.

original: sdug bsngal med na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med na /
translated: Objection: If suffering does not exist,🔽then what is the purpose of the Buddha’s teaching?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srungs sdug bsngal yod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srungs sdug bsngal yod de /
translated: The Bhagavān said to Kāśyapa, “Suffering exists.

original: ngas sdug bsngal shes so //
analyzed: ngas sdug bsngal shes so //
translated: I know suffering.🔽I see suffering.”

original: mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu /
analyzed: mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu /
translated: In response to that, we say:

original: bshad pa / sdug bsngal med do zhes de skad du ma zer /🔽kho bos / de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bshad pa / sdug bsngal med do zhes de skad du ma zer / kho bos / de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: Do not say, “Suffering does not exist.”

original: zhes ma smras sam /
analyzed: zhes ma smras sam /
translated: Have we not said,🔽“Therefore it does not arise in dependence”?

original: de'i phyir kho bo ni sdug bsngal brten nas 'byung bar smra'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo ni sdug bsngal brten nas 'byung bar smra'i /
translated: Therefore we say suffering arises in dependence.

original: bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / gnyi gas byas pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / gnyi gas byas pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: We do not say it is produced by itself, by another, by both, or that it arises without a cause.

original: sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig rnam pa bzhi //
translated: Suffering does not exist in the fourfold way.

original: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
analyzed: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
translated: But it is not that it does not exist at all.

original: phyi rol dngos po rnams la yang ;
analyzed: phyi rol dngos po rnams la yang ;
translated: External things also

original: / rnam pa bzhi po yod ma yin //
analyzed: / rnam pa bzhi po yod ma yin //
translated: Do not exist in the fourfold way.

original: phung po sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig la bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / gnyi gas byas pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba rnam pa bzhi po dag yod pa ma yin pa de ltar gzung bar mi bya'i //
analyzed: phung po sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig la bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / gnyi gas byas pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba rnam pa bzhi po dag yod pa ma yin pa de ltar gzung bar mi bya'i //
translated: The aggregates are not produced in any of the four ways: by themselves, by something else, by both, or causelessly.

original: phyir rol gyi dngos po gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang rnam pa bzhi po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir rol gyi dngos po gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang rnam pa bzhi po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: External things such as form are also not produced in any of the four ways.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: re zhig gzugs nyid kyis gzugs bdag nyid ma byas so //🔽gal te gzugs kyis bdag nyid byed na yod pa 'am /
analyzed: re zhig gzugs nyid kyis gzugs bdag nyid ma byas so // gal te gzugs kyis bdag nyid byed na yod pa 'am /
translated: Form is not produced by form itself.

original: med pa zhig byed grang na /
analyzed: med pa zhig byed grang na /
translated: If form were to produce itself, would it produce itself as existent or nonexistent?

original: de la re zhig gal te gzugs su yod pa nyid yin na de la yang bya ci dgos /
analyzed: de la re zhig gal te gzugs su yod pa nyid yin na de la yang bya ci dgos /
translated: First, if form were to exist, what need would there be to produce it?

original: ci ste gzugs med na ni ji ltar med pa dag nyid kyis bdag nyid byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste gzugs med na ni ji ltar med pa dag nyid kyis bdag nyid byed par 'gyur /
translated: But if form does not exist, how could it produce itself?

original: ci ste byed na ni dri za'i grong khyer gyis kyang rang gi ra ba rtsig par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste byed na ni dri za'i grong khyer gyis kyang rang gi ra ba rtsig par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it could, then a phantom city could build its own ramparts.

original: gzugs bdag gis byas pa yin na /
analyzed: gzugs bdag gis byas pa yin na /
translated: If form were created by itself,

original: gzugs brten nas 'byung ngo zhes bya bar mi 'thad pas de yang mi 'dod do//
analyzed: gzugs brten nas 'byung ngo zhes bya bar mi 'thad pas de yang mi 'dod do//
translated: it would not be tenable to say that it originates in dependence on conditions.🔽Therefore, that is unacceptable.

original: de la gzugs de 'byung ba gzhan du gyur pa dag gis byas so snyam na /
analyzed: de la gzugs de 'byung ba gzhan du gyur pa dag gis byas so snyam na /
translated: If you think that form is created by the transformation of the primary elements,

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that is also unacceptable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzugs kyi rgyu 'byung ba dag las gzugs gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu 'byung ba dag las gzugs gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because form is not different from the primary elements that are the cause of form.

original: de ni 'og nas kyang /🔽gang la brten te gang yin pa //
analyzed: de ni 'og nas kyang / gang la brten te gang yin pa //
translated: This will be explained later:🔽It is not tenable that

original: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //🔽ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad // ces 'byung ste /
translated: what depends on that is different from that.

original: gzugs ma byas pa ma skyes ba med pa las byung ba rnams ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur /🔽gzugs ni gnyi gas byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ma byas pa ma skyes ba med pa las byung ba rnams ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur / gzugs ni gnyi gas byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: How could form that is not created, not arisen, and not nonexistent arise from that which is different?

original: re res byas par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzugs rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: re res byas par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // gzugs rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Form is not created by both because it is untenable that it is created by each.🔽Form does not arise from a cause because it is not created by another and it is not created by itself.

original: gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / bdag gis @217b ma byas ba rgyu med pa las ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / bdag gis @217b ma byas ba rgyu med pa las ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: How could it arise without a cause?

original: skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because many errors would ensue.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa dngos po thams cad la yang rnam pa bzhi po dag mi 'thad pas 'grub par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa dngos po thams cad la yang rnam pa bzhi po dag mi 'thad pas 'grub par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, since the four alternatives are untenable in all things, such as sound, one should see that they are established.

original: sdug bsngal brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa'o /🔽// / smras pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa'o / // / smras pa /
translated: This is the twelfth chapter, called Critique of Suffering.

original: sdug bsngal yang yod phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyang yod de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang yod phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyang yod de /
translated: Objection: Suffering exists and external things exist.

original: de dag yod pa la rnam pa bzhi po 'ba' zhig mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de dag yod pa la rnam pa bzhi po 'ba' zhig mi 'thad do //
translated: It is only the four alternatives that do not exist.

original: rnam pa bzhi po dag med du zin kyang re zhig / dngos po rnams ni rab tu grub po //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po dag med du zin kyang re zhig / dngos po rnams ni rab tu grub po //
translated: Even if the four alternatives do not exist, things are still established.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod sgyu ma'i glang po ches 'gro bar 'dod dam /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod sgyu ma'i glang po ches 'gro bar 'dod dam /
translated: Response: Do you wish to go on the illusory elephant?

original: khyod rnam pa bzhi po dag gis ma byas pa'i dngos po rnams yang dag par yod par rtog go //
analyzed: khyod rnam pa bzhi po dag gis ma byas pa'i dngos po rnams yang dag par yod par rtog go //
translated: You imagine that things exist in reality without being created by the four alternatives.

original: 'dir yang dag pa gang yin pa de nyid gzung bar bya ba'i rigs pa snyam /
analyzed: 'dir yang dag pa gang yin pa de nyid gzung bar bya ba'i rigs pa snyam /
translated: Here, it is reasonable to accept only what is real.

original: smras pa / 'dir yang dag pa gang yin /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir yang dag pa gang yin /
translated: Objection: What is reality here?

original: bshad pa / chos gang slu bde brdzun zhes //
analyzed: bshad pa / chos gang slu bde brdzun zhes //
translated: Response: The Blessed One said that any phenomenon that is deceptive is false.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs //
translated: The Blessed One said this in a sūtra:

original: 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos //
translated: “All compositional things are deceptive phenomena.

original: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
analyzed: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
translated: Therefore, they are false.”

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan las chos gang slu ba de ni brdzun pa'o //🔽dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan las chos gang slu ba de ni brdzun pa'o // dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: In another sūtra, the Blessed One said, “Any phenomenon that is deceptive is false.

original: mi slu ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa de ni bden pa'i mchog go zhes gsungs so //🔽de bzhin du bden pa gcig ste /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa de ni bden pa'i mchog go zhes gsungs so // de bzhin du bden pa gcig ste /
translated: Monks, for example, that which is a nondeceptive phenomenon, nirvāṇa, is the supreme truth.”

original: gnyis pa med ces tshigs su bcad pa yang gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyis pa med ces tshigs su bcad pa yang gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, he said in a verse, “There is one truth; there is no second.”

original: de bzhin du gzhan nas kyang 'dus byas de ni slu ba'i chos kyang yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan nas kyang 'dus byas de ni slu ba'i chos kyang yin /
translated: Similarly, in another sūtra, he said, “That conditioned phenomenon is a deceptive phenomenon.

original: de ni rab tu 'jig pa'i chos kyang yin no zhes 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos can yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni rab tu 'jig pa'i chos kyang yin no zhes 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos can yin par gsungs so //
translated: It is also a phenomenon that is subject to destruction.” Thus he said that all compositional things are deceptive phenomena.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos nyid des /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos nyid des /
translated: Therefore, because all compositional things are deceptive phenomena,

original: thams cad brdzun pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: thams cad brdzun pa nyid yin te /
translated: All are false.

original: gang dag brdzun pa de dang / ji ltar rab tu 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dag brdzun pa de dang / ji ltar rab tu 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: How can that which is false be established?

original: khyod kyis dngos po rnams ni rab tu grub po zhes gang smras pa de ni sred pas bskyod par zad do //
analyzed: khyod kyis dngos po rnams ni rab tu grub po zhes gang smras pa de ni sred pas bskyod par zad do //
translated: You say, “Things are established,” but that is just a statement made out of craving.

original: smras pa // gal te 'du byed thams cad brdzun pa yin na 'dzin bzhin du yang dngos po thams cad med do zhes de dag mi gsal bar byas par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: smras pa // gal te 'du byed thams cad brdzun pa yin na 'dzin bzhin du yang dngos po thams cad med do zhes de dag mi gsal bar byas par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Objection: If all compounded phenomena are false, then when one apprehends them, wouldn’t one be making things that do not exist manifest?

original: bshad pa mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: bshad pa mi 'gyur te //
translated: Response: No, one would not.

original: gal te slu chos gang yin pa //
analyzed: gal te slu chos gang yin pa //
translated: If that which is deceptive

original: de brdzun de la ci zhig slu //
analyzed: de brdzun de la ci zhig slu //
translated: is false, then what is deceptive about it?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsungs pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsungs pa //
translated: The Bhagavān said this

original: @218a * // stong nyid yongs su bstan pa yin //
analyzed: @218a * // stong nyid yongs su bstan pa yin //
translated: in order to teach emptiness.

original: gal te slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de brdzun pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de brdzun pa yin na /
translated: If that which is said to be a deceptive phenomenon is false,🔽then what is deceptive about it?

original: slu ba'i chos ni med pa nyid do zhes smra ba yin pas slu ba'i chos med pa de la ci zhig slu bar 'gyur ba de ji smros shig /'di ltar med pa la ci zhig slu bar 'gyur /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos ni med pa nyid do zhes smra ba yin pas slu ba'i chos med pa de la ci zhig slu bar 'gyur ba de ji smros shig /'di ltar med pa la ci zhig slu bar 'gyur /
translated: Since we say that deceptive phenomena are non-existent, what is there to deceive in the non-existence of deceptive phenomena? Tell us! How can something non-existent deceive?

original: ci ste slu bar 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: ci ste slu bar 'gyur na ni //
translated: If it could deceive,

original: phyugs bdag pa dang gcer bu ba'i nor la yang chos rkun pa dag 'tshe bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyugs bdag pa dang gcer bu ba'i nor la yang chos rkun pa dag 'tshe bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then thieves would steal the wealth of the naked ascetics and the cowherds.

original: de lta bas na brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas dngos po rnams med par bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas dngos po rnams med par bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the Buddha said “false,” he did not teach that things are non-existent.

original: bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i mkhyen pa dang rnam par thar pa brnyes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs pas slu ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa'o zhes bya ba de gsungs pas ni dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i mkhyen pa dang rnam par thar pa brnyes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs pas slu ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa'o zhes bya ba de gsungs pas ni dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid
translated: The Lord, who has attained unobstructed knowledge and liberation, who sees things as they really are, said, “That which is deceptive is false.”

original: stong pa nyid mu stegs byed thams cad kyis mi rtogs pa yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid kyi skyon dang bral ba yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid mu stegs byed thams cad kyis mi rtogs pa yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid kyi skyon dang bral ba yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that emptiness is not realized by any of the tīrthikas, and it is taught to be free from the faults of existence and nonexistence.

original: smras pa / brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: smras pa / brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Objection: The statement “false”

original: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su ston pa yin par ma gsungs kyi /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su ston pa yin par ma gsungs kyi /
translated: does not teach that the nature of things is emptiness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement by the Bhagavān

original: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de //
analyzed: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de //
translated: “Things are essenceless

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
translated: because they are seen to change into something else.”

original: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa nyid gang yin pa des ni dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid med pa kho nar yongs su bstan pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa nyid gang yin pa des ni dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid med pa kho nar yongs su bstan pa ma yin gyi /
translated: does not teach that things are essenceless because of the statement “false.”

original: de ni dngos po rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba snang ba'i phyir dang / rnam par 'gyur ba snang ba'i phyir dang / nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba'i phyir yongs su bstan pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ni dngos po rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba snang ba'i phyir dang / rnam par 'gyur ba snang ba'i phyir dang / nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba'i phyir yongs su bstan pa yin no ;
translated: It teaches that things are essenceless because they are seen to change into something else, because they are seen to transform, and because they are seen to be essentially impermanent.

original: / gal te ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “How?”🔽It is said:

original: ngo bo nyid med dngos med de //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med dngos med de //
