translated: There is no entity without an intrinsic reality.

original: gang phyir dngos rnams stong pa nyid //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos rnams stong pa nyid //
translated: Because entities are emptiness.

original: gang gi phyir ngo bo nyid med pa'i dngos //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngo bo nyid med pa'i dngos //
translated: Because there is no entity without an intrinsic reality.

original: med la dngos po rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyang bstan pa /
analyzed: med la dngos po rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyang bstan pa /
translated: And because the emptiness of entities is taught.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid nges par mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid nges par mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the intrinsic reality of entities is definitely not stable and because a transformation is seen,

original: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces gsungs par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces gsungs par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the statement “Entities are without intrinsic reality” is made.

original: de ni nges pa kho nar de ltar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nges pa kho nar de ltar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: That should definitely be understood in that way.

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: If there is no intrinsic reality,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
translated: Whose transformation would it be?

original: gal te dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid @218b med pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid @218b med pa kho na yin na /
translated: If entities definitely have no intrinsic reality,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba de gang gi yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba de gang gi yin par 'gyur /
translated: whose transformation would it be?

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid las bzlog ba yin na /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid las bzlog ba yin na /
translated: “Transformation” is the opposite of intrinsic reality.

original: de la gal te ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin na gzhan du 'gyur ba yang med par 'gyur bar the tshom med pa zhig na /
analyzed: de la gal te ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin na gzhan du 'gyur ba yang med par 'gyur bar the tshom med pa zhig na /
translated: If it were only without intrinsic reality, then without doubt it would not transform.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni yod bas de'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni yod bas de'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa kho na'o //
translated: But since it does transform, therefore it definitely has intrinsic reality.

original: bshad pa / gal te ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If it has intrinsic reality,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
translated: Whose transformation would it be?

original: zhes gang smras pa de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, the response to that is as follows:

original: gal te ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: If it has intrinsic reality,

original: ji lta bur na gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: How could it transform?

original: gal te dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid yod na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid yod na /
translated: If things have intrinsic reality,

original: gzhan la mi ltos par rang las rab tu grub pa rtag pa mi 'gyur ba yod pa de la ji ltar gzhan du yang 'gyur ba yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan la mi ltos par rang las rab tu grub pa rtag pa mi 'gyur ba yod pa de la ji ltar gzhan du yang 'gyur ba yod par 'gyur te /
translated: then they would exist as self-established without relying on others, as permanent and unchanging. How could they transform into something else?

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni gzhan la rag las pa'i phyir 'gyur ba yin gyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni gzhan la rag las pa'i phyir 'gyur ba yin gyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin pas /
translated: Because transformation is change that relies on another, it is not intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is untenable that intrinsic reality transforms.

original: smras pa / gal te ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'thad na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'thad na /
translated: Objection: If it is untenable that that which is intrinsically real transforms into something else,

original: 'o na ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa de ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur /🔽bshad pa / de nyid la ni gzhan 'gyur med //
analyzed: 'o na ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa de ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur / bshad pa / de nyid la ni gzhan 'gyur med //
translated: then how could that which is other than intrinsically real transform into something else?🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:🔽That which is itself does not transform.

original: gzhan nyid la yang yod ma yin //🔽dngos por yongs su brtag pa gang yin pa de nyid la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba yod par mi 'thad la /
analyzed: gzhan nyid la yang yod ma yin // dngos por yongs su brtag pa gang yin pa de nyid la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba yod par mi 'thad la /
translated: That which is other also does not transform.🔽It is untenable that that which is intrinsically real transforms into something else.

original: de las gzhan pa nyid gang yin pa de la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba yod par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa nyid gang yin pa de la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba yod par mi 'thad do //
translated: It is also untenable that that which is other than intrinsically real transforms into something else.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gang phyir gzhon nu mi rga ste //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang phyir gzhon nu mi rga ste //
translated: Why is that?🔽Because a youth does not age.

original: gang phyir rgas pa'ang mi rga'o //
analyzed: gang phyir rgas pa'ang mi rga'o //
translated: Because an old man also does not age.

original: 'di las gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rga ba ste /🔽rga ba de yang gang gi phyir gzhon nu'i gnas skabs nyid du rga bar bab pa la yang med la /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rga ba ste / rga ba de yang gang gi phyir gzhon nu'i gnas skabs nyid du rga bar bab pa la yang med la /
translated: “Transforming into something else” means aging.🔽That aging does not exist in the state of youth itself.

original: gzhon nu las gzhan pa rgas pa'i gnas skabs la bab pa la yang med pas /
analyzed: gzhon nu las gzhan pa rgas pa'i gnas skabs la bab pa la yang med pas /
translated: And that aging also does not exist in the state of old age, which is other than youth.

original: de'i phyir de nyid la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba med la gzhan nyid la yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba med la gzhan nyid la yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, aging does not exist in that which is already aging, nor does it exist in that which is not yet aging.

original: gal te gzhon nu gzhon nu'i gnas skabs nyid du rga bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzhon nu gzhon nu'i gnas skabs nyid du rga bar 'gyur na /
translated: If a youth were to age while in the state of being a youth,

original: de lta na rgas pa dang gzhon pa gnyis gcig la lhan cig gnas par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na rgas pa dang gzhon pa gnyis gcig la lhan cig gnas par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: then aging and youthfulness would exist simultaneously in a single basis.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: But that is untenable.

original: 'di ltar mi mthun pa gnyis gcig la lhan cig ji ltar gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi mthun pa gnyis gcig la lhan cig ji ltar gnas par 'gyur /
translated: How could two incompatible states exist simultaneously in a single basis?

original: ci ste yang rgas pa rgas pa'i gnas skabs na rga bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste yang rgas pa rgas pa'i gnas skabs na rga bar 'gyur na /
translated: But if aging were to age while in the state of being old,

original: de lta na yang rga bar brtag pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rga bar brtag pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: then the examination of aging would be pointless.

original: @219a * // 'di ltar rgas pa la rga bar bya bar ci dgos /
analyzed: @219a * // 'di ltar rgas pa la rga bar bya bar ci dgos /
translated: What need is there for aging to age again?

original: rga ba gang zhig rgas pa de yang rga bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: rga ba gang zhig rgas pa de yang rga bar 'gyur na /
translated: If that which is already aging were to age again,

original: de'i de gnas skabs ji lta bur 'gyur zhes de la yang bsam pa de nyid dang rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i de gnas skabs ji lta bur 'gyur zhes de la yang bsam pa de nyid dang rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: then what would be its state? This same examination would apply to that.

original: smras pa / de nyid gzhan du 'gyur gyi gzhan ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / de nyid gzhan du 'gyur gyi gzhan ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: Objection: It transforms into something else, but it does not become something else.

original: dper na 'o ma gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po zho nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'o ma gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po zho nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, milk transforms into something else, the thing called “curds.”

original: bshad pa / gal te de nyid gzhan 'gyur na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te de nyid gzhan 'gyur na //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If it transforms into something else,

original: 'o ma nyid ni zhor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o ma nyid ni zhor 'gyur ro //
translated: milk itself would become curds.

original: gal te de nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar sems na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar sems na /
translated: If you think it transforms into something else,

original: de ltar na khyod kyi 'o ma nyid zho yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na khyod kyi 'o ma nyid zho yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that milk itself would become curds.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nyid kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi yin gyi /
translated: Because it is that itself,

original: gzhan gyi ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: but it is not something else.

original: khyod kyis 'o ma'i gnas skabs nyid du gyur pa zho'i dngos por brjod pas /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'o ma'i gnas skabs nyid du gyur pa zho'i dngos por brjod pas /
translated: Since you say that the thing called “curds” is the state of milk,

original: des na 'o ma de nyid zho de nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'o ma de nyid zho de nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that milk itself is curds.

original: smras pa / 'o ma nyid kyi dngos po zho yin pas 'o ma nyid zho yin no zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'o ma nyid kyi dngos po zho yin pas 'o ma nyid zho yin no zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: Objection: I do not say that milk itself is curds because the thing called “milk” is curds.🔽Nāgārjuna responds: What thing

original: bshad pa / 'o ma las gzhan gang gi ni //🔽dngos po zhe ni yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'o ma las gzhan gang gi ni //🔽dngos po zhe ni yin par 'gyur //
translated: other than milk is it?

original: gal te 'o ma nyid kyi dngos po zho yin pas 'o ma nyid zho yin no zhes mi smra na /
analyzed: gal te 'o ma nyid kyi dngos po zho yin pas 'o ma nyid zho yin no zhes mi smra na /
translated: If you do not say that the entity of milk itself is curd,

original: 'o na 'o ma las gzhan gang gi dngos po zho yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na 'o ma las gzhan gang gi dngos po zho yin par 'gyur /
translated: then what else apart from milk could the entity of curd be?

original: ci zho nyid kyi dngos po zhor 'gyur zhing zho nyid yin nam /
analyzed: ci zho nyid kyi dngos po zhor 'gyur zhing zho nyid yin nam /
translated: Is it that the entity of curd itself is curd, and curd is itself?

original: 'on te chu'i dngos po zhor 'gyur zhing chu zho yin no zhes smras /
analyzed: 'on te chu'i dngos po zhor 'gyur zhing chu zho yin no zhes smras /
translated: Or is it that the entity of water is curd, and water is curd?

original: de lta bas na de nyid dang gzhan yang gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de nyid dang gzhan yang gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is untenable that what is identical is different.

original: gang gi phyir de nyid dang / gzhan yang gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'thad pa de'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid dang / gzhan yang gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'thad pa de'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is untenable that what is identical is different, therefore difference does not exist.

original: de'i phyir brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su ston par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yongs su ston par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the statement “false” fully reveals the emptiness of the intrinsic reality of things.

original: ngo bo nyid nges par mi gnas pa ston par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid nges par mi gnas pa ston par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not reveal that intrinsic reality definitely does not endure.

original: smras pa / yang re zhig stong pa nyid ni yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / yang re zhig stong pa nyid ni yod de /
translated: Objection: First, emptiness exists.

original: gnyen po med pas cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas stong pa nyid yod pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ma yin pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyen po med pas cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas stong pa nyid yod pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ma yin pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it does not exist, emptiness exists.

original: bshad pa / gnyen po las dngos po rab tu yang 'grub par 'dod na yang stong pa yin pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bshad pa / gnyen po las dngos po rab tu yang 'grub par 'dod na yang stong pa yin pa mi 'thad de /
translated: But if you assert that things are established from their antidotes, then emptiness is untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because emptiness does not exist.

original: gal te stong min cung zad yod //
analyzed: gal te stong min cung zad yod //
translated: If something nonempty existed,

original: stong pa'ang @219b cung zad yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang @219b cung zad yod par 'gyur //
translated: Then something empty would exist.

original: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
analyzed: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
translated: But since something nonempty does not exist,

original: stong pa'ang yod par gal 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par gal 'gyur //
translated: How could something empty exist?

original: gal te mi stong pa cung zad cig rab tu 'grub par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te mi stong pa cung zad cig rab tu 'grub par gyur na ni /
translated: If something nonempty were established,

original: de'i gnyen po stong pa yang cung zad yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po stong pa yang cung zad yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then its antidote, emptiness, would exist.

original: gang gi tshe rnam pa thams cad du brtags na mi stong pa cung zad kyang yod par mi 'thad pa de'i tshe mi gtong pa med na stong pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam pa thams cad du brtags na mi stong pa cung zad kyang yod par mi 'thad pa de'i tshe mi gtong pa med na stong pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: But when you analyze in every way, it is not tenable that something nonempty exists. Therefore, if something nonempty does not exist, how could emptiness exist?

original: de stong pa yod pa ma yin na de'i gnyen po stong pa ma yin pa yod par ji ltar brtag / smras pa /
analyzed: de stong pa yod pa ma yin na de'i gnyen po stong pa ma yin pa yod par ji ltar brtag / smras pa /
translated: If that emptiness does not exist, how could its opposite, nonemptiness, be conceived to exist?

original: khyod gang smra ba de nyid yang mi 'dod de sngar /
analyzed: khyod gang smra ba de nyid yang mi 'dod de sngar /
translated: Objection: You yourself do not accept what you have said, for previously you said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsungs pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsungs pa //
translated: The Transcendent Lord taught this

original: stong nyid yongs su bstan pa yin //
analyzed: stong nyid yongs su bstan pa yin //
translated: In order to teach emptiness.

original: zhes smras la /🔽de ni gal te stong min yod //
analyzed: zhes smras la / de ni gal te stong min yod //
translated: And you also said:🔽If nonemptiness existed,

original: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //🔽zhes smra'am / bshad pa /
analyzed: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur // zhes smra'am / bshad pa /
translated: Emptiness would exist.🔽Response: In this regard, without anger, you should accept the following rational

original: 'di la ma khro bar rigs pa zung shig / rgyal ba rnams kyis stong nyid ni //
analyzed: 'di la ma khro bar rigs pa zung shig / rgyal ba rnams kyis stong nyid ni //
translated: argument. The victors have said that emptiness

original: lta kun nges par 'byin par gsungs //
analyzed: lta kun nges par 'byin par gsungs //
translated: Is what definitely delivers from all views.

original: gang dag stong pa nyid lta pa //
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid lta pa //
translated: Those who view emptiness

original: de dag bsgrub tu med par gsungs //
analyzed: de dag bsgrub tu med par gsungs //
translated: Have been said to be incurable.

original: rgyal ba yang dag ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs pa /
analyzed: rgyal ba yang dag ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs pa /
translated: The victors, who see things just as they are,

original: thugs rje'i dam pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis 'gro ba rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thugs rje'i dam pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis 'gro ba rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: possess the highest compassion and for the sake of benefiting migrating🔽beings, have said that emptiness is what definitely delivers from all views.

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid lta ba kun gyi chu srin 'dzin khri thams cad las nges par 'byin pa yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid lta ba kun gyi chu srin 'dzin khri thams cad las nges par 'byin pa yin par gsungs te /
translated: It is said that “emptiness” is the deliverance from all the crocodiles and whirlpools of all views.

original: de ni lta ba'i chu srin 'dzin khri thams cad bzlog par gsungs pas /
analyzed: de ni lta ba'i chu srin 'dzin khri thams cad bzlog par gsungs pas /
translated: It is said that it turns back all the crocodiles and whirlpools of views.

original: lta ba'i chu srin 'dzin khri bzlog pa de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
analyzed: lta ba'i chu srin 'dzin khri bzlog pa de ni dngos por mi 'thad do //
translated: But it is not tenable that it turns back the crocodiles and whirlpools of views.

original: dper na sems rmongs pa 'ga' zhig dri za'i grong khyer la grong khyer ro snyam pa'i blo gros byung ba las kun tu rmongs pa dang bral nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: dper na sems rmongs pa 'ga' zhig dri za'i grong khyer la grong khyer ro snyam pa'i blo gros byung ba las kun tu rmongs pa dang bral nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i tshe /
translated: For example, suppose someone is confused and thinks that a mirage is a town. When he becomes free from confusion and sees it as it really is,

original: grong khyer gyi blo log pa na grong khyer gyi blo log pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: grong khyer gyi blo log pa na grong khyer gyi blo log pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'ga' yang med de /
translated: then when the thought of a town is reversed, there is no thing at all called “the reversal of the thought of a town.”

original: yod pa ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig tu zad pa /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig tu zad pa /
translated: It is simply the absence of the conception of something that does not exist.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dngos por lta ba'i chu srin 'dzin khri gang yin pa las log pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba de ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dngos por lta ba'i chu srin 'dzin khri gang yin pa las log pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba de ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Likewise, the so-called emptiness that is the opposite of the crocodile-like view of real things, which is seeing things as they are in reality, is not any kind of real thing called “emptiness.”

original: gang dag stong pa nyid ces brjod pa tsam ma gtogs pa'i phyir /🔽stong pa nyid la dngos por lta ba de dag ni ma rig pa'i mun @220a * //
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid ces brjod pa tsam ma gtogs pa'i phyir / stong pa nyid la dngos por lta ba de dag ni ma rig pa'i mun @220a * //
translated: Because they are only verbal expressions of emptiness,🔽those who view emptiness as a real thing have their eyes of intelligence obscured by the great darkness of ignorance.

original: pa chen pos blo gros kyi mig bsgribs pas bsgrub tu rung ba dang / bsgrub tu mi rung ba'i dpyad pa sman pa chen po rgyal ba rnams kyis de dag ni bsgrub tu mi rung ba nyid yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: pa chen pos blo gros kyi mig bsgribs pas bsgrub tu rung ba dang / bsgrub tu mi rung ba'i dpyad pa sman pa chen po rgyal ba rnams kyis de dag ni bsgrub tu mi rung ba nyid yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The great physicians, the Victorious Ones, have said that they are not suitable for practice.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang dag dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no zhes mngon par zhen pa de dag la stong pa nyid ces brjod pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dis rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis dngos por brtags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang dag dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no zhes mngon par zhen pa de dag la stong pa nyid ces brjod pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'dis rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis dngos por brtags pa yin gyi /
translated: For those who conceive that things exist by their own intrinsic reality, this emptiness, dependent origination, is said to be a designation of a thing by the power of causes and conditions.

original: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no zhes dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid du rab tu bstan pa na mngon par zhen pa de bzlog par nus kyi /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no zhes dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid du rab tu bstan pa na mngon par zhen pa de bzlog par nus kyi /
translated: When it is taught that things do not exist by their own intrinsic reality, that conception can be reversed.

original: gang dag stong pa nyid la dngos po nyid du mngon par zhen pa de dag la ni /
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid la dngos po nyid du mngon par zhen pa de dag la ni /
translated: But for those who conceive that emptiness itself is a thing,

original: gzhan gang gis kyang mngon par zhen pa de bzlog par mi nus te /
analyzed: gzhan gang gis kyang mngon par zhen pa de bzlog par mi nus te /
translated: that conception cannot be reversed by anything else.

original: dper na ci yang med do zhes smras pa na ci yang med pa de nyid byin cig ces zer ba gang yin pa de la med pa nyid 'dzin du gzhug par ji ltar nus pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na ci yang med do zhes smras pa na ci yang med pa de nyid byin cig ces zer ba gang yin pa de la med pa nyid 'dzin du gzhug par ji ltar nus pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like the case of someone who says, “Give me nothing,” and when told, “Take this nothing,” replies, “How can I take nothing?”

original: de lta bas na de bas ni rgyal ba stobs bcu dang ldan par gyur pa /
analyzed: de lta bas na de bas ni rgyal ba stobs bcu dang ldan par gyur pa /
translated: Therefore, the Victorious One, who possesses the ten powers,

original: thugs rje chen po mnga' bas kyang bsgrub tu mi rung ba nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po mnga' bas kyang bsgrub tu mi rung ba nyid du gsungs so //
translated: and who is endowed with great compassion, has declared that it is not suitable to be established.

original: gang dag gis stong pa nyid kyang stong par mthong ba de kho na mthong pa de dag la ni stong pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: gang dag gis stong pa nyid kyang stong par mthong ba de kho na mthong pa de dag la ni stong pa nyid du grub po //
translated: For those who see emptiness as empty, who see reality, emptiness is established.

original: de kho na nyid brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'o /🔽// / smras pa /
analyzed: de kho na nyid brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'o / // / smras pa /
translated: This is the thirteenth chapter, called “The Examination of Reality.”

original: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: Objection: Things are not empty of their own intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Things exist with intrinsic reality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: phrad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because contact is taught.

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das de dang der gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dang mig gsum phrad pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das de dang der gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dang mig gsum phrad pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the Blessed One has said, “The contact of these and those forms, consciousnesses, and eyes is contact.

original: sgra dang / rnam par shes pa dang rna ba la sogs pa dag kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgra dang / rnam par shes pa dang rna ba la sogs pa dag kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Sound, consciousness, and the ear, and so on, are also like this.”

original: de bzhin du rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro pa dang ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dag gis kun tu sbyar to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro pa dang ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dag gis kun tu sbyar to zhes gsungs so //
translated: So too, it is said that they are bound by the fetters of attachment, anger, and ignorance.

original: dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid med na phrad par mi 'thad de //
analyzed: dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid med na phrad par mi 'thad de //
translated: If things do not have intrinsic reality, contact is untenable.

original: 'di ltar dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa rnams ji ltar phrad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa rnams ji ltar phrad par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, how could things that do not have intrinsic reality come into contact?

original: de lta bas na dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, things surely exist intrinsically.

original: @220b bshad pa /
analyzed: @220b bshad pa /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:

original: gal te dngos po rnams kyis phrad pa nyid 'thad na ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams kyis phrad pa nyid 'thad na ni /
translated: If the contact of things were tenable,

original: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: things would exist intrinsically.

original: dngos po rnams kyi phrad pa nyid mi 'thad pas ngo bo nyid yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi phrad pa nyid mi 'thad pas ngo bo nyid yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: But since the contact of things is untenable, how could they exist intrinsically?

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: blta bya lta ba lta ba po //
analyzed: blta bya lta ba lta ba po //
translated: The seen, seeing, and the seer,

original: gsum po de dag gnyis gnyis dang // thams cad kyang ni phan tshun du //
analyzed: gsum po de dag gnyis gnyis dang // thams cad kyang ni phan tshun du //
translated: these three

original: phrad par 'gyur ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: phrad par 'gyur ba yod ma yin //
translated: do not make mutual contact🔽in any way.

original: blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po gsum po de dag ni gnyis gnyis dang / thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po gsum po de dag ni gnyis gnyis dang / thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The three—the object of seeing, seeing, and the seer—do not make mutual contact either in pairs or all together.

original: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur la /🔽blta bar bya ba dang lta ba po yang phrad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur la / blta bar bya ba dang lta ba po yang phrad par mi 'gyur /
translated: The object of seeing and seeing do not make contact.🔽The object of seeing and the seer do not make contact.

original: lta ba dang lta ba po yang phrad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: lta ba dang lta ba po yang phrad par mi 'gyur /
translated: Seeing and the seer do not make contact.

original: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po yang phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po yang phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The object of seeing, seeing, and the seer do not make contact.🔽Likewise, desire and the desirous one,

original: de bzhin 'dod chags chags pa dang // chags par 'gyur dang nyon mongs pa ;
analyzed: de bzhin 'dod chags chags pa dang // chags par 'gyur dang nyon mongs pa ;
translated: The desirous, and the afflictions,

original: / lhag ma rnams dang skye mched kyi //
analyzed: / lhag ma rnams dang skye mched kyi //
translated: And the remaining faculties and their objects

original: lhag ma'ang rnam pa gsum gyis lta //
analyzed: lhag ma'ang rnam pa gsum gyis lta //
translated: Should be viewed in terms of the three.

original: ji ltar blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po dag gnyis gnyis dang phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba dag kyang gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po dag gnyis gnyis dang phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba dag kyang gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the object seen, seeing, and the seer do not make mutual contact in pairs or all together, so also attachment, one who is attached, and that with which one is attached do not make mutual contact in pairs or all together.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dang phrad par mi 'gyur la /🔽'dod chags dang chags par 'gyur ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur /🔽chags pa dang chags par 'gyur ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dang phrad par mi 'gyur la / 'dod chags dang chags par 'gyur ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur / chags pa dang chags par 'gyur ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur /
translated: Attachment does not make mutual contact with one who is attached.🔽Attachment does not make mutual contact with that with which one is attached.🔽One who is attached does not make mutual contact with that with which one is attached.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dang chags par 'gyur ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dang chags par 'gyur ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Attachment, one who is attached, and that with which one is attached do not make mutual contact.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa lhag ma zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams dang / skye mched kyi lhag ma sgra dang rna ba dang / nyan pa po la sogs pa dag kyang gnyis gnyis dang ; thams cad dag kyang phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa lhag ma zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams dang / skye mched kyi lhag ma sgra dang rna ba dang / nyan pa po la sogs pa dag kyang gnyis gnyis dang ; thams cad dag kyang phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: So too, the remaining afflictions such as anger, the remaining sense bases such as sound, the ear, and the hearer, and so on, all of these do not mutually contact each other.

original: smras pa / ci'i phyir blta bar bya ba la sogs pa de dag phan tshun lhan cig phrad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / ci'i phyir blta bar bya ba la sogs pa de dag phan tshun lhan cig phrad par mi 'gyur /
translated: Objection: Why do those objects of seeing and so on not mutually contact each other?🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gzhan ni gzhan dang phrad gyur na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gzhan ni gzhan dang phrad gyur na //
translated: If one thing contacts another,

original: gang phyir blta bya la sogs pa //
analyzed: gang phyir blta bya la sogs pa //
translated: then the object of seeing and so on

original: gzhan de @221a * //🔽yod pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: gzhan de @221a * // yod pa ma yin pa //
translated: would be different🔽from the seer and so on.🔽But since that is not the case,

original: de phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they do not contact each other.

original: 'di la gal te phrad pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de nges par gzhan dang gzhan lhan cig las 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te phrad pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de nges par gzhan dang gzhan lhan cig las 'gyur grang na /
translated: If something called contact exists, then it would definitely arise from the mutual contact of one thing with another.

original: gang gi phyir blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag la gzhan de yod par mi rigs shing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag la gzhan de yod par mi rigs shing /
translated: But since it is illogical that the object of seeing and so on are different from the seer and so on,

original: de dag la phan tshun gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir phan tshun lhan cig phrad par mi 'gyur ro //🔽blta bya la sogs 'ba' zhig la //
analyzed: de dag la phan tshun gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir phan tshun lhan cig phrad par mi 'gyur ro // blta bya la sogs 'ba' zhig la //
translated: Because they do not exist as different from each other, they do not make mutual contact.🔽Not only is difference

original: gzhan nyid med par ma zad kyi //🔽gang yang gang dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med par ma zad kyi // gang yang gang dang lhan cig tu //
translated: not tenable for the seen and so on,🔽but also it is not tenable

original: gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: that anything is different from anything else.

original: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa de dag 'ba' zhig la phan tshun gzhan nyid mi 'thad par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa de dag 'ba' zhig la phan tshun gzhan nyid mi 'thad par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it that difference is not tenable for the seen and so on,

original: 'di ltar dngos po gang yang dngos po gang dang yang lhan cig tu gzhan nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po gang yang dngos po gang dang yang lhan cig tu gzhan nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: but also it is not tenable that any thing is different from any other thing.

original: gzhan nyid med na gang yang gang dang yang lhan cig phrad par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med na gang yang gang dang yang lhan cig phrad par mi 'thad do //
translated: If difference does not exist, it is not tenable that anything makes mutual contact with anything else.

original: smras pa / dngos po rnams kyi gzhan nyid mngon sum du dmigs bzhin du med do zhes su zhig smra bar rigs /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po rnams kyi gzhan nyid mngon sum du dmigs bzhin du med do zhes su zhig smra bar rigs /
translated: Objection: Since the difference of things is observed by direct perception, who would say that it does not exist?

original: bshad pa / khyod kyis gang kho na'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi gzhan nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa de kho na'i phyir kho bos khyod kyis dngos po rnams kyi gzhan nyid ma dmigs par legs par khong du chud de /
analyzed: bshad pa / khyod kyis gang kho na'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi gzhan nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa de kho na'i phyir kho bos khyod kyis dngos po rnams kyi gzhan nyid ma dmigs par legs par khong du chud de /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Because you directly observe the otherness of things, therefore I understand that you do not observe the otherness of things.

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi gzhan nyid med pa ni lha'i mig gis kyang dmigs par mi nus na khyod lta bu'i sha'i mig gis lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi gzhan nyid med pa ni lha'i mig gis kyang dmigs par mi nus na khyod lta bu'i sha'i mig gis lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: In that case, since the nonexistence of the otherness of things cannot be observed even with the divine eye, what need is there to mention that it cannot be observed with the fleshly eye of someone like you?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan ni gzhan la brten te gzhan //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan la brten te gzhan //
translated: The other is other in dependence on another.

original: gzhan med gzhan las gzhan mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan med gzhan las gzhan mi 'gyur //
translated: Without another, the other would not be other.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa 'ga' zhig la brten te gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa 'ga' zhig la brten te gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin na /
translated: That which is called “other” is not other in dependence on another.

original: gzhan med na gzhan ni rang las gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan med na gzhan ni rang las gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without another, the other would not be other from itself.

original: gzhan gang yin pa ni gzhan la ltos nas gzhan zhes bya ba'i rang las gzhan du mi 'gyur bas de mngon sum du dmigs so zhes su zhig smra bar rigs /
analyzed: gzhan gang yin pa ni gzhan la ltos nas gzhan zhes bya ba'i rang las gzhan du mi 'gyur bas de mngon sum du dmigs so zhes su zhig smra bar rigs /
translated: But who would say that something that is different in dependence on another is not different from itself?

original: smras pa / de lta na yang gzhan nyid med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / de lta na yang gzhan nyid med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Objection: In that case, difference would not be nonexistent.

original: gzhan nyid rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Difference would be fully established.

original: bshad pa / mi mkhas pa la ni de ltar 'gyur gyi mkhas pa la ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bshad pa / mi mkhas pa la ni de ltar 'gyur gyi mkhas pa la ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: Response: That would be the case for the unskilled, but not for the skilled.

original: gang la brten te gang yin pa //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang yin pa //
translated: If something exists in dependence on another,

original: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //
translated: It is not tenable that it is different from that.

original: 'di ltar gang la brten te gang 'byung ba de de las gzhan no zhes de skad smra bar mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la brten te gang 'byung ba de de las gzhan no zhes de skad smra bar mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: In that case, is it not the case that it is illogical to say that something that arises in dependence on another is different from that?

original: @221b ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @221b ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te gzhan ni gzhan las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te gzhan ni gzhan las gzhan //
translated: If one thing is different from another,

original: gzhan med par yang rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan med par yang rung bar 'gyur //
translated: It would be different even without another.

original: gal te gang la brten nas gzhan du 'gyur ba de de las gzhan yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te gang la brten nas gzhan du 'gyur ba de de las gzhan yin par gyur na ni /
translated: If something that becomes different in dependence on another is different from that,

original: de med par yang de gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: de med par yang de gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: then it would be different even without another.

original: de ltar na re lde la ma ltos pa kho nar bum pa gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de ltar na re lde la ma ltos pa kho nar bum pa gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: In that case, the vase would be different from the straw mat without depending on the straw mat.

original: re lde la ma ltos par bum pa gzhan du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: re lde la ma ltos par bum pa gzhan du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: But the vase does not become different without depending on the straw mat.

original: de lta bas na re lde las bum pa gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na re lde las bum pa gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the vase is not different from the straw mat.

original: smras pa / de las gzhan du ma gyur du zin gyis kyang re zhig gzhan ni yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / de las gzhan du ma gyur du zin gyis kyang re zhig gzhan ni yod do //
translated: Objection: Even though it does not become different from that, still difference exists.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod skrod par byed pa nyid kyi rjes su 'gro'am /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod skrod par byed pa nyid kyi rjes su 'gro'am /
translated: Response: Do you follow the one who is expelled?

original: khyod gzhan nyid zlog par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyis gzhan nyid sgrub par sems ko //
analyzed: khyod gzhan nyid zlog par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyis gzhan nyid sgrub par sems ko //
translated: Do you think that the reason that refutes difference establishes difference?

original: gal te gang la brten te gzhan //
analyzed: gal te gang la brten te gzhan //
translated: If it is different in dependence on that,

original: zhes bya bar 'gyur ba de las de gzhan ma yin na /
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'gyur ba de las de gzhan ma yin na /
translated: then it is not different from that.

original: 'o na ci de rang gi bdag nyid kho na las gzhan du 'gyur bar sems sam /
analyzed: 'o na ci de rang gi bdag nyid kho na las gzhan du 'gyur bar sems sam /
translated: Well, do you think that it becomes different from itself?

original: gzhan las gzhan pa'i gzhan pa ste //
analyzed: gzhan las gzhan pa'i gzhan pa ste //
translated: Difference is different from that which is different.

original: med na med pas de phyir med //
analyzed: med na med pas de phyir med //
translated: Since that which is nonexistent does not exist, therefore it does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gang las gzhan pa'i gzhan pa de med na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gang las gzhan pa'i gzhan pa de med na /
translated: If that which is different from that which is different does not exist,

original: gzhan med pas rang nyid las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan med pa kho nar shes par gyis shig / smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan med pas rang nyid las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan med pa kho nar shes par gyis shig / smras pa /
translated: Because there is no other, it does not become other than itself. Therefore, understand that it is only because there is no other that it is other.

original: gang kho na'i phyir gzhan ni gzhan la brten te gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de kho na'i phyir gzhan yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang kho na'i phyir gzhan ni gzhan la brten te gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de kho na'i phyir gzhan yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Objection: But is it not because of the very fact that “other becomes other in dependence on another” that there is no other?

original: ci ste brten nas kyang gzhan du yang mi 'gyur na gzhan yin no zhes ji skad du bya /
analyzed: ci ste brten nas kyang gzhan du yang mi 'gyur na gzhan yin no zhes ji skad du bya /
translated: If, in dependence on another, it does not become other, then how could it be said, “It is other”?

original: bshad pa / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni bdag nyid 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni bdag nyid 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: In response Nāgārjuna explains: Dependent origination has this nature.

original: gang gi phyir re zhig gzhan la brten nas gzhan zhes bya ba de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis gzhan yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir re zhig gzhan la brten nas gzhan zhes bya ba de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis gzhan yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: Because it is said that “other becomes other in dependence on another,” therefore it is other by the power of worldly convention.

original: gang gi phyir yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na /🔽gzhan nyid gzhan la yod ma yin //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na / gzhan nyid gzhan la yod ma yin //
translated: But if one analyzes reality just as it is,🔽Other does not exist in other.

original: gzhan ma yin la'ang yod pa min //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin la'ang yod pa min //
translated: Other does not exist in nonother.

original: gang gi phyir re lde la ltos te bum pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni re lde la ltos pa'i phyir dang / re lde la rag lus pa'i phyir dang / rang las rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir bum pa la gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //🔽gang gi phyir re lde la mi ltos pa bum pa gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig la yang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir re lde la ltos te bum pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni re lde la ltos pa'i phyir dang / re lde la rag lus pa'i phyir dang / rang las rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir bum pa la gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no // gang gi phyir re lde la mi ltos pa bum pa gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig la yang /
translated: Because a pot is not different from a wall, since it is dependent on a wall, since it is contingent on a wall, and since it is not established from itself.🔽Because a pot that is not dependent on a wall is not different,

original: gzhan ma yin pa dang mi mthun pa gzhan nyid med pa de'i phyir don dam pa'i dbang gis gzhan med do zhes @222a * //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa dang mi mthun pa gzhan nyid med pa de'i phyir don dam pa'i dbang gis gzhan med do zhes @222a * //
translated: therefore, in terms of the ultimate, there is no difference.

original: smra'o // de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chu shing gi phung po bstan te /
analyzed: smra'o // de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chu shing gi phung po bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the Transcendent Lord also taught the example of the plantain tree trunk:

original: chu shing gi phung po ni khong stong zhing snying po rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chu shing gi phung po ni khong stong zhing snying po rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: “The plantain tree trunk is hollow and has no core.”

original: ci yang med do zhes kyang bstan to //
analyzed: ci yang med do zhes kyang bstan to //
translated: He also taught, “It is nothing at all.”

original: smras pa / gal te de ltar bum pa gzhan ma yin na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te de ltar bum pa gzhan ma yin na /
translated: Objection: If a pot is not different,

original: de lta na bum pa de nyid gzhan ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na bum pa de nyid gzhan ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, that very pot would not be different.

original: gzhan med par gzhan ma yin par yang med pas gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan med par gzhan ma yin par yang med pas gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that which is not different does not exist without another, difference would exist.

original: bshad pa / gnyen po las kyang gzhan nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bshad pa / gnyen po las kyang gzhan nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: It is also untenable that difference exists due to an antidote.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzhan ma yin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that which is not different is untenable.

original: 'di ltar gzhan la ltos nas gzhan ma yin par 'gyur na gzhan nyid de yang brtags na mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan la ltos nas gzhan ma yin par 'gyur na gzhan nyid de yang brtags na mi 'thad do //
translated: In that case, if difference exists in reliance on another, then difference would not be different.

original: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Difference does not exist.

original: gzhan nam de nyid yod ma yin //🔽de gzhan nyid de yod pa ma yin na de'i gnyen po gzhan ma yin na de nyid kyang med la /
analyzed: gzhan nam de nyid yod ma yin // de gzhan nyid de yod pa ma yin na de'i gnyen po gzhan ma yin na de nyid kyang med la /
translated: Neither difference nor identity exist.🔽If that difference does not exist, then its antidote, nondifference, does not exist.🔽If nondifference does not exist, then its antidote, difference, does not exist.

original: gzhan ma yin pa med na de'i gnyen po gzhan med do zhes de skad bstan par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa med na de'i gnyen po gzhan med do zhes de skad bstan par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Wouldn’t it be taught in this way?

original: gzhan yang smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang smras pa /
translated: Moreover, it was said:

original: gzhan la ltos nas gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos nas gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Difference does not exist in reliance on another.

original: gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni spyi yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni spyi yin te /
translated: Difference is a universal.

original: de dang ldan pas gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of possessing that, it becomes different.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / gal te gzhan nyid dang ldan pas gzhan du 'gyur na rang las rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te gzhan nyid dang ldan pas gzhan du 'gyur na rang las rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: If it becomes different because of possessing difference, then because it is not established from itself,

original: gzhan la ltos pa kho nas gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa kho nas gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: doesn’t it become different only in reliance on another?

original: smras pa / gzhan nyid ni gzhan la nges par gnas pa kho na yin pas de la yang ltos ci dgos bshad pa /
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan nyid ni gzhan la nges par gnas pa kho na yin pas de la yang ltos ci dgos bshad pa /
translated: Objection: Since difference definitely exists in another, what need is there to rely on it?

original: gzhan nyid gzhan la yod ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan nyid gzhan la yod ma yin /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Difference does not exist in another.

original: gzhan nyid ni gzhan las nges par gnas pa kho na yin pas zhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan nyid ni gzhan las nges par gnas pa kho na yin pas zhes gang smras pa /
translated: You said, “Difference definitely exists in another.”

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: gzhan nyid ni gzhan la med do //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ni gzhan la med do //
translated: Difference does not exist in another.🔽Why is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: gzhan ma yin la'ang yod pa min //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin la'ang yod pa min //
translated: Difference does not exist in what is not different.

original: 'di la bum pa ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pas de la gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang mi mthun pa'i gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la bum pa ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pas de la gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang mi mthun pa'i gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here a vase is not different from its own nature. Therefore, difference, which is incompatible with nondifference, does not exist in it.

original: gal te gzhan nyid de gzhan la nges par gnas pa nyid du gyur na ni bum pa rang gi bdag nyid las kyang gzhan nyid du 'gyur zhing gzhan ma yin par mi bsdus te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan nyid de gzhan la nges par gnas pa nyid du gyur na ni bum pa rang gi bdag nyid las kyang gzhan nyid du 'gyur zhing gzhan ma yin par mi bsdus te /
translated: If difference definitely existed in another, then a pot would be different from its own nature, and it would not be included as not being different.

original: bum pa rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'dod de //
analyzed: bum pa rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'dod de //
translated: But that which is different from a pot’s own nature is not accepted.

original: de ltar na gang gi phyir bum pa gzhan ma yin pa la med pa de'i phyir gzhan la yang yod pa ma yin @222b no ;
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi phyir bum pa gzhan ma yin pa la med pa de'i phyir gzhan la yang yod pa ma yin @222b no ;
translated: Since a pot does not exist as different from itself, therefore it does not exist as different from another.

original: / gal te yod par gyur na ni gnas skabs thams cad na yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / gal te yod par gyur na ni gnas skabs thams cad na yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did exist, it would exist in all circumstances.

original: ci ste gang gi phyir bum pa snam bu la ltos na gzhan yin pa de'i tshe bum pa de la gzhan nyid de yod pa sems na /
analyzed: ci ste gang gi phyir bum pa snam bu la ltos na gzhan yin pa de'i tshe bum pa de la gzhan nyid de yod pa sems na /
translated: But if you think that when a pot is different in reliance on a cloth, at that time the difference of that pot exists,

original: de lta na gzhan nyid nges par mi gnas par bsten pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na gzhan nyid nges par mi gnas par bsten pa yin te /
translated: then in that case, difference would not definitely exist.

original: de'i phyir dngos po ltos nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po ltos nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because things exist in reliance,

original: gzhan nyid la bzhag pa dang / btsal bar yod pa yang dam bcas par yang 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzhan nyid la bzhag pa dang / btsal bar yod pa yang dam bcas par yang 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: And if it were to exist as something to be sought, then that would be a thesis, but that is untenable.

original: rang gi gzhung lugs dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi gzhung lugs dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it contradicts your own scriptures.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: dngos po gnyis yod na phrad par 'gyur gyi med pa ni mi 'gyur bas de la gal te re zhig pa ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan ma yin pa de gzhan nyid dang ldan pas ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po gnyis yod na phrad par 'gyur gyi med pa ni mi 'gyur bas de la gal te re zhig pa ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan ma yin pa de gzhan nyid dang ldan pas ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: if two things exist, they would make contact, but if they do not exist, they would not. Therefore, if the other does not exist as different by its very nature, how could it become different through possessing difference?

original: 'o ma dang 'dres pa'i chu yang 'o mar mi 'gyur la 'o ma yang chur mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'o ma dang 'dres pa'i chu yang 'o mar mi 'gyur la 'o ma yang chur mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as water mixed with milk is not milk, and milk mixed with water is not water.

original: ci ste bum pa ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan yin na ni gzhan la gzhan nyid dang ldan pa btsal ci dgos /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan yin na ni gzhan la gzhan nyid dang ldan pa btsal ci dgos /
translated: But if the pot is different by its very nature, then what need is there to seek difference in that which is already different?

original: de lta bas na de gzhan nyid dang ldan pas gzhan du 'gyur zhes bya ba dang / gzhan nyid gzhan la nges par gnas so zhes bya ba de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de gzhan nyid dang ldan pas gzhan du 'gyur zhes bya ba dang / gzhan nyid gzhan la nges par gnas so zhes bya ba de ni gyi na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is untenable to say, “It becomes different through possessing difference” and “Difference definitely abides in that which is different.”

original: smras pa / gzhan nyid gzhan la nges par gnas kyang rung mi gnas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan nyid gzhan la nges par gnas kyang rung mi gnas kyang rung ste /
translated: Objection: Even if difference definitely exists in another, or does not exist,

original: don gang la gzhan nyid du 'dod pa'i gzhan de ni re zhig yod do //
analyzed: don gang la gzhan nyid du 'dod pa'i gzhan de ni re zhig yod do //
translated: the other that is asserted as different exists.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod 'jig rten rgyug par rtsom mam //
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod 'jig rten rgyug par rtsom mam //
translated: Response: Do you intend to run around in circles?

original: khyod gzhan nyid med pas gzhan bsgrub par rtsom ko //
analyzed: khyod gzhan nyid med pas gzhan bsgrub par rtsom ko //
translated: You intend to establish difference without difference.

original: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Difference does not exist.

original: gzhan nam de nyid yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan nam de nyid yod ma yin //
translated: Neither difference nor sameness exist.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na gzhan nam de nyid med do zhes bstan pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na gzhan nam de nyid med do zhes bstan pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: Haven’t we already demonstrated that if the difference of another does not exist, neither difference nor sameness exist?

original: ci ste gzhan gyi dngos po med par yang gzhan du 'gyur na ni khyod la glen pa'i dngos po med par yang glen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gyi dngos po med par yang gzhan du 'gyur na ni khyod la glen pa'i dngos po med par yang glen par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if difference occurs without the difference of another, then you would be a fool without the difference of a fool.

original: ci ste de mi 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste de mi 'dod na /
translated: But if you do not accept that,

original: 'o na ni gzhan gyi dngos po med par gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni gzhan gyi dngos po med par gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then difference does not occur without the difference of another.

original: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na dngos po thams cad la gzhan nyid ji ltar yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na dngos po thams cad la gzhan nyid ji ltar yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, when examined in this way, otherness is not tenable in any way for all things.

original: gzhan nyid med na blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ji ltar phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par gyur /
analyzed: gzhan nyid med na blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ji ltar phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par gyur /
translated: If otherness does not exist, how could objects of sight and so on and attachment and so on come into contact with each other?

original: phrad pa med na khyod kyi phrad pa'i gtan tshigs las byung ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: phrad pa med na khyod kyi phrad pa'i gtan tshigs las byung ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If they do not come into contact, how could the intrinsic reality of things that arises from the reason of contact be tenable?

original: ci ste yang khyod kyi @223a * //🔽yid la bsam pas gzhan yang yin la /
analyzed: ci ste yang khyod kyi @223a * // yid la bsam pas gzhan yang yin la /
translated: But if you think,🔽“It is other and it is that very thing,”

original: de nyid kyang yin no snyam du sems na de lta na yang phrad pa mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyang yin no snyam du sems na de lta na yang phrad pa mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: even so, contact is untenable.🔽Why?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: de ni de dang phrad pa med //
analyzed: de ni de dang phrad pa med //
translated: that does not come into contact with itself.

original: gzhan dang gzhan yang phrad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan yang phrad mi 'gyur //
translated: Nor does one thing come into contact with another.

original: de la re zhig de nyid ni de dang phrad par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de la re zhig de nyid ni de dang phrad par mi 'thad de /
translated: First, that very thing does not come into contact with itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de tsam du zad pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig gi don du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam du zad pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig gi don du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is just that, and because the meaning of “together” is not tenable.

original: ci ste de lta na yang 'gyur na ni ci yang mi phrad par mi 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ci ste de lta na yang 'gyur na ni ci yang mi phrad par mi 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: But if it were to occur in that way, then nothing would not make contact. Therefore, that is unacceptable.

original: de lta bas na de nyid dang phrad par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de nyid dang phrad par mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, contact with that is not tenable.

original: de ni gang la 'di ni gzhan no 'di yang gzhan no zhes bya ba ste yod pa de la yang phrad par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni gang la 'di ni gzhan no 'di yang gzhan no zhes bya ba ste yod pa de la yang phrad par mi 'thad do //
translated: And it is not tenable that contact occurs with that which exists, with respect to which one can say, “This is different” and “That is different.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan nyid yin pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being different.

original: ci ste gzhan nyid yin pa yang phrad na ni de lta na ci yang mi phrad par mi 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan nyid yin pa yang phrad na ni de lta na ci yang mi phrad par mi 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: But if it were to occur with that which is different, then in that case nothing would not make contact. Therefore, that is unacceptable.
